35 /* Prototypes for Lapack functions, if MKL or LAPACK is used. */
36 #if defined (HAVE_MKL) || defined(HAVE_LAPACK)
37 extern "C" void dpotrf_(char *, int*, passivedouble*, int*, int*);
38 extern "C" void dpotri_(char *, int*, passivedouble*, int*, int*);
39 #endif

41 bool CLong3T::operator<(const CLong3T &other) const {
42  if(long0 != other.long0) return (long0 < other.long0);
43  if(long1 != other.long1) return (long1 < other.long1);
44  if(long2 != other.long2) return (long2 < other.long2);
45 
46  return false;
47 }
48 
49 void CLong3T::Copy(const CLong3T &other) {
50  long0 = other.long0;
51  long1 = other.long1;
52  long2 = other.long2;
53 }
54 
55 CReorderElements::CReorderElements(const unsigned long val_GlobalElemID,
56  const unsigned short val_TimeLevel,
57  const bool val_CommSolution,
58  const unsigned short val_VTK_Type,
59  const unsigned short val_nPolySol,
60  const bool val_JacConstant) {
61 
62  /* Copy the global elment ID, time level and whether or not this element
63  must be communicated. */
64  globalElemID = val_GlobalElemID;
65  timeLevel = val_TimeLevel;
66  commSolution = val_CommSolution;
67 
68  /* Create the element type used in this class, which stores information of
69  the VTK type, the polynomial degree of the solution and whether or not the
70  Jacobian of the transformation is constant. As it is possible that the
71  polynomial degree of the solution is zero, this convention is different
72  from the convention used in the SU2 grid file. */
73  elemType = val_VTK_Type + 100*val_nPolySol;
74  if( !val_JacConstant ) elemType += 50;
75 }
76 
77 bool CReorderElements::operator< (const CReorderElements &other) const {
78 
79  /* Elements with the lowest time level are stored first. */
80  if(timeLevel != other.timeLevel) return timeLevel < other.timeLevel;
81 
82  /* Next comparison is whether or not the element must communicate its
83  solution data to other ranks. Elements which do not need to do this
84  are stored first. */
85  if(commSolution != other.commSolution) return other.commSolution;
86 
87  /* Elements of the same element type must be stored as contiguously as
88  possible to allow for the simultaneous treatment of elements in the
89  matrix multiplications. */
90  if(elemType != other.elemType) return elemType < other.elemType;
91 
92  /* The final comparison is based on the global element ID. */
93  return globalElemID < other.globalElemID;
94 }
95 
96 void CReorderElements::Copy(const CReorderElements &other) {
97  globalElemID = other.globalElemID;
98  timeLevel = other.timeLevel;
99  commSolution = other.commSolution;
100  elemType = other.elemType;
101 }
102 
103 bool CSortFaces::operator()(const CFaceOfElement &f0,
104  const CFaceOfElement &f1) {
105 
106  /*--- Comparison in case both faces are boundary faces. ---*/
107  if(f0.faceIndicator >= 0 && f1.faceIndicator >= 0) {
108 
109  /* Both faces are boundary faces. The first comparison is the boundary
110  marker, which is stored in faceIndicator. */
111  if(f0.faceIndicator != f1.faceIndicator) return f0.faceIndicator < f1.faceIndicator;
112 
113  /* Both faces belong to the same boundary marker. The second comparison is
114  based on the on the local volume ID's of the adjacent elements. As the
115  volumes are sorted according to the time levels for time accurate
116  local stepping, there is no need to do this check seperately here. */
117  unsigned long ind0 = f0.elemID0 < nVolElemTot ? f0.elemID0 : f0.elemID1;
118  unsigned long ind1 = f1.elemID0 < nVolElemTot ? f1.elemID0 : f1.elemID1;
119 
120  return ind0 < ind1;
121  }
122 
123  /*--- Comparison in case both faces are internal faces. ---*/
124  if(f0.faceIndicator == -1 && f1.faceIndicator == -1) {
125 
126  /* Both faces are internal faces. First determine the minimum and maximum
127  ID of its adjacent elements. */
128  unsigned long elemIDMin0 = min(f0.elemID0, f0.elemID1);
129  unsigned long elemIDMax0 = max(f0.elemID0, f0.elemID1);
130 
131  unsigned long elemIDMin1 = min(f1.elemID0, f1.elemID1);
132  unsigned long elemIDMax1 = max(f1.elemID0, f1.elemID1);
133 
134  /* Determine the situation. */
135  if(elemIDMax0 < nVolElemTot && elemIDMax1 < nVolElemTot) {
136 
137  /* Both faces are matching internal faces. Determine whether or not these
138  faces are local faces, i.e. faces between locally owned elements. */
139  const bool face0IsLocal = elemIDMax0 < nVolElemOwned;
140  const bool face1IsLocal = elemIDMax1 < nVolElemOwned;
141 
142  /* Check if both faces have the same status, i.e. either local or
143  not local. */
144  if(face0IsLocal == face1IsLocal) {
145 
146  /* Both faces are either local or not local. Determine the time level
147  of the faces, which is the minimum value of the adjacent volume
148  elements. */
149  const unsigned short timeLevel0 = min(volElem[elemIDMin0].timeLevel,
150  volElem[elemIDMax0].timeLevel);
151  const unsigned short timeLevel1 = min(volElem[elemIDMin1].timeLevel,
152  volElem[elemIDMax1].timeLevel);
153 
154  /* Internal faces with the same status are first sorted according to
155  their time level. Faces with the smallest time level are numbered
156  first. Note this is only relevant for time accurate local time
157  stepping. */
158  if(timeLevel0 != timeLevel1) return timeLevel0 < timeLevel1;
159 
160  /* The faces belong to the same time level. They are sorted according
161  to their element ID's in order to increase cache performance. */
162  if(elemIDMin0 != elemIDMin1) return elemIDMin0 < elemIDMin1;
163  return elemIDMax0 < elemIDMax1;
164  }
165  else {
166 
167  /* One face is a local face and the other is not. Make sure that
168  the local faces are numbered first. */
169  if( face0IsLocal ) return true;
170  else return false;
171  }
172  }
173  else if(elemIDMax0 >= nVolElemTot && elemIDMax1 >= nVolElemTot) {
174 
175  /* Both faces are non-matching internal faces. Sort them according to
176  their relevant element ID. The time level is not taken into account
177  yet, because non-matching faces are not possible at the moment with
178  time accurate local time stepping. */
179  return elemIDMin0 < elemIDMin1;
180  }
181  else {
182 
183  /* One face is a matching internal face and the other face is a
184  non-matching internal face. Make sure that the non-matching face
185  is numbered after the matching face. This is accomplished by comparing
186  the maximum element ID's. */
187  return elemIDMax0 < elemIDMax1;
188  }
189  }
190 
191  /*--- One face is a boundary face and the other face is an internal face.
192  Make sure that the boundary face is numbered first. This can be
193  accomplished by using the > operator for faceIndicator. ---*/
194  return f0.faceIndicator > f1.faceIndicator;
195 }
196 
197 bool CSortBoundaryFaces::operator()(const CSurfaceElementFEM &f0,
198  const CSurfaceElementFEM &f1) {
199 
200  /* First sorting criterion is the index of the standard element. The
201  boundary faces should be sorted per standard element. Note that the
202  time level is not taken into account here, because it is assumed that
203  the surface elements to be sorted belong to one time level. */
204  if(f0.indStandardElement != f1.indStandardElement)
205  return f0.indStandardElement < f1.indStandardElement;
206 
207  /* The standard elements are the same. The second criterion is the
208  corresponding volume IDs of the surface elements. */
209  return f0.volElemID < f1.volElemID;
210 }
211 
212 void CPointFEM::Copy(const CPointFEM &other) {
213  globalID = other.globalID;
214  periodIndexToDonor = other.periodIndexToDonor;
215  coor[0] = other.coor[0];
216  coor[1] = other.coor[1];
217  coor[2] = other.coor[2];
218 }
219 
220 bool CPointFEM::operator< (const CPointFEM &other) const {
221  if(periodIndexToDonor != other.periodIndexToDonor)
222  return periodIndexToDonor < other.periodIndexToDonor;
223  return globalID < other.globalID;
224  }
225 
226 bool CPointFEM::operator==(const CPointFEM &other) const {
227  return (globalID == other.globalID &&
228  periodIndexToDonor == other.periodIndexToDonor);
229 }
230 
231 void CVolumeElementFEM::GetCornerPointsAllFaces(unsigned short &numFaces,
232  unsigned short nPointsPerFace[],
233  unsigned long faceConn[6][4]) {
234 
235  /*--- Get the corner connectivities of the faces, local to the element. ---*/
236  CPrimalGridFEM::GetLocalCornerPointsAllFaces(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, nDOFsGrid,
237  numFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
238 
239  /*--- Convert the local values of faceConn to global values. ---*/
240  for(unsigned short i=0; i<numFaces; ++i) {
241  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j) {
242  unsigned long nn = faceConn[i][j];
243  faceConn[i][j] = nodeIDsGrid[nn];
244  }
245  }
246 }
247 
248 bool CInternalFaceElementFEM::operator<(const CInternalFaceElementFEM &other) const {
249 
250  /* First comparison is the standard element, such that elements with
251  the same same standard elements are grouped together. */
252  if(indStandardElement != other.indStandardElement)
253  return indStandardElement < other.indStandardElement;
254 
255  /* The second comparison is the element ID on side 0. */
256  if(elemID0 != other.elemID0) return elemID0 < other.elemID0;
257 
258  /* The final comparison is the element ID on side 1. */
259  return elemID1 < other.elemID1;
260 }
261 
262 void CInternalFaceElementFEM::Copy(const CInternalFaceElementFEM &other) {
263 
264  VTK_Type = other.VTK_Type;
265  indStandardElement = other.indStandardElement;
266 
267  elemID0 = other.elemID0;
268  elemID1 = other.elemID1;
269 
270  DOFsGridFaceSide0 = other.DOFsGridFaceSide0;
271  DOFsGridFaceSide1 = other.DOFsGridFaceSide1;
272  DOFsSolFaceSide0 = other.DOFsSolFaceSide0;
273  DOFsSolFaceSide1 = other.DOFsSolFaceSide1;
274 
275  DOFsGridElementSide0 = other.DOFsGridElementSide0;
276  DOFsGridElementSide1 = other.DOFsGridElementSide1;
277  DOFsSolElementSide0 = other.DOFsSolElementSide0;
278  DOFsSolElementSide1 = other.DOFsSolElementSide1;
279 
280  metricNormalsFace = other.metricNormalsFace;
281  metricCoorDerivFace0 = other.metricCoorDerivFace0;
282  metricCoorDerivFace1 = other.metricCoorDerivFace1;
283 
284  coorIntegrationPoints = other.coorIntegrationPoints;
285  gridVelocities = other.gridVelocities;
286  wallDistance = other.wallDistance;
287 }
288 
289 void CSurfaceElementFEM::GetCornerPointsFace(unsigned short &nPointsPerFace,
290  unsigned long faceConn[]) {
291 
292  /*--- Get the corner connectivities of the face, local to the element. ---*/
293  CPrimalGridBoundFEM::GetLocalCornerPointsFace(VTK_Type, nPolyGrid, nDOFsGrid,
294  nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
295 
296  /*--- Convert the local values of faceConn to global values. ---*/
297  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nPointsPerFace; ++j) {
298  unsigned long nn = faceConn[j];
299  faceConn[j] = nodeIDsGrid[nn];
300  }
301 }
302 
303 void CSurfaceElementFEM::Copy(const CSurfaceElementFEM &other) {
304  VTK_Type = other.VTK_Type;
305  nPolyGrid = other.nPolyGrid;
306  nDOFsGrid = other.nDOFsGrid;
307  indStandardElement = other.indStandardElement;
308  volElemID = other.volElemID;
309  boundElemIDGlobal = other.boundElemIDGlobal;
310  nodeIDsGrid = other.nodeIDsGrid;
311 
312  DOFsGridFace = other.DOFsGridFace;
313  DOFsSolFace = other.DOFsSolFace;
314  DOFsGridElement = other.DOFsGridElement;
315  DOFsSolElement = other.DOFsSolElement;
316 
317  metricNormalsFace = other.metricNormalsFace;
318  metricCoorDerivFace = other.metricCoorDerivFace;
319  coorIntegrationPoints = other.coorIntegrationPoints;
320  gridVelocities = other.gridVelocities;
321  wallDistance = other.wallDistance;
322 
323  donorsWallFunction = other.donorsWallFunction;
324  nIntPerWallFunctionDonor = other.nIntPerWallFunctionDonor;
325  intPerWallFunctionDonor = other.intPerWallFunctionDonor;
326  matWallFunctionDonor = other.matWallFunctionDonor;
327 }
328 
329 CMeshFEM::CMeshFEM(CGeometry *geometry, CConfig *config) {
330 
331  /*--- Allocate the memory for blasFunctions. ---*/
332  blasFunctions = new CBlasStructure;
333 
334  /*--- The new FEM mesh class has the same problem dimension/zone. ---*/
335  nDim = geometry->GetnDim();
336  nZone = geometry->GetnZone();
337 
338  /*--- Determine the number of variables stored per DOF. ---*/
339  /*--- This is specifically taylored towards perfect gas computations ---*/
340  /*--- and must be generalized later. As this number is also needed ---*/
341  /*--- in the solver, it is worthwhile to create a separate function ---*/
342  /*--- for this purpose. ---*/
343  const bool compressible = (config->GetKind_Regime() == COMPRESSIBLE);
344 
345  unsigned short nVar;
346  if( compressible ) nVar = nDim + 2;
347  else nVar = nDim + 1;
348 
349  /*--- Determine a mapping from the global point ID to the local index
350  of the points. ---*/
351  map<unsigned long,unsigned long> globalPointIDToLocalInd;
352  for(unsigned long i=0; i<geometry->GetnPoint(); ++i)
353  globalPointIDToLocalInd[geometry->node[i]->GetGlobalIndex()] = i;
354 
355  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
356  /*--- Step 1: Communicate the elements and the boundary elements to the ---*/
357  /*--- ranks where they will be stored during the computation. ---*/
358  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
359 
360  /*--- Determine the ranks to which I have to send my elements. ---*/
361  vector<int> sendToRank(size, 0);
362 
363  for(unsigned long i=0; i<geometry->GetnElem(); ++i) {
364  sendToRank[geometry->elem[i]->GetColor()] = 1;
365  }
366 
367  map<int,int> rankToIndCommBuf;
368  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
369  if( sendToRank[i] ) {
370  int ind = rankToIndCommBuf.size();
371  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
372  }
373  }
374 
375  /*--- Definition of the communication buffers, used to send the element data
376  to the correct ranks. ---*/
377  int nRankSend = rankToIndCommBuf.size();
378  vector<vector<short> > shortSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<short>(0));
379  vector<vector<long> > longSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<long>(0));
380  vector<vector<su2double> > doubleSendBuf(nRankSend, vector<su2double>(0));
381 
382  /*--- The first element of longSendBuf will contain the number of elements, which
383  are stored in the communication buffers. Initialize this value to 0. ---*/
384  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) longSendBuf[i].push_back(0);
385 
386  /*--- Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. ---*/
387  int nRankRecv = nRankSend;
388 
389 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
390  vector<int> sizeRecv(size, 1);
391 
392  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(),
393  MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
394 #endif
395 
396  /*--- Loop over the local elements to fill the communication buffers with element data. ---*/
397  for(unsigned long i=0; i<geometry->GetnElem(); ++i) {
398  int ind = geometry->elem[i]->GetColor();
399  map<int,int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find(ind);
400  ind = MI->second;
401 
402  ++longSendBuf[ind][0]; /* The number of elements in the buffers must be incremented. */
403 
404  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetVTK_Type());
405  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNPolyGrid());
406  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNPolySol());
407  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsGrid());
408  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsSol());
409  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces());
410  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetTimeLevel());
411  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back( (short) geometry->elem[i]->GetJacobianConsideredConstant());
412 
413  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetGlobalElemID());
414  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetGlobalOffsetDOFsSol());
415 
416  for(unsigned short j=0; j<geometry->elem[i]->GetNDOFsGrid(); ++j)
417  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNode(j));
418 
419  for(unsigned short j=0; j<geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces(); ++j)
420  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetNeighbor_Elements(j));
421 
422  for(unsigned short j=0; j<geometry->elem[i]->GetnFaces(); ++j) {
423  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetPeriodicIndex(j));
424  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back( (short) geometry->elem[i]->GetJacobianConstantFace(j));
425  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back( (short) geometry->elem[i]->GetOwnerFace(j));
426  }
427 
428  doubleSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->elem[i]->GetLengthScale());
429  }
430 
431  /*--- Determine for each rank to which I have to send elements the data of
432  the corresponding nodes. ---*/
433  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
434 
435  /*--- Determine the vector with node IDs in the connectivity
436  of the elements for this rank. ---*/
437  vector<long> nodeIDs;
438 
439  unsigned long indL = 3;
440  unsigned long indS = 3;
441  for(long j=0; j<longSendBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
442  short nDOFsGrid = shortSendBuf[i][indS], nFaces = shortSendBuf[i][indS+2];
443  indS += 3*nFaces+8;
444 
445  for(short k=0; k<nDOFsGrid; ++k, ++indL)
446  nodeIDs.push_back(longSendBuf[i][indL]);
447  indL += nFaces+2;
448  }
449 
450  /*--- Sort nodeIDs in increasing order and remove the double entities. ---*/
451  sort(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
452  vector<long>::iterator lastNodeID = unique(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
453  nodeIDs.erase(lastNodeID, nodeIDs.end());
454 
455  /*--- Add the number of node IDs and the node IDs itself to longSendBuf[i]. ---*/
456  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs.size());
457  longSendBuf[i].insert(longSendBuf[i].end(), nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
458 
459  /*--- Copy the coordinates to doubleSendBuf. ---*/
460  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
461  map<unsigned long,unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
462  LMI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeIDs[j]);
463 
464  if(LMI == globalPointIDToLocalInd.end())
465  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in map", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
466 
467  unsigned long ind = LMI->second;
468  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nDim; ++l)
469  doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(geometry->node[ind]->GetCoord(l));
470  }
471  }
472 
473  /*--- Loop over the boundaries to send the boundary data to the appropriate rank. ---*/
474  nMarker = geometry->GetnMarker();
475  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
476 
477  /* Store the current indices in the longSendBuf, which are used to store the
478  number of boundary elements sent to this rank. Initialize this value to 0. */
479  vector<long> indLongBuf(nRankSend);
480  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
481  indLongBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i].size();
482  longSendBuf[i].push_back(0);
483  }
484 
485  /* Loop over the local boundary elements in geometry for this marker. */
486  for(unsigned long i=0; i<geometry->GetnElem_Bound(iMarker); ++i) {
487 
488  /* Determine the local ID of the corresponding domain element. */
489  unsigned long elemID = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDomainElement()
490  - geometry->starting_node[rank];
491 
492  /* Determine to which rank this boundary element must be sent.
493  That is the same as its corresponding domain element.
494  Update the corresponding index in longSendBuf. */
495  int ind = geometry->elem[elemID]->GetColor();
496  map<int,int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find(ind);
497  ind = MI->second;
498 
499  ++longSendBuf[ind][indLongBuf[ind]];
500 
501  /* Get the donor information for the wall function treatment. */
502  const unsigned short nDonors = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDonorsWallFunctions();
503  const unsigned long *donors = geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDonorsWallFunctions();
504 
505  /* Store the data for this boundary element in the communication buffers. */
506  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetVTK_Type());
507  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNPolyGrid());
508  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDOFsGrid());
509  shortSendBuf[ind].push_back(nDonors);
510 
511  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetDomainElement());
512  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetGlobalElemID());
513 
514  for(unsigned short j=0; j<geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNDOFsGrid(); ++j)
515  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(geometry->bound[iMarker][i]->GetNode(j));
516 
517  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDonors; ++j)
518  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(donors[j]);
519  }
520  }
521 
522  /*--- Definition of the communication buffers, used to receive
523  the element data from the other correct ranks. ---*/
524  vector<vector<short> > shortRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<short>(0));
525  vector<vector<long> > longRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<long>(0));
526  vector<vector<su2double> > doubleRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<su2double>(0));
527 
528  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
529  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
530  map<int,int>::const_iterator MI;
531 
532 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
533 
534  /*--- Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. ---*/
535  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> commReqs(3*nRankSend);
536  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
537 
538  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
539 
540  int dest = MI->first;
541  SU2_MPI::Isend(shortSendBuf[i].data(), shortSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_SHORT,
542  dest, dest, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[3*i]);
543  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
544  dest, dest+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[3*i+1]);
545  SU2_MPI::Isend(doubleSendBuf[i].data(), doubleSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
546  dest, dest+2, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[3*i+2]);
547  }
548 
549  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
550  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
551 
552  /* Block until a message with shorts arrives from any processor.
553  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
554  SU2_MPI::Status status;
555  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
556  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
557 
558  int sizeMess;
559  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_SHORT, &sizeMess);
560 
561  /* Allocate the memory for the short receive buffer and receive the message. */
562  shortRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
563  SU2_MPI::Recv(shortRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_SHORT,
564  source, rank, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
565 
566  /* Block until the corresponding message with longs arrives, determine
567  its size, allocate the memory and receive the message. */
568  SU2_MPI::Probe(source, rank+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
569  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
570  longRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
571 
572  SU2_MPI::Recv(longRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
573  source, rank+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
574 
575  /* Idem for the message with doubles. */
576  SU2_MPI::Probe(source, rank+2, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
577  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_DOUBLE, &sizeMess);
578  doubleRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
579 
580  SU2_MPI::Recv(doubleRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_DOUBLE,
581  source, rank+2, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
582  }
583 
584  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
585  SU2_MPI::Waitall(3*nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
586 
587  /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
588  so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
589  SU2_MPI::Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
590 
591 #else
592 
593  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffers. ---*/
594  shortRecvBuf[0] = shortSendBuf[0];
595  longRecvBuf[0] = longSendBuf[0];
596  doubleRecvBuf[0] = doubleSendBuf[0];
597 
598 #endif
599 
600  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
601  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
602  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
603  vector<short>().swap(shortSendBuf[i]);
604  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
605  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleSendBuf[i]);
606  }
607 
608  /*--- Allocate the memory for the number of elements for every boundary
609  marker and initialize them to zero. ---*/
610  nElem_Bound = new unsigned long[nMarker];
611  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nMarker; ++i)
612  nElem_Bound[i] = 0;
613 
614  /*--- Determine the global element ID's of the elements stored on this rank.
615  Sort them in increasing order, such that an easy search can be done.
616  In the same loop determine the upper bound for the local nodes (without
617  halos) and the number of boundary elements for every marker. ---*/
618  nElem = nPoint = 0;
619  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) nElem += longRecvBuf[i][0];
620 
621  vector<unsigned long> globalElemID;
622  globalElemID.reserve(nElem);
623 
624  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
625  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
626  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
627  globalElemID.push_back(longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
628 
629  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
630  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+5];
631  indS += 3*nFaces + 8;
632  indL += nDOFsGrid + nFaces + 2;
633  }
634 
635  long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
636  nPoint += nNodesThisRank;
637  indL += nNodesThisRank+1;
638 
639  for(unsigned iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
640  long nBoundElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL]; ++indL;
641  nElem_Bound[iMarker] += nBoundElemThisRank;
642 
643  for(long j=0; j<nBoundElemThisRank; ++j) {
644  short nDOFsBoundElem = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+2];
645  short nDonorsWallFunction = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
646  indS += 4;
647  indL += nDOFsBoundElem + nDonorsWallFunction + 2;
648  }
649  }
650  }
651 
652  sort(globalElemID.begin(), globalElemID.end());
653 
654  /*--- Determine the global element ID's of the halo elements. A vector of
655  CUnsignedLong2T is used for this purpose, such that a possible periodic
656  transformation can be taken into account. Neighbors with a periodic
657  transformation will always become a halo element, even if the element
658  is stored on this rank. Furthermore a vector of CReorderElements
659  is created for the owned elements to be able to reorder the elements,
660  see step 2 below. ---*/
661  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> haloElements;
662  vector<CReorderElements> ownedElements;
663  unsigned short maxTimeLevelLoc = 0;
664 
665  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
666  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
667  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
668  unsigned long globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
669  unsigned short VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS];
670  unsigned short nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+2];
671  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
672  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+5];
673  unsigned short timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+6];
674  bool JacConstant = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS+7];
675  bool commSol = false;
676 
677  /* If the integration rule for constant and non-constant Jacobian
678  elements is the same, simply set JacConstant to false, such that
679  the elements with constant and non-constant Jacobians are
680  considered the same. */
681  if( JacConstant ) {
682  const unsigned short orderExactStraight =
683  (unsigned short) ceil(nPolySol*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
684  const unsigned short orderExactCurved =
685  (unsigned short) ceil(nPolySol*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
686  if(orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved) JacConstant = false;
687  }
688 
689  /* Update the local value of the maximum time level. */
690  maxTimeLevelLoc = max(maxTimeLevelLoc, timeLevel);
691 
692  /*--- Loop over the faces of this element to determine the halo elements
693  and the information needed to reorder the owned elements. ---*/
694  indS += 8;
695  indL += nDOFsGrid + 2;
696  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nFaces; ++k, indS+=3, ++indL) {
697 
698  if(longRecvBuf[i][indL] != -1) { /* -1 indicates a boundary face. */
699 
700  /* Check if the neighbor of the face is also an owned element.
701  Per definition an element for which a periodic transformation
702  is carried out, is a halo element, even if the parent element
703  is stored locally. */
704  bool neighborIsInternal = false;
705  if(shortRecvBuf[i][indS] == -1) { /* -1 indicates no periodic transformation. */
706  neighborIsInternal = binary_search(globalElemID.begin(),
707  globalElemID.end(),
708  longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
709  }
710 
711  /* Check if this neighbor is not internal and if the element owns the face. */
712  if( !neighborIsInternal ) {
713  if( shortRecvBuf[i][indS+2] ) {
714 
715  /* The face is owned by this element. As the neighboring element
716  is not owned, this implies that a halo element must be created. */
717  haloElements.push_back(CUnsignedLong2T(longRecvBuf[i][indL],
718  shortRecvBuf[i][indS]+1)); /* The +1, because haloElements */
719  } /* are unsigned longs. */
720  else {
721 
722  /* The face is not owned by this element and therefore it is owned
723  by the neighboring element on a different rank. Consequently the
724  solution of this element must be communicated. */
725  commSol = true;
726  }
727  }
728  }
729  }
730 
731  /* Store the required data for this element in ownedElements. */
732  ownedElements.push_back(CReorderElements(globalID, timeLevel, commSol,
733  VTK_Type, nPolySol, JacConstant));
734  }
735 
736  /* Skip the part with the node numbers. */
737  long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
738  indL += nNodesThisRank+1;
739 
740  /* Loop over the boundary markers. */
741  for(unsigned iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
742  long nBoundElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL]; ++indL;
743 
744  /* Loop over the boundary elements coming from this rank. */
745  for(long j=0; j<nBoundElemThisRank; ++j) {
746  short nDOFsBoundElem = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+2];
747  short nDonorsWallFunctions = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
748  indS += 4;
749  indL += nDOFsBoundElem + 2;
750 
751  /* Loop over the donors for the wall functions. */
752  for(short k=0; k<nDonorsWallFunctions; ++k, ++indL) {
753 
754  /* Check for an external donor. If external, store it in
755  haloElements with no periodic transformation. */
756  if( !binary_search(globalElemID.begin(), globalElemID.end(),
757  longRecvBuf[i][indL]) )
758  haloElements.push_back(CUnsignedLong2T(longRecvBuf[i][indL], 0));
759  }
760  }
761  }
762  }
763 
764  /* Sort the halo elements in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
765  sort(haloElements.begin(), haloElements.end());
766  vector<CUnsignedLong2T>::iterator lastHalo = unique(haloElements.begin(), haloElements.end());
767  haloElements.erase(lastHalo, haloElements.end());
768 
769  /* Determine the maximum global time level and possibly reset the number
770  of time levels in config. */
771  unsigned short maxTimeLevelGlob = maxTimeLevelLoc;
772 
773 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
774  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&maxTimeLevelLoc, &maxTimeLevelGlob,
775  1, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MPI_MAX, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
776 #endif
777 
778  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = maxTimeLevelGlob+1;
779  config->SetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS(nTimeLevels);
780 
781  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
782  /*--- Step 2: Find out on which rank the halo elements are stored. ---*/
783  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
784 
785  /* Determine the number of owned elements and the total number of
786  elements stored on this rank. */
787  nVolElemOwned = globalElemID.size();
788  nVolElemTot = nVolElemOwned + haloElements.size();
789 
790  /* Determine the map from the global element ID to the current storage
791  sequence of ownedElements. */
792  map<unsigned long, unsigned long> mapGlobalElemIDToInd;
793  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
794  mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = i;
795 
796  /* Determine the number of elements per rank of the originally partitioned grid
797  stored in cumulative storage format. */
798  vector<unsigned long> nElemPerRankOr(size+1);
799 
800  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) nElemPerRankOr[i] = geometry->starting_node[i];
801  nElemPerRankOr[size] = geometry->ending_node[size-1];
802 
803  /* Determine to which ranks I have to send messages to find out the information
804  of the halos stored on this rank. */
805  sendToRank.assign(size, 0);
806 
807  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloElements.size(); ++i) {
808 
809  /* Determine the rank where this halo element was originally stored. */
810  vector<unsigned long>::iterator low;
811  low = lower_bound(nElemPerRankOr.begin(), nElemPerRankOr.end(),
812  haloElements[i].long0);
813  unsigned long rankHalo = low - nElemPerRankOr.begin();
814  if(*low > haloElements[i].long0) --rankHalo;
815 
816  sendToRank[rankHalo] = 1;
817  }
818 
819  rankToIndCommBuf.clear();
820  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
821  if( sendToRank[i] ) {
822  int ind = rankToIndCommBuf.size();
823  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
824  }
825  }
826 
827  /* Resize the first index of the long send buffers for the communication of
828  the halo data. */
829  nRankSend = rankToIndCommBuf.size();
830  longSendBuf.resize(nRankSend);
831 
832  /* Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. */
833  nRankRecv = nRankSend;
834 
835 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
836  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(),
837  MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
838 #endif
839 
840  /* Loop over the local halo elements to fill the communication buffers. */
841  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloElements.size(); ++i) {
842 
843  /* Determine the rank where this halo element was originally stored. */
844  vector<unsigned long>::iterator low;
845  low = lower_bound(nElemPerRankOr.begin(), nElemPerRankOr.end(),
846  haloElements[i].long0);
847  unsigned long ind = low - nElemPerRankOr.begin();
848  if(*low > haloElements[i].long0) --ind;
849 
850  /* Convert this rank to the index in the send buffer. */
851  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.find(ind);
852  ind = MI->second;
853 
854  /* Store the global element ID and the periodic index in the long buffer.
855  The subtraction of 1 is there to obtain the correct periodic index.
856  In haloElements a +1 is added, because this variable is of unsigned long,
857  which cannot handle negative numbers. */
858  long perIndex = haloElements[i].long1 -1;
859 
860  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(haloElements[i].long0);
861  longSendBuf[ind].push_back(perIndex);
862  }
863 
864  /* Define a second set of long receive buffers, because the information from
865  the first set is still needed later on. Also define the vector to
866  store the ranks from which the message came. */
867  vector<vector<long> > longSecondRecvBuf(nRankRecv, vector<long>(0));
868  vector<int> sourceRank(nRankRecv);
869 
870  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
871  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
872 
873 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
874 
875  /* Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. */
876  commReqs.resize(nRankSend);
877  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
878 
879  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
880  int dest = MI->first;
881  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
882  dest, dest, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[i]);
883  }
884 
885  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
886  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
887 
888  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
889  Determine the source and the size of the message and receive it. */
890  SU2_MPI::Status status;
891  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
892  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
893 
894  int sizeMess;
895  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
896 
897  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
898  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
899  sourceRank[i], rank, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
900  }
901 
902  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
903  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
904 
905 #else
906 
907  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
908  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i)
909  longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
910 
911 #endif
912 
913  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all the memory
914  is deleted, the swap function is used. Afterwards resize the first index
915  of the send buffers to nRankRecv, because this number of messages must
916  be sent back to the sending ranks with halo information. ---*/
917  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
918  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
919  }
920 
921  longSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
922 
923 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
924  /* Resize the vector of the communication requests to the number of messages
925  to be sent by this rank. Only in parallel node. */
926  commReqs.resize(nRankRecv);
927 #endif
928 
929  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to fill and send the send buffers again. ---*/
930  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
931 
932  /* Determine the number of elements present in longSecondRecvBuf[i] and
933  reserve the memory for the send buffer. */
934  const long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size()/2;
935  longSendBuf[i].reserve(3*nElemBuf);
936 
937  /* Loop over the elements stored in the receive buffer. */
938  for(long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
939 
940  /* Get the global element ID and periodic index from the receive buffer. */
941  const long globalID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2*j];
942  const long perInd = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2*j+1];
943 
944  /* Determine the local index of the element in the original partitioning.
945  Check if the index is valid. */
946  const long localID = globalID - geometry->starting_node[rank];
947  if(localID < 0 || localID >= (long) geometry->npoint_procs[rank]) {
948  ostringstream message;
949  message << localID << " " << geometry->npoint_procs[rank] << endl;
950  message << "Invalid local element ID";
951  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
952  }
953 
954  /* Determine which rank owns this element and store everything in the
955  send buffer. */
956  longSendBuf[i].push_back(globalID);
957  longSendBuf[i].push_back(perInd);
958  longSendBuf[i].push_back(geometry->elem[localID]->GetColor());
959  }
960 
961  /* Release the memory of this receive buffer. */
962  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
963 
964  /*--- Send the send buffer back to the calling rank.
965  Only in parallel mode of course. ---*/
966 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
967  int dest = sourceRank[i];
968  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
969  dest, dest+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[i]);
970 #endif
971  }
972 
973  /*--- Resize the first index of the receive buffers to nRankSend, such that
974  the requested halo information can be received. ---*/
975  longSecondRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
976 
977  /*--- Receive the communication data from the correct ranks. Make a distinction
978  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
979 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
980 
981  /* Parallel mode. Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data
982  in the return communication, i.e. nRankSend. */
983  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
984 
985  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
986  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
987  SU2_MPI::Status status;
988  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
989  int source = status.MPI_SOURCE;
990 
991  int sizeMess;
992  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
993 
994  /* Allocate the memory for the long receive buffer and receive the message. */
995  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
996  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
997  source, rank+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
998  }
999 
1000  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the ranks, because
1001  wild cards have been used. */
1002  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankRecv, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1003  SU2_MPI::Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
1004 
1005 #else
1006 
1007  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
1008  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i)
1009  longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
1010 
1011 #endif
1012 
1013  /* Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
1014  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. */
1015  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i)
1016  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
1017 
1018  /* Copy the data from the receive buffers into a class of CLong3T, such that
1019  it can be sorted in increasing order. Note that the rank of the element
1020  is stored first, followed by its global ID and last the periodic index. */
1021  vector<CLong3T> haloData;
1022  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1023  const long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size()/3;
1024 
1025  for(long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
1026  const long j3 = 3*j;
1027  haloData.push_back(CLong3T(longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3+2], longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3],
1028  longSecondRecvBuf[i][j3+1]));
1029  }
1030 
1031  /* Release the memory of this receive buffer. */
1032  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
1033  }
1034 
1035  /* Sort halo data in increasing order. */
1036  sort(haloData.begin(), haloData.end());
1037 
1038  /* Determine the number of halo elements per rank in cumulative storage.
1039  The first element of this vector is nVolElemOwned, such that this vector
1040  contains the starting position in the vector volElem. */
1041  vector<unsigned long> nHaloElemPerRank(size+1, 0);
1042  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloData.size(); ++i)
1043  ++nHaloElemPerRank[haloData[i].long0+1];
1044 
1045  nHaloElemPerRank[0] = nVolElemOwned;
1046  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i)
1047  nHaloElemPerRank[i+1] += nHaloElemPerRank[i];
1048 
1049  if(nHaloElemPerRank[size] != nVolElemTot)
1050  SU2_MPI::Error("Inconsistency in total number of volume elements",
1051  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1052 
1053  /* Determine the number of ranks to which I have to send data in this cycle. */
1054  sendToRank.assign(size, 0);
1055  rankToIndCommBuf.clear();
1056  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
1057  if(nHaloElemPerRank[i+1] > nHaloElemPerRank[i]) {
1058  sendToRank[i] = 1;
1059  int ind = rankToIndCommBuf.size();
1060  rankToIndCommBuf[i] = ind;
1061  }
1062  }
1063 
1064  nRankSend = rankToIndCommBuf.size();
1065 
1066  /* Store the value of nRankSend for later use. */
1067  const int nRankSendHaloInfo = nRankSend;
1068 
1069  /* Determine the number of ranks, from which this rank will receive elements. */
1070  nRankRecv = nRankSend;
1071 
1072 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1073  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(sendToRank.data(), &nRankRecv, sizeRecv.data(),
1074  MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
1075 #endif
1076 
1077  /* Copy the data to be sent to the send buffers. */
1078  longSendBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1079  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
1080 
1081  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
1082  int dest = MI->first;
1083  for(unsigned long j=nHaloElemPerRank[dest]; j<nHaloElemPerRank[dest+1]; ++j) {
1084  const unsigned long jj = j - nVolElemOwned;
1085  longSendBuf[i].push_back(haloData[jj].long1);
1086  longSendBuf[i].push_back(haloData[jj].long2);
1087  }
1088  }
1089 
1090  /* Resize the first index of the long receive buffer. */
1091  longSecondRecvBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1092 
1093  /*--- Communicate the data to the correct ranks. Make a distinction
1094  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
1095 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1096 
1097  /* Parallel mode. Send all the data using non-blocking sends. */
1098  commReqs.resize(nRankSend);
1099  MI = rankToIndCommBuf.begin();
1100 
1101  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i, ++MI) {
1102  int dest = MI->first;
1103  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
1104  dest, dest, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[i]);
1105  }
1106 
1107  /* Resize the vector to store the ranks from which the message came. */
1108  sourceRank.resize(nRankRecv);
1109 
1110  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data. */
1111  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1112 
1113  /* Block until a message with longs arrives from any processor.
1114  Determine the source and the size of the message and receive it. */
1115  SU2_MPI::Status status;
1116  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
1117  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1118 
1119  int sizeMess;
1120  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
1121 
1122  longSecondRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1123  SU2_MPI::Recv(longSecondRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
1124  sourceRank[i], rank, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
1125  }
1126 
1127  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the ranks,
1128  because wild cards have been used. */
1129  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRankSend, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1130  SU2_MPI::Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
1131 
1132 #else
1133 
1134  /*--- Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffer, if present at all. ---*/
1135  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i)
1136  longSecondRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
1137 
1138 #endif
1139 
1140  /* Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all the memory
1141  is deleted, the swap function is used. */
1142  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1143  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
1144  }
1145 
1146  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to flag the locally owned elements for
1147  communication. Although the face information has already been used to
1148  do this when ownedElements are constructed, elements that are donors
1149  for the wall function treatment and are not direct neighbors may
1150  have been missed. ---*/
1151  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1152 
1153  const unsigned long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size()/2;
1154  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
1155  const unsigned long elemID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][2*j];
1156 
1157  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1158  if(MMI == mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end())
1159  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapGlobalElemIDToInd", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1160 
1161  ownedElements[MMI->second].SetCommSolution(true);
1162  }
1163  }
1164 
1165  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1166  /*--- Step 3: Determine the numbering of the owned elements. The following ---*/
1167  /*--- criteria are used for the owned elements. ---*/
1168  /*--- - Time level of the element: elements with the smallest time ---*/
1169  /*--- level are number first, etc. ---*/
1170  /*--- - For each time level the elements that do not need to send ---*/
1171  /*--- their data are numbered first, followed by the elements ---*/
1172  /*--- that must send their data to other ranks. Note that not ---*/
1173  /*--- sending the solution does not mean that the residual can ---*/
1174  /*--- be built without communication. It is possible that a face ---*/
1175  /*--- is owned by a local element, but it is adjacent to an ---*/
1176  /*--- element owned by a different rank. In that case the data ---*/
1177  /*--- from the neighboring element is communicated and stored in ---*/
1178  /*--- a halo element. However, the residual of these internal ---*/
1179  /*--- elements do not receive a contribution computed on a ---*/
1180  /*--- different rank. ---*/
1181  /*--- - Some of the elements that do not need to send their data ---*/
1182  /*--- to other ranks may still be put in that part to increase ---*/
1183  /*--- the efficiency when treating element simultaneously, see ---*/
1184  /*--- next point. ---*/
1185  /*--- - Elements of the same type are put contiguously in memory ---*/
1186  /*--- as much as possible to facilitate the simultaneous ---*/
1187  /*--- treatment in the matrix multiplications to increase ---*/
1188  /*--- performance. ---*/
1189  /*--- - A reverse Cuthill McKee renumbering takes place to obtain ---*/
1190  /*--- better cache performance for the face residuals. ---*/
1191  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1192 
1193  /* Determine the number of elements/faces that are treated simultaneously */
1194  /* in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
1195  const unsigned short nElemSimul = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding()/nVar;
1196 
1197  /* Determine the number of different element types present. */
1198  map<unsigned short, unsigned short> mapElemTypeToInd;
1199  for(vector<CReorderElements>::iterator OEI =ownedElements.begin();
1200  OEI!=ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1201  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1202 
1203  if(mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType) == mapElemTypeToInd.end()) {
1204  const unsigned short ind = mapElemTypeToInd.size();
1205  mapElemTypeToInd[elType] = ind;
1206  }
1207  }
1208 
1209  /* Determine the number of elements per element type per time level.
1210  Make a distinction between internal elements (elements that are not
1211  communicated) and elements that are communicated. Later on these vectors
1212  will be put in cumulative storage format, which explains the +1 for
1213  the second index. */
1214  vector<vector<unsigned long> > nInternalElem(nTimeLevels,
1215  vector<unsigned long>(mapElemTypeToInd.size()+1));
1216  vector<vector<unsigned long> > nCommElem(nTimeLevels,
1217  vector<unsigned long>(mapElemTypeToInd.size()+1));
1218  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
1219  {
1220  for(unsigned long j=0; j<=mapElemTypeToInd.size(); ++j) {
1221  nInternalElem[i][j] = 0;
1222  nCommElem[i][j] = 0;
1223  }
1224  }
1225 
1226  for(vector<CReorderElements>::iterator OEI =ownedElements.begin();
1227  OEI!=ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1228  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1229  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1230  unsigned short ind = MI->second +1;
1231 
1232  if( OEI->GetCommSolution() )
1233  ++nCommElem[OEI->GetTimeLevel()][ind];
1234  else
1235  ++nInternalElem[OEI->GetTimeLevel()][ind];
1236  }
1237 
1238  /* Loop again over the owned elements and check if elements, which do not
1239  have to send their solution, should be flagged as such in order to improve
1240  the gemm performance. */
1241  for(vector<CReorderElements>::iterator OEI =ownedElements.begin();
1242  OEI!=ownedElements.end(); ++OEI) {
1243 
1244  /* Check for an internal element, i.e. an element for which the solution
1245  does not need to be communicated. */
1246  if( !OEI->GetCommSolution() ) {
1247 
1248  /* Determine the time level and the index of the element type. */
1249  const unsigned short tLev = OEI->GetTimeLevel();
1250 
1251  const unsigned short elType = OEI->GetElemType();
1252  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1253  const unsigned short ind = MI->second +1;
1254 
1255  /* Determine whether or not this element must be moved from internal to
1256  comm elements to improve performance. Change the appropriate data
1257  when this must happen. */
1258  if(nInternalElem[tLev][ind]%nElemSimul && nCommElem[tLev][ind]%nElemSimul) {
1259  OEI->SetCommSolution(true);
1260  --nInternalElem[tLev][ind];
1261  ++nCommElem[tLev][ind];
1262  }
1263  }
1264  }
1265 
1266  /* Check whether there are enough elements in every partition for every
1267  time level to guarantee a good gemm performance. */
1268  unsigned long nFullChunks = 0, nPartialChunks = 0;
1269  for(unsigned short tLev=0; tLev<nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1270  for(unsigned long j=1; j<nInternalElem[tLev].size(); ++j) {
1271  nFullChunks += nInternalElem[tLev][j]/nElemSimul;
1272  if(nInternalElem[tLev][j]%nElemSimul) ++nPartialChunks;
1273  }
1274 
1275  for(unsigned long j=1; j<nCommElem[tLev].size(); ++j) {
1276  nFullChunks += nCommElem[tLev][j]/nElemSimul;
1277  if(nCommElem[tLev][j]%nElemSimul) ++nPartialChunks;
1278  }
1279  }
1280 
1281  unsigned long tooManyPartChunksLoc = 0;
1282  if(5*nPartialChunks >= (nPartialChunks+nFullChunks)) tooManyPartChunksLoc = 1;
1283 
1284  /* Determine the number of ranks which contain too many partial chunks.
1285  The result only needs to be known on the master node. */
1286  unsigned long nRanksTooManyPartChunks = tooManyPartChunksLoc;
1287 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1288  SU2_MPI::Reduce(&tooManyPartChunksLoc, &nRanksTooManyPartChunks, 1,
1289  MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
1290 #endif
1291 
1292  if((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (nRanksTooManyPartChunks != 0) && (size > 1)) {
1293  cout << endl << " WARNING" << endl;
1294  cout << "There are " << nRanksTooManyPartChunks << " partitions for which "
1295  << " the simultaneous treatment of volume elements is not optimal." << endl;
1296  cout << "This could lead to a significant load imbalance." << endl;
1297  }
1298 
1299  /* Put nInternalElem and nCommElem in cumulative storage format. */
1300  for(unsigned short tLev=0; tLev<nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1301  if( tLev ) nInternalElem[tLev][0] = nCommElem[tLev-1].back();
1302  for(unsigned long j=1; j<nInternalElem[tLev].size(); ++j)
1303  nInternalElem[tLev][j] += nInternalElem[tLev][j-1];
1304 
1305  nCommElem[tLev][0] = nInternalElem[tLev].back();
1306  for(unsigned long j=1; j<nCommElem[tLev].size(); ++j)
1307  nCommElem[tLev][j] += nCommElem[tLev][j-1];
1308  }
1309 
1310  /* In the solver only the number of elements per time level is needed.
1311  The number of owned elements, nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel, is stored in
1312  cumulative storage format and can be retrieved easily from nCommElem.
1313  The number of internal elements per time level is stored normally and
1314  can be retrieved from nInternalElem. */
1315  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels+1);
1316  nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
1317 
1318  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0] = 0;
1319  for(unsigned short tLev=0; tLev<nTimeLevels; ++tLev) {
1320  nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[tLev+1] = nCommElem[tLev].back();
1321  nVolElemInternalPerTimeLevel[tLev] = nInternalElem[tLev].back()
1322  - nInternalElem[tLev][0];
1323  }
1324 
1325  /* Sort the elements of ownedElements in increasing order. */
1326  sort(ownedElements.begin(), ownedElements.end());
1327 
1328  /* At the moment the elements are sorted per time level and element type. */
1329  /* This is in principle enough to make to code work with the simultaneous */
1330  /* treatment for volume elements. Below follows a renumbering within the */
1331  /* time level and element type (Reverse Cuthill-McKee), such that a better */
1332  /* cache performance is obtained for the surface elements. For high order */
1333  /* elements this effect is probably marginal. */
1334 
1335  /* Determine the map from the global element ID to the current storage
1336  sequence of ownedElements. */
1337  mapGlobalElemIDToInd.clear();
1338  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
1339  mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = i;
1340 
1341  /*--- Create the graph of local elements. The halo elements are ignored. ---*/
1342  vector<vector<unsigned long> > neighElem(nVolElemOwned, vector<unsigned long>(0));
1343 
1344  nRankRecv = (int) longRecvBuf.size();
1345  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1346  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0;
1347  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1348  unsigned long globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL];
1349  unsigned short nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+3];
1350  unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+5];
1351 
1352  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(globalID);
1353  unsigned long ind = MMI->second;
1354 
1355  indS += 8;
1356  indL += nDOFsGrid + 2;
1357  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nFaces; ++k, indS+=3, ++indL) {
1358  if((longRecvBuf[i][indL] != -1) && (shortRecvBuf[i][indS] == -1)) { // Check for internal owned node.
1359 
1360  MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(longRecvBuf[i][indL]);
1361  if(MMI != mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end()) neighElem[ind].push_back(MMI->second);
1362  }
1363  }
1364  }
1365  }
1366 
1367  /* Sort the neighbors of each element in increasing order. */
1368  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
1369  sort(neighElem[i].begin(), neighElem[i].end());
1370 
1371  /* Define the vector, which contains the new numbering of the owned elements
1372  w.r.t. to the numbering currently stored in ownedElements. Note that signed
1373  longs are used for this purpose, because the vector is initialized with -1
1374  to indicate that no new number has been assigned yet. */
1375  vector<long> oldElemToNewElem(nVolElemOwned, -1);
1376 
1377  /*--- While loop to carry out the renumbering. A while loop is present,
1378  because the local partition may not be contiguous. ---*/
1379  unsigned long nElemRenumbered = 0;
1380  while (nElemRenumbered < nVolElemOwned) {
1381 
1382  /* Determine the first element in the list that has not been renumbered. */
1383  unsigned long indBeg;
1384  for(indBeg=0; indBeg<nVolElemOwned; ++indBeg)
1385  if(oldElemToNewElem[indBeg] == -1) break;
1386 
1387  /* Determine the time level and element type of the element indBeg and
1388  determine the element range in which the starting element for the
1389  renumbering must be sought. */
1390  unsigned short timeLevel = ownedElements[indBeg].GetTimeLevel();
1391  unsigned short elType = ownedElements[indBeg].GetElemType();
1392 
1393  map<unsigned short, unsigned short>::const_iterator MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1394  unsigned short ind = MI->second;
1395 
1396  unsigned long indEnd;
1397  if( ownedElements[indBeg].GetCommSolution() )
1398  indEnd = nCommElem[timeLevel][ind+1];
1399  else
1400  indEnd = nInternalElem[timeLevel][ind+1];
1401 
1402  /* Determine the element in the range [indBeg,indEnd) with the least number
1403  of neighbors that has not been renumbered yet. This is the starting
1404  element for the current renumbering round. */
1405  for(unsigned long i=(indBeg+1); i<indEnd; ++i) {
1406  if((oldElemToNewElem[i] == -1) &&
1407  (neighElem[i].size() < neighElem[indBeg].size())) indBeg = i;
1408  }
1409 
1410  /* Start of the Reverse Cuthil McKee renumbering. */
1411  vector<unsigned long> frontElements(1, indBeg);
1412  while( frontElements.size() ) {
1413 
1414  /* Vector, which stores the front for the next round. */
1415  vector<unsigned long> frontElementsNew;
1416 
1417  /* Loop over the elements of the current front. */
1418  for(unsigned long i=0; i<frontElements.size(); ++i) {
1419 
1420  /* Carry out the renumbering for this element. */
1421  const unsigned long iFront = frontElements[i];
1422 
1423  timeLevel = ownedElements[iFront].GetTimeLevel();
1424  elType = ownedElements[iFront].GetElemType();
1425  MI = mapElemTypeToInd.find(elType);
1426  ind = MI->second;
1427 
1428  if( ownedElements[iFront].GetCommSolution() )
1429  oldElemToNewElem[iFront] = nCommElem[timeLevel][ind]++;
1430  else
1431  oldElemToNewElem[iFront] = nInternalElem[timeLevel][ind]++;
1432 
1433  /* Store the neighbors that have not been renumbered yet in the front
1434  for the next round. Set its index to -2 to indicate that the element
1435  is already on the new front. */
1436  for(unsigned long j=0; j<neighElem[iFront].size(); ++j) {
1437  if(oldElemToNewElem[neighElem[iFront][j]] == -1) {
1438  frontElementsNew.push_back(neighElem[iFront][j]);
1439  oldElemToNewElem[neighElem[iFront][j]] = -2;
1440  }
1441  }
1442  }
1443 
1444  /* Update the counter nElemRenumbered. */
1445  nElemRenumbered += frontElements.size();
1446 
1447  /* Sort frontElementsNew in increasing order. */
1448  sort(frontElementsNew.begin(), frontElementsNew.end());
1449 
1450  /* Store the new front elements in frontElements for the next round. */
1451  frontElements = frontElementsNew;
1452  }
1453  }
1454 
1455  if(nElemRenumbered != nVolElemOwned)
1456  SU2_MPI::Error("Something went wrong in the renumbering", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1457 
1458  /* Determine the final mapping from the global element number to the local
1459  entry for the owned elements. First clear mapGlobalElemIDToInd before
1460  it can be used to store its correct content. */
1461  mapGlobalElemIDToInd.clear();
1462  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
1463  mapGlobalElemIDToInd[ownedElements[i].GetGlobalElemID()] = oldElemToNewElem[i];
1464 
1465  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1466  /*--- Step 4: Store the elements, nodes and boundary elements in the data ---*/
1467  /*--- structures used by the FEM solver. ---*/
1468  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1469 
1470  /*--- Check in parallel mode for empty partitions. If present, print a warning.
1471  The solver is capable of handling empty partitions, but it may not be
1472  efficient. ---*/
1473 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1474  unsigned long thisPartitionEmpty = nVolElemOwned ? 0 : 1;
1475  unsigned long nEmptyPartitions = 0;
1476 
1477  SU2_MPI::Reduce(&thisPartitionEmpty, &nEmptyPartitions, 1,
1478  MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
1479 
1480  if(rank == MASTER_NODE && nEmptyPartitions) {
1481  cout << endl << " WARNING" << endl;
1482  cout << "There are " << nEmptyPartitions << " empty partitions present." << endl;
1483  cout << "SU2 is able to handle this, but it may be inefficient." << endl << endl;
1484  }
1485 #endif
1486 
1487  /*--- Allocate the memory for the volume elements, the nodes
1488  and the surface elements of the boundaries. ---*/
1489  volElem.resize(nVolElemTot);
1490  meshPoints.reserve(nPoint);
1491 
1492  boundaries.resize(nMarker);
1493  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1494  boundaries[iMarker].markerTag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
1495  boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary = config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY;
1496  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.reserve(nElem_Bound[iMarker]);
1497  }
1498 
1499  /*--- Copy the data from the communication buffers. ---*/
1500  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1501 
1502  /* The data for the volume elements. Loop over these elements in the buffer. */
1503  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0, indD = 0;
1504  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1505 
1506  /* Determine the location in volElem where this data must be stored. */
1507  unsigned long elemID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1508  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1509  unsigned long ind = MMI->second;
1510 
1511  /* Store the data. */
1512  volElem[ind].elemIsOwned = true;
1513  volElem[ind].rankOriginal = rank;
1514  volElem[ind].periodIndexToDonor = -1;
1515 
1516  volElem[ind].VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1517  volElem[ind].nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1518  volElem[ind].nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1519  volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1520  volElem[ind].nDOFsSol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1521  volElem[ind].nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1522  volElem[ind].timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1523 
1524  volElem[ind].JacIsConsideredConstant = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1525 
1526  volElem[ind].elemIDGlobal = elemID;
1527  volElem[ind].offsetDOFsSolGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1528 
1529  volElem[ind].nodeIDsGrid.resize(volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid);
1530  volElem[ind].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant.resize(volElem[ind].nFaces);
1531  volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces.resize(volElem[ind].nFaces);
1532 
1533  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[ind].nDOFsGrid; ++k)
1534  volElem[ind].nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1535 
1536  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[ind].nFaces; ++k) {
1537  long neighBorID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1538 
1539  ++indS; // At this location the periodic index of the face is stored in
1540  // shortRecvBuf, which is not stored in volElem.
1541  volElem[ind].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k] = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1542  volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces[k] = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1543 
1544  if(neighBorID == -1)
1545  volElem[ind].ElementOwnsFaces[k] = true; // Boundary faces are always owned.
1546  }
1547 
1548  volElem[ind].lenScale = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1549  }
1550 
1551  /* The data for the nodes. Loop over these nodes in the buffer and store
1552  them in meshPoints. */
1553  unsigned long nNodesThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1554  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nNodesThisRank; ++j) {
1555  CPointFEM thisPoint;
1556  thisPoint.globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1557  thisPoint.periodIndexToDonor = -1;
1558  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDim; ++k)
1559  thisPoint.coor[k] = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1560 
1561  meshPoints.push_back(thisPoint);
1562  }
1563 
1564  /* The data for the boundary markers. Loop over them. */
1565  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1566 
1567  unsigned long nElemThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1568  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nElemThisRank; ++j) {
1569  CSurfaceElementFEM thisSurfElem;
1570 
1571  thisSurfElem.VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1572  thisSurfElem.nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1573  thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1574  const short nDonors = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1575 
1576  thisSurfElem.volElemID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1577  thisSurfElem.boundElemIDGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1578 
1579  thisSurfElem.nodeIDsGrid.resize(thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid);
1580  for(unsigned short k=0; k<thisSurfElem.nDOFsGrid; ++k)
1581  thisSurfElem.nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1582 
1583  indL += nDonors;
1584 
1585  /* Convert the global volume element ID to the local one.
1586  It is essential to do this before the sorting. */
1587  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI;
1588  MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(thisSurfElem.volElemID);
1589  thisSurfElem.volElemID = MMI->second;
1590 
1591  /* Store the surface element in the data structure for this boundary. */
1592  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.push_back(thisSurfElem);
1593  }
1594  }
1595  }
1596 
1597  /* Sort meshPoints in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
1598  sort(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end());
1599  vector<CPointFEM>::iterator lastPoint = unique(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end());
1600  meshPoints.erase(lastPoint, meshPoints.end());
1601 
1602  /* Clear the contents of the map globalPointIDToLocalInd and fill
1603  it with the information present in meshPoints. */
1604  globalPointIDToLocalInd.clear();
1605  for(unsigned long i=0; i<meshPoints.size(); ++i)
1606  globalPointIDToLocalInd[meshPoints[i].globalID] = i;
1607 
1608  /*--- All the data from the receive buffers has been copied in the local
1609  data structures. Release the memory of the receive buffers. To make
1610  sure that all the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
1611  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1612  vector<short>().swap(shortRecvBuf[i]);
1613  vector<long>().swap(longRecvBuf[i]);
1614  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleRecvBuf[i]);
1615  }
1616 
1617  /*--- Sort the surface elements of the boundaries in increasing order. ---*/
1618  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker)
1619  sort(boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.begin(), boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.end());
1620 
1621  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1622  /*--- Step 5: Obtain the information of the halo elements, which are ---*/
1623  /*--- sorted per time level and afterwards per rank, where the ---*/
1624  /*--- sequence is determined by the numbering on the sending rank. ---*/
1625  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1626 
1627  /*--- Resize the first index of the send buffers to nRankRecv, because this
1628  number of messages must be sent back to the sending ranks with halo
1629  information. ---*/
1630  nRankRecv = (int) longSecondRecvBuf.size();
1631  shortSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1632  longSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1633  doubleSendBuf.resize(nRankRecv);
1634 
1635 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1636  /* Resize the vector of the communication requests to the number of messages
1637  to be sent by this rank. Only in parallel node. */
1638  commReqs.resize(3*nRankRecv);
1639 #endif
1640 
1641  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to fill the send buffers again. ---*/
1642  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1643 
1644  /* Loop over the elements in this receive buffer to determine the local
1645  index on this rank. Note that also the periodic index must be stored,
1646  hence use an CUnsignedLong2T for this purpose. As -1 cannot be stored
1647  for an unsigned long a 1 is added to the periodic transformation. */
1648  const unsigned long nElemBuf = longSecondRecvBuf[i].size()/2;
1649  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> elemBuf(nElemBuf);
1650 
1651  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
1652  const unsigned long j2 = 2*j;
1653 
1654  const unsigned long elemID = longSecondRecvBuf[i][j2];
1655  map<unsigned long, unsigned long>::iterator MMI = mapGlobalElemIDToInd.find(elemID);
1656  if(MMI == mapGlobalElemIDToInd.end())
1657  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in mapGlobalElemIDToInd", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1658 
1659  elemBuf[j].long0 = MMI->second;
1660  elemBuf[j].long1 = longSecondRecvBuf[i][j2+1] + 1;
1661  }
1662 
1663  /* Release the memory of the long receive buffer via the swap function
1664  and sort elemBuf in increasing order. */
1665  vector<long>().swap(longSecondRecvBuf[i]);
1666 
1667  sort(elemBuf.begin(), elemBuf.end());
1668 
1669  /* Store the number of elements in the first element of the long send buffer. */
1670  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nElemBuf);
1671 
1672  /* Vector with node IDs that must be returned to this calling rank.
1673  Note that also the periodic index must be stored, hence use an
1674  CUnsignedLong2T for this purpose. */
1675  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> nodeIDs;
1676 
1677  /* Loop over the elements to fill the send buffers. */
1678  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nElemBuf; ++j) {
1679 
1680  /* Store the global element ID in the long buffer,
1681  the periodic index in the short send buffer and
1682  the length scale in the double send buffer. */
1683  const unsigned long indV = elemBuf[j].long0;
1684  longSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].elemIDGlobal);
1685 
1686  const short perIndex = (short) elemBuf[j].long1 -1; // Note the -1.
1687  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(perIndex);
1688 
1689  doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].lenScale);
1690 
1691  /* Store the other relevant information of this element in the short
1692  and long communication buffers. Also store the node IDs and the
1693  periodic transformation in nodeIDs. */
1694  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].VTK_Type);
1695  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nPolyGrid);
1696  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nPolySol);
1697  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid);
1698  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nDOFsSol);
1699  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nFaces);
1700  shortSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].timeLevel);
1701 
1702  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid; ++k) {
1703  longSendBuf[i].push_back(volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k]);
1704  nodeIDs.push_back(CUnsignedLong2T(volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k],
1705  elemBuf[j].long1));
1706  }
1707 
1708  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[indV].nFaces; ++k)
1709  shortSendBuf[i].push_back((short) volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k]);
1710  }
1711 
1712  /* Sort nodeIDs in increasing order and remove the double entities. */
1713  sort(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
1714  vector<CUnsignedLong2T>::iterator lastNodeID = unique(nodeIDs.begin(), nodeIDs.end());
1715  nodeIDs.erase(lastNodeID, nodeIDs.end());
1716 
1717  /* Add the number of node IDs and the node IDs itself to longSendBuf[i]
1718  and the periodix index to shortSendBuf. Note again the -1 for the
1719  periodic index, because an unsigned long cannot represent -1, the
1720  value for the periodic index when no peridicity is present. */
1721  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs.size());
1722  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
1723  longSendBuf[i].push_back(nodeIDs[j].long0);
1724  shortSendBuf[i].push_back( (short) nodeIDs[j].long1-1);
1725  }
1726 
1727  /*--- Copy the coordinates to doubleSendBuf. ---*/
1728  for(unsigned long j=0; j<nodeIDs.size(); ++j) {
1729  map<unsigned long,unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
1730  LMI = globalPointIDToLocalInd.find(nodeIDs[j].long0);
1731 
1732  if(LMI == globalPointIDToLocalInd.end())
1733  SU2_MPI::Error("Entry not found in map", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
1734 
1735  unsigned long ind = LMI->second;
1736  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nDim; ++l)
1737  doubleSendBuf[i].push_back(meshPoints[ind].coor[l]);
1738  }
1739 
1740  /*--- Send the communication buffers back to the calling rank.
1741  Only in parallel mode of course. ---*/
1742 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1743  int dest = sourceRank[i];
1744  SU2_MPI::Isend(shortSendBuf[i].data(), shortSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_SHORT,
1745  dest, dest+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[3*i]);
1746  SU2_MPI::Isend(longSendBuf[i].data(), longSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_LONG,
1747  dest, dest+2, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[3*i+1]);
1748  SU2_MPI::Isend(doubleSendBuf[i].data(), doubleSendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
1749  dest, dest+3, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[3*i+2]);
1750 #endif
1751  }
1752 
1753  /*--- Resize the first index of the receive buffers to nRankSendHaloInfo,
1754  such that the requested halo information can be received. ---*/
1755  nRankSend = nRankSendHaloInfo;
1756  shortRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1757  longRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1758  doubleRecvBuf.resize(nRankSend);
1759 
1760  /* Resize the vector to store the ranks from which the message came. */
1761  sourceRank.resize(nRankSend);
1762 
1763  /*--- Receive the communication data from the correct ranks. Make a distinction
1764  between parallel and sequential mode. ---*/
1765 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
1766 
1767  /* Parallel mode. Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data
1768  in the return communication, i.e. nRankSend. */
1769  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1770 
1771  /* Block until a message with shorts arrives from any processor.
1772  Determine the source and the size of the message. */
1773  SU2_MPI::Status status;
1774  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
1775  sourceRank[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
1776 
1777  int sizeMess;
1778  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_SHORT, &sizeMess);
1779 
1780  /* Allocate the memory for the short receive buffer and receive the message. */
1781  shortRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1782  SU2_MPI::Recv(shortRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_SHORT,
1783  sourceRank[i], rank+1, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
1784 
1785  /* Block until the corresponding message with longs arrives, determine
1786  its size, allocate the memory and receive the message. */
1787  SU2_MPI::Probe(sourceRank[i], rank+2, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
1788  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_LONG, &sizeMess);
1789  longRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1790 
1791  SU2_MPI::Recv(longRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_LONG,
1792  sourceRank[i], rank+2, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
1793 
1794  /* Idem for the message with doubles. */
1795  SU2_MPI::Probe(sourceRank[i], rank+3, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
1796  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_DOUBLE, &sizeMess);
1797  doubleRecvBuf[i].resize(sizeMess);
1798 
1799  SU2_MPI::Recv(doubleRecvBuf[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_DOUBLE,
1800  sourceRank[i], rank+3, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
1801  }
1802 
1803  /* Complete the non-blocking sends. */
1804  SU2_MPI::Waitall(3*nRankRecv, commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
1805 
1806  /* Wild cards have been used in the communication,
1807  so synchronize the ranks to avoid problems. */
1808  SU2_MPI::Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
1809 
1810 #else
1811 
1812  /* Sequential mode. Simply copy the buffers. Note that nRankSend is at most 1. */
1813  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1814  sourceRank[i] = i;
1815  shortRecvBuf[i] = shortSendBuf[i];
1816  longRecvBuf[i] = longSendBuf[i];
1817  doubleRecvBuf[i] = doubleSendBuf[i];
1818  }
1819 
1820 #endif
1821 
1822  /*--- Release the memory of the send buffers. To make sure that all
1823  the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. ---*/
1824  for(int i=0; i<nRankRecv; ++i) {
1825  vector<short>().swap(shortSendBuf[i]);
1826  vector<long>().swap(longSendBuf[i]);
1827  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleSendBuf[i]);
1828  }
1829 
1830  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1831  /*--- Step 6: Build the layer of halo elements from the information in the ---*/
1832  /*--- receive buffers shortRecvBuf, longRecvBuf and doubleRecvBuf. ---*/
1833  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
1834 
1835  /*--- The halo elements must be sorted first based on the time level, followed
1836  by the rank and finally the index in the receive buffers (which represents
1837  the sequence on the sending rank. This sorting can be accomplished by
1838  using a vector of CLong3T. The contents of this vector is build below. ---*/
1839  vector<CLong3T> haloElemInfo;
1840  haloElemInfo.reserve(nVolElemTot - nVolElemOwned);
1841 
1842  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1843  unsigned long indS = 0;
1844 
1845  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1846  const unsigned short nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS+6];
1847  haloElemInfo.push_back(CLong3T(shortRecvBuf[i][indS+7], sourceRank[i], j));
1848  indS += nFaces + 8;
1849  }
1850  }
1851 
1852  sort(haloElemInfo.begin(), haloElemInfo.end());
1853 
1854  /*--- Loop over the receive buffers to store the information of the
1855  halo elements and the halo points. ---*/
1856  vector<CPointFEM> haloPoints;
1857  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
1858 
1859  /* Initialization of the indices in the communication buffers. */
1860  unsigned long indL = 1, indS = 0, indD = 0;
1861 
1862  /* Loop over the halo elements received from this rank. */
1863  for(long j=0; j<longRecvBuf[i][0]; ++j) {
1864 
1865  /* Create an object of CLong3T and search for its position
1866  in haloElemInfo to determine the index in volElem, where
1867  this element is stored. */
1868  CLong3T thisElem(shortRecvBuf[i][indS+7], sourceRank[i], j);
1869  vector<CLong3T>::iterator low;
1870  low = lower_bound(haloElemInfo.begin(), haloElemInfo.end(), thisElem);
1871 
1872  unsigned long indV = low - haloElemInfo.begin();
1873  indV += nVolElemOwned;
1874 
1875  /* Retrieve the data from the communication buffers. */
1876  volElem[indV].elemIDGlobal = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1877  volElem[indV].rankOriginal = sourceRank[i];
1878 
1879  volElem[indV].periodIndexToDonor = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1880  volElem[indV].VTK_Type = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1881  volElem[indV].nPolyGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1882  volElem[indV].nPolySol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1883  volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1884  volElem[indV].nDOFsSol = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1885  volElem[indV].nFaces = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1886  volElem[indV].timeLevel = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1887 
1888  volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid.resize(volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid);
1889  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[indV].nDOFsGrid; ++k)
1890  volElem[indV].nodeIDsGrid[k] = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1891 
1892  volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant.resize(volElem[indV].nFaces);
1893  for(unsigned short k=0; k<volElem[indV].nFaces; ++k)
1894  volElem[indV].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[k] = (bool) shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1895 
1896  /* Give the member variables that are not obtained via communication their
1897  values. Some of these variables are not used for halo elements. */
1898  volElem[indV].elemIsOwned = false;
1899  volElem[indV].JacIsConsideredConstant = false;
1900  volElem[indV].offsetDOFsSolGlobal = ULONG_MAX;
1901 
1902  /* Halo elements do not own a face per definition. */
1903  volElem[indV].ElementOwnsFaces.assign(volElem[indV].nFaces, false);
1904 
1905  /* Get the length scale from the double receive buffer.*/
1906  volElem[indV].lenScale = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1907  }
1908 
1909  /* Store the information of the points in haloPoints. */
