1910  const long nPointsThisRank = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1911  for(long j=0; j<nPointsThisRank; ++j) {
1912  CPointFEM thisPoint;
1913  thisPoint.globalID = longRecvBuf[i][indL++];
1914  thisPoint.periodIndexToDonor = shortRecvBuf[i][indS++];
1915  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nDim; ++l)
1916  thisPoint.coor[l] = doubleRecvBuf[i][indD++];
1917 
1918  haloPoints.push_back(thisPoint);
1919  }
1920 
1921  /* The communication buffers from this rank are not needed anymore.
1922  Delete them using the swap function. */
1923  vector<short>().swap(shortRecvBuf[i]);
1924  vector<long>().swap(longRecvBuf[i]);
1925  vector<su2double>().swap(doubleRecvBuf[i]);
1926  }
1927 
1928  /* Remove the duplicate entries from haloPoints. */
1929  sort(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1930  lastPoint = unique(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1931  haloPoints.erase(lastPoint, haloPoints.end());
1932 
1933  /* Initialization of some variables to sort the halo points. */
1934  Global_nPoint = geometry->GetGlobal_nPoint();
1935  unsigned long InvalidPointID = Global_nPoint + 10;
1936  short InvalidPerInd = SHRT_MAX;
1937 
1938  /*--- Search for the nonperiodic halo points in the local points to see
1939  if these points are already stored on this rank. If this is the
1940  case invalidate this halo and decrease the number of halo points.
1941  Afterwards remove the invalid halos from the vector. ---*/
1942  unsigned long nHaloPoints = haloPoints.size();
1943  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloPoints.size(); ++i) {
1944  if(haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor != -1) break; // Test for nonperiodic.
1945 
1946  if( binary_search(meshPoints.begin(), meshPoints.end(), haloPoints[i]) ) {
1947  haloPoints[i].globalID = InvalidPointID;
1948  haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor = InvalidPerInd;
1949  --nHaloPoints;
1950  }
1951  }
1952 
1953  sort(haloPoints.begin(), haloPoints.end());
1954  haloPoints.resize(nHaloPoints);
1955 
1956  /* Increase the capacity of meshPoints, such that the halo points can be
1957  stored in there as well. Note that in case periodic points are present
1958  this is an upper bound. Add the non-periodic halo points to meshPoints. */
1959  meshPoints.reserve(meshPoints.size() + nHaloPoints);
1960 
1961  for(unsigned long i=0; i<haloPoints.size(); ++i) {
1962  if(haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor != -1) break; // Test for nonperiodic.
1963 
1964  meshPoints.push_back(haloPoints[i]);
1965  }
1966 
1967  /* Create a map from the global point ID and periodic index to the local
1968  index in the vector meshPoints. First store the points already present
1969  in meshPoints. */
1970  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long> mapGlobalPointIDToInd;
1971  for(unsigned long i=0; i<meshPoints.size(); ++i) {
1972  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
1973  globIndAndPer.long0 = meshPoints[i].globalID;
1974  globIndAndPer.long1 = meshPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor+1; // Note the +1 again.
1975 
1976  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = i;
1977  }
1978 
1979  /*--- Convert the global indices in the boundary connectivities to local ones.
1980  Note that the volume ID's already contain the local number. ---*/
1981  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
1982  for(unsigned long i=0; i<boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size(); ++i) {
1983 
1984  /* Convert the global node ID's to local values. Note that for these node
1985  ID's no periodic transformation can be present. */
1986  for(unsigned short j=0; j<boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
1987  CUnsignedLong2T searchItem(boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j], 0);
1988  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long>::const_iterator LLMI;
1989  LLMI = mapGlobalPointIDToInd.find(searchItem);
1990  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j] = LLMI->second;
1991  }
1992  }
1993  }
1994 
1995  /*--- The only halo points that must be added to meshPoints are the periodic
1996  halo points. It must be checked whether or not the periodic points in
1997  haloPoints match with points in meshPoints. This is done below. ---*/
1998  for(unsigned long iLow=0; iLow<haloPoints.size(); ) {
1999 
2000  /* Determine the upper index for this periodic transformation. */
2001  unsigned long iUpp;
2002  for(iUpp=iLow+1; iUpp<haloPoints.size(); ++iUpp)
2003  if(haloPoints[iUpp].periodIndexToDonor != haloPoints[iLow].periodIndexToDonor) break;
2004 
2005  /* Check for a true periodic index. */
2006  short perIndex = haloPoints[iLow].periodIndexToDonor;
2007  if(perIndex != -1) {
2008 
2009  /* Easier storage of the surface elements. */
2010  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[perIndex].surfElem;
2011 
2012  /*--- In the loop below the coordinates of the points of this local
2013  periodic boundary as well as a matching tolerance are determined.
2014  A vector of point ID's is also created, which is needed later on
2015  when it is checked whether or not a matching point is already
2016  stored in meshPoints. ---*/
2017  vector<long> indInPoints(meshPoints.size(), -1);
2018  vector<unsigned long> IDsPoints;
2019  vector<su2double> coordPoints;
2020  vector<su2double> tolPoints;
2021 
2022  for(unsigned long j=0; j<surfElem.size(); ++j) {
2023 
2024  /* Determine the tolerance for equal points, which is a small value
2025  times the length scale of the adjacent volume element. */
2026  const su2double tolElem = 1.e-2*volElem[surfElem[j].volElemID].lenScale;
2027 
2028  /* Loop over the nodes of this surface grid and update the points on
2029  this periodic boundary. */
2030  for(unsigned short k=0; k<surfElem[j].nDOFsGrid; ++k) {
2031  unsigned long nn = surfElem[j].nodeIDsGrid[k];
2032 
2033  if(indInPoints[nn] == -1) {
2034 
2035  /* Point is not stored yet in pointsBoundary. Do so now. */
2036  indInPoints[nn] = IDsPoints.size();
2037  IDsPoints.push_back(nn);
2038  tolPoints.push_back(tolElem);
2039 
2040  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nDim; ++l)
2041  coordPoints.push_back(meshPoints[nn].coor[l]);
2042  }
2043  else {
2044 
2045  /* Point is already stored. Update the tolerance. */
2046  nn = indInPoints[nn];
2047  tolPoints[nn] = min(tolPoints[nn], tolElem);
2048  }
2049  }
2050  }
2051 
2052  /* Create a local ADT of the points on the periodic boundary. */
2053  CADTPointsOnlyClass periodicADT(nDim, IDsPoints.size(), coordPoints.data(),
2054  IDsPoints.data(), false);
2055 
2056  /* Get the data for the periodic transformation to the donor. */
2057  su2double *center = config->GetPeriodicRotCenter(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
2058  su2double *angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
2059  su2double *trans = config->GetPeriodicTranslation(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(perIndex));
2060 
2061  /*--- Compute the rotation matrix and translation vector for the
2062  transformation from the donor. This is the transpose of the
2063  transformation to the donor. ---*/
2064 
2065  /* Store (center-trans) as it is constant and will be added on. */
2066  su2double translation[] = {center[0] - trans[0],
2067  center[1] - trans[1],
2068  center[2] - trans[2]};
2069 
2070  /* Store angles separately for clarity. Compute sines/cosines. */
2071  su2double theta = angles[0];
2072  su2double phi = angles[1];
2073  su2double psi = angles[2];
2074 
2075  su2double cosTheta = cos(theta), cosPhi = cos(phi), cosPsi = cos(psi);
2076  su2double sinTheta = sin(theta), sinPhi = sin(phi), sinPsi = sin(psi);
2077 
2078  /* Compute the rotation matrix. Note that the implicit
2079  ordering is rotation about the x-axis, y-axis, then z-axis. */
2080  su2double rotMatrix[3][3];
2081  rotMatrix[0][0] = cosPhi*cosPsi;
2082  rotMatrix[0][1] = cosPhi*sinPsi;
2083  rotMatrix[0][2] = -sinPhi;
2084 
2085  rotMatrix[1][0] = sinTheta*sinPhi*cosPsi - cosTheta*sinPsi;
2086  rotMatrix[1][1] = sinTheta*sinPhi*sinPsi + cosTheta*cosPsi;
2087  rotMatrix[1][2] = sinTheta*cosPhi;
2088 
2089  rotMatrix[2][0] = cosTheta*sinPhi*cosPsi + sinTheta*sinPsi;
2090  rotMatrix[2][1] = cosTheta*sinPhi*sinPsi - sinTheta*cosPsi;
2091  rotMatrix[2][2] = cosTheta*cosPhi;
2092 
2093  /* Loop over the halo points for this periodic transformation. */
2094  for(unsigned long i=iLow; i<iUpp; ++i) {
2095 
2096  /* Apply the periodic transformation to the coordinates
2097  stored in this halo point. */
2098  su2double dx = haloPoints[i].coor[0] - center[0];
2099  su2double dy = haloPoints[i].coor[1] - center[1];
2100  su2double dz = nDim == 3 ? haloPoints[i].coor[2] - center[2] : su2double(0.0);
2101 
2102  haloPoints[i].coor[0] = rotMatrix[0][0]*dx + rotMatrix[0][1]*dy
2103  + rotMatrix[0][2]*dz + translation[0];
2104  haloPoints[i].coor[1] = rotMatrix[1][0]*dx + rotMatrix[1][1]*dy
2105  + rotMatrix[1][2]*dz + translation[1];
2106  haloPoints[i].coor[2] = rotMatrix[2][0]*dx + rotMatrix[2][1]*dy
2107  + rotMatrix[2][2]*dz + translation[2];
2108 
2109  /* Search for the nearest coordinate in the ADT. */
2110  su2double dist;
2111  unsigned long pointID;
2112  int rankID;
2113 
2114  periodicADT.DetermineNearestNode(haloPoints[i].coor, dist,
2115  pointID, rankID);
2116 
2117  /* Check whether the distance is less equal to the tolerance for
2118  a matching point. */
2119  const unsigned long nn = indInPoints[pointID];
2120  if(dist <= tolPoints[nn]) {
2121 
2122  /* The distance to the nearest point is less than the tolerance,
2123  hence this periodically transformed point is present on the
2124  boundary. Store it as such in the map mapGlobalPointIDToInd. */
2125  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
2126  globIndAndPer.long0 = haloPoints[i].globalID;
2127  globIndAndPer.long1 = haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor+1; // Note the +1 again.
2128 
2129  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = pointID;
2130  }
2131  else {
2132 
2133  /* The distance to the nearest point is larger than the tolerance,
2134  hence this periodically transformed point is not present yet on
2135  this rank. Store it in the mapping to the local points and
2136  create it in meshPoints. */
2137  CUnsignedLong2T globIndAndPer;
2138  globIndAndPer.long0 = haloPoints[i].globalID;
2139  globIndAndPer.long1 = haloPoints[i].periodIndexToDonor+1; // Note the +1 again.
2140 
2141  mapGlobalPointIDToInd[globIndAndPer] = meshPoints.size();
2142  meshPoints.push_back(haloPoints[i]);
2143  }
2144  }
2145  }
2146 
2147  /* Set iLow to iUpp for the next periodic transformation. */
2148  iLow = iUpp;
2149  }
2150 
2151  /*--- Convert the global node numbering in the elements to a local numbering and
2152  determine the value of factTimeLevel. This is the number of local time steps
2153  of the element relative to the largest time step of an element in the mesh.
2154  This value can only differ from 1 when time accurate local time stepping is
2155  used. ---*/
2156  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
2157  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[i].nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
2158  CUnsignedLong2T searchItem(volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j],
2159  volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor+1); // Again the +1.
2160  map<CUnsignedLong2T, unsigned long>::const_iterator LLMI;
2161  LLMI = mapGlobalPointIDToInd.find(searchItem);
2162  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid[j] = LLMI->second;
2163  }
2164 
2165  const unsigned short diffTimeLevel = nTimeLevels - 1 - volElem[i].timeLevel;
2166  volElem[i].factTimeLevel = pow(2, diffTimeLevel);
2167  }
2168 
2169  /* Determine the number of halo elements per time level in cumulative
2170  storage format. */
2171  nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel.assign(nTimeLevels+1, 0);
2172  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i)
2173  ++nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel+1];
2174 
2175  nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[0] = nVolElemOwned;
2176  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
2177  nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[i+1] += nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[i];
2178 }
2179 
2180 void CMeshFEM::ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(const unsigned short nIntegration,
2181  const unsigned short nDOFs,
2182  const su2double *matDerBasisInt,
2183  const unsigned long *DOFs,
2184  su2double *derivCoor,
2185  CConfig *config) {
2186 
2187  /* Allocate the memory to store the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. */
2188  vector<su2double> helpDxdrVec(nIntegration*nDim*nDim);
2189  su2double *dxdrVec = helpDxdrVec.data();
2190 
2191  /* Determine the gradients of the Cartesian coordinates w.r.t. the
2192  parametric coordinates. */
2193  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nIntegration, nDOFs, matDerBasisInt, DOFs,
2194  dxdrVec, config);
2195 
2196  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D to compute the derivatives drdx,
2197  drdy, etc. */
2198  switch( nDim ) {
2199  case 2: {
2200  /* 2D computation. Store the offset between the r and s derivatives. */
2201  const unsigned short off = 2*nIntegration;
2202 
2203  /* Loop over the integration points. */
2204  unsigned short ii = 0;
2205  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nIntegration; ++j) {
2206 
2207  /* Retrieve the values of dxdr, dydr, dxds and dyds from dxdrVec
2208  in this integration point. */
2209  const unsigned short jx = 2*j; const unsigned short jy = jx+1;
2210  const su2double dxdr = dxdrVec[jx], dydr = dxdrVec[jy];
2211  const su2double dxds = dxdrVec[jx+off], dyds = dxdrVec[jy+off];
2212 
2213  /* Compute the inverse relations drdx, drdy, dsdx, dsdy. */
2214  const su2double Jinv = 1.0/(dxdr*dyds - dxds*dydr);
2215 
2216  derivCoor[ii++] = dyds*Jinv; // drdx
2217  derivCoor[ii++] = -dxds*Jinv; // drdy
2218  derivCoor[ii++] = -dydr*Jinv; // dsdx
2219  derivCoor[ii++] = dxdr*Jinv; // dsdy
2220  }
2221  break;
2222  }
2223 
2224  case 3: {
2225  /* 3D computation. Store the offset between the r and s and r and t derivatives. */
2226  const unsigned short offS = 3*nIntegration, offT = 6*nIntegration;
2227 
2228  /* Loop over the integration points. */
2229  unsigned short ii = 0;
2230  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nIntegration; ++j) {
2231 
2232  /* Retrieve the values of dxdr, dydr, dzdr, dxds, dyds, dzds, dxdt, dydt
2233  and dzdt from dxdrVec in this integration point. */
2234  const unsigned short jx = 3*j; const unsigned short jy = jx+1, jz = jx+2;
2235  const su2double dxdr = dxdrVec[jx], dydr = dxdrVec[jy], dzdr = dxdrVec[jz];
2236  const su2double dxds = dxdrVec[jx+offS], dyds = dxdrVec[jy+offS], dzds = dxdrVec[jz+offS];
2237  const su2double dxdt = dxdrVec[jx+offT], dydt = dxdrVec[jy+offT], dzdt = dxdrVec[jz+offT];
2238 
2239  /* Compute the inverse relations drdx, drdy, drdz, dsdx, dsdy, dsdz,
2240  dtdx, dtdy, dtdz. */
2241  const su2double Jinv = 1.0/(dxdr*(dyds*dzdt - dzds*dydt)
2242  - dxds*(dydr*dzdt - dzdr*dydt)
2243  + dxdt*(dydr*dzds - dzdr*dyds));
2244 
2245  derivCoor[ii++] = (dyds*dzdt - dzds*dydt)*Jinv; // drdx
2246  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzds*dxdt - dxds*dzdt)*Jinv; // drdy
2247  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxds*dydt - dyds*dxdt)*Jinv; // drdz
2248 
2249  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzdr*dydt - dydr*dzdt)*Jinv; // dsdx
2250  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxdr*dzdt - dzdr*dxdt)*Jinv; // dsdy
2251  derivCoor[ii++] = (dydr*dxdt - dxdr*dydt)*Jinv; // dsdz
2252 
2253  derivCoor[ii++] = (dydr*dzds - dzdr*dyds)*Jinv; // dtdx
2254  derivCoor[ii++] = (dzdr*dxds - dxdr*dzds)*Jinv; // dtdy
2255  derivCoor[ii++] = (dxdr*dyds - dydr*dxds)*Jinv; // dtdz
2256  }
2257 
2258  break;
2259  }
2260  }
2261 }
2262 
2263 void CMeshFEM::ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(const unsigned short nIntegration,
2264  const unsigned short nDOFs,
2265  const su2double *matDerBasisInt,
2266  const unsigned long *DOFs,
2267  su2double *derivCoor,
2268  CConfig *config) {
2269 
2270  /* Allocate the memory to store the coordinates as right hand side. */
2271  vector<su2double> vecRHS(nDOFs*nDim);
2272 
2273  /* Loop over the grid DOFs of the element and copy the coordinates in
2274  vecRHS in row major order. */
2275  unsigned long ic = 0;
2276  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFs; ++j) {
2277  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDim; ++k, ++ic)
2278  vecRHS[ic] = meshPoints[DOFs[j]].coor[k];
2279  }
2280 
2281  /* Carry out the matrix matrix product The last argument is NULL, such
2282  that this gemm call is ignored in the profiling. Replace by config if
2283  if should be included. */
2284  blasFunctions->gemm(nDim*nIntegration, nDim, nDOFs, matDerBasisInt,
2285  vecRHS.data(), derivCoor, NULL);
2286 }
2287 
2288 void CMeshFEM::ComputeNormalsFace(const unsigned short nIntegration,
2289  const unsigned short nDOFs,
2290  const su2double *dr,
2291  const su2double *ds,
2292  const unsigned long *DOFs,
2293  su2double *normals) {
2294 
2295  /* Initialize the counter ii to 0. ii is the index in normals where the
2296  information is stored. */
2297  unsigned int ii = 0;
2298 
2299  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. */
2300  switch( nDim ) {
2301  case 2: {
2302  /* 2D computation. Loop over the integration points of the face. */
2303  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nIntegration; ++j) {
2304 
2305  /*--- Loop over the number of DOFs of the face to compute dxdr
2306  and dydr. ---*/
2307  const su2double *drr = &dr[j*nDOFs];
2308  su2double dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0;
2309  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k) {
2310  dxdr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2311  dydr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2312  }
2313 
2314  /* Determine the length of the tangential vector (dxdr, dydr), which
2315  is also the length of the corresponding normal vector. Also compute
2316  the inverse of the length. Make sure that a division by zero is
2317  avoided, although this is most likely never active. */
2318  const su2double lenNorm = sqrt(dxdr*dxdr + dydr*dydr);
2319  const su2double invLenNorm = lenNorm < su2double(1.e-35) ? su2double(1.e+35) : 1.0/lenNorm;
2320 
2321  /* Store the corresponding unit normal vector and its length. The
2322  direction of the normal vector is such that it is outward pointing
2323  for the element on side 0 of the face. */
2324  normals[ii++] = dydr*invLenNorm;
2325  normals[ii++] = -dxdr*invLenNorm;
2326  normals[ii++] = lenNorm;
2327  }
2328 
2329  break;
2330  }
2331 
2332  case 3: {
2333  /* 3D computation. Loop over the integration points of the face. */
2334  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nIntegration; ++j) {
2335 
2336  /*--- Loop over the number of DOFs of the face to compute dxdr,
2337  dxds, dydr, dyds, dzdr and dzds. ---*/
2338  const su2double *drr = &dr[j*nDOFs], *dss = &ds[j*nDOFs];
2339  su2double dxdr = 0.0, dydr = 0.0, dzdr = 0.0,
2340  dxds = 0.0, dyds = 0.0, dzds = 0.0;
2341  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k) {
2342  dxdr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2343  dydr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2344  dzdr += drr[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[2];
2345 
2346  dxds += dss[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[0];
2347  dyds += dss[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[1];
2348  dzds += dss[k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[2];
2349  }
2350 
2351  /* Compute the vector product dxdr X dxds, where x is the coordinate
2352  vector (x,y,z). Compute the length of this vector, which is an area,
2353  as well as the inverse. Make sure that a division by zero is
2354  avoided, although this is most likely never active. */
2355  const su2double nx = dydr*dzds - dyds*dzdr;
2356  const su2double ny = dxds*dzdr - dxdr*dzds;
2357  const su2double nz = dxdr*dyds - dxds*dydr;
2358 
2359  const su2double lenNorm = sqrt(nx*nx + ny*ny + nz*nz);
2360  const su2double invLenNorm = lenNorm < su2double(1.e-35) ? su2double(1.e+35) : 1.0/lenNorm;
2361 
2362  /* Store the components of the unit normal as well as its length in the
2363  normals. Note that the current direction of the normal is pointing
2364  into the direction of the element on side 0 of the face. However,
2365  in the actual computation of the integral over the faces, it is
2366  assumed that the vector points in the opposite direction.
2367  Hence the normal vector must be reversed. */
2368  normals[ii++] = -nx*invLenNorm;
2369  normals[ii++] = -ny*invLenNorm;
2370  normals[ii++] = -nz*invLenNorm;
2371  normals[ii++] = lenNorm;
2372  }
2373  break;
2374  }
2375  }
2376 }
2377 
2378 void CMeshFEM::MetricTermsBoundaryFaces(CBoundaryFEM *boundary,
2379  CConfig *config) {
2380 
2381  /* Determine whether or not the viscous terms are needed. */
2382  const bool viscousTerms = (config->GetKind_Solver() != FEM_EULER && config->GetKind_Solver() != DISC_ADJ_FEM_EULER);
2383 
2384  /*--- Loop over the boundary faces stored on this rank. ---*/
2385  for(unsigned long i=0; i<boundary->surfElem.size(); ++i) {
2386 
2387  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2388  /*--- Step 1: Allocate the memory for the face metric terms. ---*/
2389  /*--- Depending on the case, not all of this memory is needed. ---*/
2390  /*--- - Unit normals + area (nDim+1 per integration point) ---*/
2391  /*--- - drdx, dsdx, etc. (nDim*nDim per integration point) ---*/
2392  /*--- - grid velocities in the integration points. ---*/
2393  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2394 
2395  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
2396  relevant information from it. */
2397  const unsigned short ind = boundary->surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
2398  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
2399 
2400  /*--- Allocate the several metric terms. ---*/
2401  boundary->surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.resize(nInt*(nDim+1));
2402 
2403  if( viscousTerms )
2404  boundary->surfElem[i].metricCoorDerivFace.resize(nInt*nDim*nDim);
2405 
2406  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities and initialize them to the
2407  default value of zero. */
2408  boundary->surfElem[i].gridVelocities.assign(nInt*nDim, 0.0);
2409 
2410  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2411  /*--- Step 2: Determine the actual metric data in the integration points ---*/
2412  /*--- of the faces. ---*/
2413  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2414 
2415  /* Call the function ComputeNormalsFace to compute the unit normals and
2416  its corresponding area in the integration points. */
2417  unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
2418  const su2double *dr = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetDrBasisFaceIntegration();
2419  const su2double *ds = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetDsBasisFaceIntegration();
2420 
2421  ComputeNormalsFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, ds, boundary->surfElem[i].DOFsGridFace.data(),
2422  boundary->surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.data());
2423 
2424  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
2425  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
2426  of the face, if needed. */
2427  if( viscousTerms ) {
2428  nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElem();
2429  dr = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegration();
2430 
2431  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr,
2432  boundary->surfElem[i].DOFsGridElement.data(),
2433  boundary->surfElem[i].metricCoorDerivFace.data(),
2434  config);
2435  }
2436  }
2437 }
2438 
2439 void CMeshFEM::SetPositive_ZArea(CConfig *config) {
2440 
2441  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2442  /*--- Step 1: Determine the local contribution to the positive z area. ---*/
2443  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2444 
2445  /* Loop over the boundary markers. */
2446  su2double PositiveZArea = 0.0;
2447  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
2448 
2449  /* Determine whether or not this boundary contributes. */
2450  const unsigned short Boundary = config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker);
2451  const unsigned short Monitoring = config->GetMarker_All_Monitoring(iMarker);
2452 
2453  if( ((Boundary == EULER_WALL) ||
2454  (Boundary == HEAT_FLUX) ||
2455  (Boundary == ISOTHERMAL) ||
2456  (Boundary == LOAD_BOUNDARY) ||
2457  (Boundary == DISPLACEMENT_BOUNDARY)) && (Monitoring == YES) ) {
2458 
2459  /* Easier storage of the surface elements for this marker. */
2460  const vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
2461 
2462  /* Loop over the surface elements. */
2463  for(unsigned long i=0; i<surfElem.size(); ++i) {
2464 
2465  /* Determine the number of integration points and their weights via
2466  the corresponding standard element. */
2467  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
2468  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2469  const su2double *weights = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
2470 
2471  /* Loop over the integration points for this element and update PositiveZArea
2472  if the normal has a negative z-component. In that case it will give a
2473  positive contribution to PositiveZArea as this must take the normal pointing
2474  into the element into account. */
2475  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
2476 
2477  /* Store the normal data for this integration point a bit easier and update
2478  PositiveZArea, if needed. */
2479  const su2double *normal = &surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace[j*(nDim+1)];
2480  if(normal[nDim-1] < 0.0)
2481  PositiveZArea -= weights[j]*normal[nDim-1]*normal[nDim];
2482  }
2483  }
2484  }
2485  }
2486 
2487  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2488  /*--- Step 2: Perform an Allreduce such that the global value of ---*/
2489  /*--- PositiveZArea is known on all ranks. ---*/
2490  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2491 
2492 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
2493  su2double locArea = PositiveZArea;
2494  SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&locArea, &PositiveZArea, 1, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_SUM, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
2495 #endif
2496 
2497  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2498  /*--- Step 3: Set the reference area, if this was not specified and write ---*/
2499  /*--- a message about the projected area if I am the master. ---*/
2500  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2501 
2502  if (config->GetRefArea() == 0.0)
2503  config->SetRefArea(PositiveZArea);
2504 
2505  if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
2506  if (nDim == 2) cout << "Area projection in the y-plane = "<< PositiveZArea << "." << endl;
2507  else cout << "Area projection in the z-plane = "<< PositiveZArea << "." << endl;
2508  }
2509 }
2510 
2511 CMeshFEM_DG::CMeshFEM_DG(CGeometry *geometry, CConfig *config)
2512  : CMeshFEM(geometry, config) {
2513 }
2514 
2515 void CMeshFEM_DG::CoordinatesIntegrationPoints(void) {
2516 
2517  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2518  /*--- Step 1: The integration points of the owned volume elements. ---*/
2519  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2520 
2521  /*--- Loop over the owned elements to compute the coordinates
2522  in the integration points. ---*/
2523  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
2524 
2525  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2526  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
2527  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2528  const su2double *lag = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetBasisFunctionsIntegration();
2529 
2530  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2531  volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim*nInt);
2532 
2533  /* Store the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
2534  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2535  const unsigned long *DOFs = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
2536 
2537  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this element and compute
2538  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2539  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
2540 
2541  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
2542  const unsigned short jj = i*nDOFs;
2543  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDim; ++j) {
2544  coor[j] = 0.0;
2545  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
2546  coor[j] += lag[jj+k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2547  }
2548  }
2549  }
2550 
2551  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2552  /*--- Step 2: The integration points of the internal matching faces. ---*/
2553  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2554 
2555  /*--- Loop over the internal matching faces to compute the coordinates
2556  in the integration points. ---*/
2557  for(unsigned long l=0; l<matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
2558 
2559  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2560  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
2561  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2562  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
2563  const su2double *lag = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
2564 
2565  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2566  matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim*nInt);
2567 
2568  /* Store the grid DOFs of this face a bit easier. */
2569  const unsigned long *DOFs = matchingFaces[l].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data();
2570 
2571  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this face and compute
2572  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2573  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
2574 
2575  su2double *coor = matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
2576  const unsigned short jj = i*nDOFs;
2577  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDim; ++j) {
2578  coor[j] = 0.0;
2579  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
2580  coor[j] += lag[jj+k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2581  }
2582  }
2583  }
2584 
2585  /*-------------------------------------------------------------*/
2586  /*--- Step 3: The integration points of the boundary faces. ---*/
2587  /*-------------------------------------------------------------*/
2588 
2589  /*--- Loop over the boundary markers. Make sure to exclude the periodic
2590  boundaries, because these are not physical. ---*/
2591  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
2592  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
2593 
2594  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
2595  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
2596 
2597  /* Loop over the boundary faces and determine the coordinates
2598  in the integration points. */
2599  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
2600 
2601  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2602  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
2603  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
2604  const unsigned short nDOFs = surfElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2605  const su2double *lag = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegration();
2606 
2607  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the integration points. */
2608  surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.resize(nDim*nInt);
2609 
2610  /* Store the grid DOFs of this face a bit easier. */
2611  const unsigned long *DOFs = surfElem[l].DOFsGridFace.data();
2612 
2613  /*--- Loop over the integration points of this face and compute
2614  the coordinates of the integration points. */
2615  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
2616 
2617  su2double *coor = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
2618  const unsigned short jj = i*nDOFs;
2619  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDim; ++j) {
2620  coor[j] = 0.0;
2621  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
2622  coor[j] += lag[jj+k]*meshPoints[DOFs[k]].coor[j];
2623  }
2624  }
2625  }
2626  }
2627  }
2628 }
2629 
2630 void CMeshFEM_DG::CoordinatesSolDOFs(void) {
2631 
2632  /*--- Loop over the owned elements to compute the coordinates
2633  of the solution DOFs. ---*/
2634  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
2635 
2636  /* Store the grid DOFs and the number of solDOFS a bit easier. */
2637  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[l].nDOFsGrid;
2638  const unsigned short nDOFsSol = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
2639  const unsigned long *DOFsGrid = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
2640 
2641  /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
2642  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
2643  const su2double *lag = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetBasisFunctionsSolDOFs();
2644 
2645  /* Allocate the memory for the coordinates of the solution DOFs. */
2646  volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.resize(nDim*nDOFsSol);
2647 
2648  /*--- Loop over the solution DOFs of this element and compute the
2649  coordinates. Note that in case the polynomial degree of the grid
2650  and solution is the same the grid DOFs and solution DOFs coincide
2651  and the interpolation boils down to a copy of the coordinates. ---*/
2652  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsSol; ++i) {
2653 
2654  su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
2655  const unsigned short jj = i*nDOFsGrid;
2656  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDim; ++j) {
2657  coor[j] = 0.0;
2658  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFsGrid; ++k)
2659  coor[j] += lag[jj+k]*meshPoints[DOFsGrid[k]].coor[j];
2660  }
2661  }
2662  }
2663 }
2664 
2665 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateFaces(CConfig *config) {
2666 
2667  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2668  /*--- Step 1: Determine the faces of the locally stored part of the grid. ---*/
2669  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2670 
2671  /*--- Loop over the volume elements stored on this rank, including the halos. ---*/
2672  vector<CFaceOfElement> localFaces;
2673 
2674  for(unsigned long k=0; k<nVolElemTot; ++k) {
2675 
2676  /* Determine the corner points of all the faces of this element. */
2677  unsigned short nFaces;
2678  unsigned short nPointsPerFace[6];
2679  unsigned long faceConn[6][4];
2680 
2681  volElem[k].GetCornerPointsAllFaces(nFaces, nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2682 
2683  /* Loop over the faces of this element, set the appropriate information,
2684  create a unique numbering and add the faces to localFaces. */
2685  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nFaces; ++i) {
2686  CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2687  thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace[i];
2688  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nPointsPerFace[i]; ++j)
2689  thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[i][j];
2690 
2691  /* Copy the data from the volume element. */
2692  thisFace.elemID0 = k;
2693  thisFace.nPolyGrid0 = volElem[k].nPolyGrid;
2694  thisFace.nPolySol0 = volElem[k].nPolySol;
2695  thisFace.nDOFsElem0 = volElem[k].nDOFsSol;
2696  thisFace.elemType0 = volElem[k].VTK_Type;
2697  thisFace.faceID0 = i;
2698  thisFace.faceIndicator = -2; // Initialized to an invalid face.
2699 
2700  thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = volElem[k].JacFacesIsConsideredConstant[i];
2701  thisFace.elem0IsOwner = volElem[k].ElementOwnsFaces[i];
2702 
2703  /* Determine whether or not the integration rule for straight and curved
2704  faces is the same. If that is the case, the value of JacFaceIsConsideredConstant
2705  is set to false. Hence it is only needed to carry out this check for faces
2706  with a constant Jacobian. This is done to reduce the number of standard elements. */
2707  if( thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant ) {
2708 
2709  unsigned short orderExactStraight =
2710  (unsigned short) ceil(thisFace.nPolyGrid0*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
2711  unsigned short orderExactCurved =
2712  (unsigned short) ceil(thisFace.nPolyGrid0*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
2713 
2714  if(orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved) {
2715  orderExactStraight =
2716  (unsigned short) ceil(thisFace.nPolySol0*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Straight());
2717  orderExactCurved =
2718  (unsigned short) ceil(thisFace.nPolySol0*config->GetQuadrature_Factor_Curved());
2719  if(orderExactStraight == orderExactCurved)
2720  thisFace.JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = false;
2721  }
2722  }
2723 
2724  /* Renumber the corner points of the face, but keep the orientation.
2725  Afterwards, add it to localFaces. */
2726  thisFace.CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation();
2727 
2728  localFaces.push_back(thisFace);
2729  }
2730  }
2731 
2732  /*--- Sort the the local faces in increasing order. ---*/
2733  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
2734 
2735  /*--- Loop over the faces to merge the matching faces. ---*/
2736  for(unsigned long i=1; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2737 
2738  /* Check for a matching face with the previous face in the vector.
2739  Note that the == operator only checks the node IDs. */
2740  if(localFaces[i] == localFaces[i-1]) {
2741 
2742  /* Faces are matching. Check if it should be kept, i.e. if one
2743  of the elements owns the face. */
2744  if(localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner || localFaces[i-1].elem0IsOwner) {
2745 
2746  /* Store the data for this matching face in faces[i-1]. */
2747  if(localFaces[i].elemID0 < nVolElemTot) {
2748  localFaces[i-1].elemID0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
2749  localFaces[i-1].nPolyGrid0 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0;
2750  localFaces[i-1].nPolySol0 = localFaces[i].nPolySol0;
2751  localFaces[i-1].nDOFsElem0 = localFaces[i].nDOFsElem0;
2752  localFaces[i-1].elemType0 = localFaces[i].elemType0;
2753  localFaces[i-1].faceID0 = localFaces[i].faceID0;
2754  localFaces[i-1].elem0IsOwner = localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner;
2755  }
2756  else {
2757  localFaces[i-1].elemID1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
2758  localFaces[i-1].nPolyGrid1 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1;
2759  localFaces[i-1].nPolySol1 = localFaces[i].nPolySol1;
2760  localFaces[i-1].nDOFsElem1 = localFaces[i].nDOFsElem1;
2761  localFaces[i-1].elemType1 = localFaces[i].elemType1;
2762  localFaces[i-1].faceID1 = localFaces[i].faceID1;
2763  }
2764 
2765  /* Adapt the boolean to indicate whether or not the face has a constant
2766  Jacobian of the transformation, although in principle this info
2767  should be the same for both faces. */
2768  if( !(localFaces[i-1].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant &&
2769  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant) ) {
2770  localFaces[i-1].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant = false;
2771  }
2772 
2773  /* Set this face indicator to -1 to indicate an internal face
2774  and set elem0IsOwner for localFaces[i] to false. */
2775  localFaces[i-1].faceIndicator = -1;
2776  localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = false;
2777  }
2778  }
2779  }
2780 
2781  /*--- Loop over the boundary markers and its boundary elements to search for
2782  the corresponding faces in localFaces. These faces should be found.
2783  Note that periodic boundaries are skipped, because these are treated
2784  via the halo elements, which are already in place. ---*/
2785  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
2786  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
2787 
2788  for(unsigned long k=0; k<boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size(); ++k) {
2789 
2790  /* Determine the corner points of the face of this element. */
2791  unsigned short nPointsPerFace;
2792  unsigned long faceConn[4];
2793 
2794  boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].GetCornerPointsFace(nPointsPerFace, faceConn);
2795 
2796  /* Create an object of CFaceOfElement to carry out the search. */
2797  CFaceOfElement thisFace;
2798  thisFace.nCornerPoints = nPointsPerFace;
2799  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nPointsPerFace; ++j)
2800  thisFace.cornerPoints[j] = faceConn[j];
2801  thisFace.CreateUniqueNumberingWithOrientation();
2802 
2803  /* Search for thisFace in localFaces. It must be found. */
2804  if( binary_search(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace) ) {
2805  vector<CFaceOfElement>::iterator low;
2806  low = lower_bound(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(), thisFace);
2807  low->faceIndicator = iMarker;
2808 
2809  /* A few additional checks. */
2810  bool side0IsBoundary = low->elemID0 < nVolElemTot;
2811  unsigned long elemID = side0IsBoundary ? low->elemID0 : low->elemID1;
2812  unsigned short nPoly = side0IsBoundary ? low->nPolyGrid0 : low->nPolyGrid1;
2813 
2814  if(elemID != boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].volElemID ||
2815  nPoly != boundaries[iMarker].surfElem[k].nPolyGrid)
2816  SU2_MPI::Error(string("Element ID and/or polynomial degree do not match ") +
2817  string("for this boundary element. This should not happen."),
2818  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2819  }
2820  else
2821  SU2_MPI::Error("Boundary face not found in localFaces. This should not happen.",
2822  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
2823  }
2824  }
2825  }
2826 
2827  /*--- It is possible that owned non-matching faces are present in the list.
2828  These faces are indicated by an owned face and a faceIndicator of -2.
2829  To avoid that these faces are removed afterwards, set their
2830  faceIndicator to -1. ---*/
2831  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2832  if(localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -2 && localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner)
2833  localFaces[i].faceIndicator = -1;
2834  }
2835 
2836  /*--- Remove the invalid faces. This is accomplished by giving the face four
2837  points and global node ID's that are larger than the largest local point
2838  ID in the grid. In this way the sorting operator puts these faces at the
2839  end of the vector, see also the < operator of CFaceOfElement. ---*/
2840  unsigned long nFacesLoc = localFaces.size();
2841  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2842  if(localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -2) {
2843  unsigned long invalID = meshPoints.size();
2844  localFaces[i].nCornerPoints = 4;
2845  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = invalID;
2846  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = invalID;
2847  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = invalID;
2848  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[3] = invalID;
2849  --nFacesLoc;
2850  }
2851  }
2852 
2853  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end());
2854  localFaces.resize(nFacesLoc);
2855 
2856  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2857  /*--- Step 2: Preparation of the localFaces vector, such that the info ---*/
2858  /*--- stored in this vector can be separated in a contribution ---*/
2859  /*--- from the internal faces and a contribution from the faces ---*/
2860  /*--- that belong to physical boundaries. ---*/
2861  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
2862 
2863  /* Sort localFaces again, but now such that the boundary faces are numbered
2864  first, followed by the matching faces and at the end of localFaces the
2865  non-matching faces are stored. In order to carry out this sorting the
2866  functor CSortFaces is used for comparison. Within the categories
2867  the sorting depends on the time levels of the adjacent volume elements
2868  of the face. */
2869  sort(localFaces.begin(), localFaces.end(),
2870  CSortFaces(nVolElemOwned, nVolElemTot, volElem.data()));
2871 
2872  /*--- Carry out a possible swap of side 0 and side 1 of the faces. This is
2873  done for the following reasons (in order of importance).
2874  1: The element on side 0 must always be an owned element.
2875  2: The VTK type of the element on side 0 must be less than or equal
2876  to the VTK type of the element on side 1. This is done to reduce
2877  the number of standard elements for the matching faces.
2878  3: For the same VTK types the element on side 0 must be the smallest.
2879 
2880  Furthermore, make sure that for boundary faces and non-matching faces
2881  the corresponding element is always on side 0. ---*/
2882  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2883 
2884  /* Determine whether or not the ajacent elements must be swapped. */
2885  bool swapElements;
2886  if(localFaces[i].elemID0 < nVolElemTot &&
2887  localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot) {
2888 
2889  /* This is an internal matching face. First check if one of the adjacent
2890  elements is not an owned element. */
2891  if(localFaces[i].elemID0 >= nVolElemOwned ||
2892  localFaces[i].elemID1 >= nVolElemOwned) {
2893 
2894  /* One of the element is not owned. Make sure that the owned element
2895  is on side 0. */
2896  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID0 > localFaces[i].elemID1;
2897  }
2898  else if(localFaces[i].elemType0 == localFaces[i].elemType1) {
2899 
2900  /* The same element type on both sides. Make sure that the element
2901  with the smallest ID is stored on side 0 of the face. */
2902  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID0 > localFaces[i].elemID1;
2903  }
2904  else {
2905  /* Different element types. Make sure that the lowest element
2906  type will be stored on side 0 of the face. */
2907  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemType0 > localFaces[i].elemType1;
2908  }
2909  }
2910  else {
2911 
2912  /* Either a boundary face or a non-matching face. It must be swapped
2913  if the element is currently on side 1 of the face. */
2914  swapElements = localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot;
2915  }
2916 
2917  /* Swap the adjacent elements of the face, if needed. Note that
2918  also the sequence of the corner points must be altered in order
2919  to obey the right hand rule. */
2920  if( swapElements ) {
2921  swap(localFaces[i].elemID0, localFaces[i].elemID1);
2922  swap(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0, localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1);
2923  swap(localFaces[i].nPolySol0, localFaces[i].nPolySol1);
2924  swap(localFaces[i].nDOFsElem0, localFaces[i].nDOFsElem1);
2925  swap(localFaces[i].elemType0, localFaces[i].elemType1);
2926  swap(localFaces[i].faceID0, localFaces[i].faceID1);
2927 
2928  if(localFaces[i].nCornerPoints == 2)
2929  swap(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0], localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1]);
2930  else
2931  swap(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0], localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]);
2932 
2933  localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner = !localFaces[i].elem0IsOwner;
2934  }
2935  }
2936 
2937  /*--- For triangular faces with a pyramid as an adjacent element, it must be
2938  made sure that the first corner point does not coincide with the top of
2939  the pyramid. Otherwise it is impossible to carry the transformation to
2940  the standard pyramid element. ---*/
2941  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
2942 
2943  /* Check for a triangular face. */
2944  if(localFaces[i].nCornerPoints == 3) {
2945 
2946  /* Determine if the corner points correspond to a corner point of a
2947  pyramid. A pyramid can in principle occur on both sides of the face. */
2948  bool cornerIsTopPyramid[] = {false, false, false};
2949 
2950  if(localFaces[i].elemType0 == PYRAMID) {
2951  unsigned long topPyramid = volElem[localFaces[i].elemID0].nodeIDsGrid.back();
2952  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[0] = true;
2953  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[1] = true;
2954  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[2] = true;
2955  }
2956 
2957  if(localFaces[i].elemType1 == PYRAMID) {
2958  unsigned long topPyramid = volElem[localFaces[i].elemID1].nodeIDsGrid.back();
2959  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[0] = true;
2960  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[1] = true;
2961  if(localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] == topPyramid) cornerIsTopPyramid[2] = true;
2962  }
2963 
2964  /* Check if the first element corresponds to the top of a pyramid. */
2965  if( cornerIsTopPyramid[0] ) {
2966 
2967  /* The sequence of the points of the face must be altered. It is done in
2968  such a way that the orientation remains the same. Store the original
2969  point numbering. */
2970  unsigned long tmp[] = {localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0],
2971  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1],
2972  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]};
2973 
2974  /* Determine the situation. */
2975  if( !cornerIsTopPyramid[1] ) {
2976 
2977  /* cornerPoint[1] is not a top of a pyramid. Hence this will become
2978  the point 0 of the triangle. */
2979  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[1];
2980  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[2];
2981  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[0];
2982  }
2983  else {
2984 
2985  /* Only cornerPoint[2] is not a top of a pyramid. Hence this will
2986  become point 0 of the triangle. */
2987  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[2];
2988  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[0];
2989  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[1];
2990  }
2991  }
2992  else if(cornerIsTopPyramid[1] && !cornerIsTopPyramid[2]) {
2993 
2994  /* cornerPoint[1] is a top of a pyramid and the other two corners
2995  are not. Change the sequence, such that cornerPoint[2] will become
2996  point 0 of the triangle. */
2997  unsigned long tmp[] = {localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0],
2998  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1],
2999  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2]};
3000  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[0] = tmp[2];
3001  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[1] = tmp[0];
3002  localFaces[i].cornerPoints[2] = tmp[1];
3003  }
3004  }
3005  }
3006 
3007  /*--- Determine the number of matching and non-matching internal faces.
3008  For the matching faces, determine these numbers per time level
3009  and also make a distinction between internal faces and faces that
3010  involve a halo element. ---*/
3011  const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
3012  nMatchingFacesInternal.assign(nTimeLevels+1, 0);
3013  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem.assign(nTimeLevels+1, 0);
3014 
3015  unsigned long nNonMatchingFaces = 0;
3016  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
3017  if(localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -1) {
3018  const unsigned long e0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
3019  const unsigned long e1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
3020 
3021  if(e1 < nVolElemTot) {
3022  const unsigned short timeLevel = min(volElem[e0].timeLevel,
3023  volElem[e1].timeLevel);
3024  if(e1 < nVolElemOwned) ++nMatchingFacesInternal[timeLevel+1];
3025  else ++nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[timeLevel+1];
3026  }
3027  else ++nNonMatchingFaces;
3028  }
3029  }
3030 
3031  if( nNonMatchingFaces ) {
3032  ostringstream message;
3033  message << nNonMatchingFaces << " non-matching internal faces found.\n"
3034  << "This is not supported yet." << endl;
3035  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3036  }
3037 
3038  /* Put nMatchingFacesInternal and nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem in
3039  cumulative storage format. */
3040  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
3041  nMatchingFacesInternal[i+1] += nMatchingFacesInternal[i];
3042 
3043  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[0] = nMatchingFacesInternal[nTimeLevels];
3044  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
3045  nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i+1] += nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i];
3046 
3047  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3048  /*--- Step 3: Create the local face based data structure for the internal ---*/
3049  /*--- faces. These are needed for the computation of the surface ---*/
3050  /*--- integral in DG-FEM. ---*/
3051  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3052 
3053  /* Allocate the memory for the matching faces. */
3054  matchingFaces.resize(nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[nTimeLevels]);
3055 
3056  /*--- Loop over the volume elements to determine the maximum number
3057  of DOFs for the volume elements. Allocate the memory for the
3058  vector used to store the DOFs of the element. ---*/
3059  unsigned short nDOFsVolMax = 0;
3060  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3061  nDOFsVolMax = max(nDOFsVolMax, volElem[i].nDOFsGrid);
3062  nDOFsVolMax = max(nDOFsVolMax, volElem[i].nDOFsSol);
3063  }
3064 
3065  vector<unsigned long> DOFsElem(nDOFsVolMax);
3066 
3067  /*--- Loop over localFaces to create the connectivity information, which
3068  is stored in matchingFaces. ---*/
3069  unsigned long ii = 0;
3070  for(unsigned long i=0; i<localFaces.size(); ++i) {
3071  if(localFaces[i].faceIndicator == -1 && localFaces[i].elemID1 < nVolElemTot) {
3072 
3073  /*--- Determine the number of DOFs on both sides of the face for both the
3074  grid and solution. This value depends on the face type. ---*/
3075  unsigned short sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = 0, sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = 0;
3076  unsigned short sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = 0, sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = 0;
3077 
3078  unsigned short VTK_Type = 0; // To avoid a compiler warning.
3079  switch( localFaces[i].nCornerPoints ) {
3080  case 2:
3081  /* Face is a line. */
3082  VTK_Type = LINE;
3083  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1;
3084  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1 + 1;
3085  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1;
3086  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = localFaces[i].nPolySol1 + 1;
3087  break;
3088 
3089  case 3:
3090  /* Face is a triangle. */
3091  VTK_Type = TRIANGLE;
3092  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+2)/2;
3093  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1+2)/2;
3094  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +2)/2;
3095  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol1 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol1 +2)/2;
3096  break;
3097 
3098  case 4:
3099  /* Face is a quadrilateral. */
3100  VTK_Type = QUADRILATERAL;
3101  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1);
3102  sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1+1);
3103  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1);
3104  sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1 = (localFaces[i].nPolySol1 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol1 +1);
3105  break;
3106  }
3107 
3108  /* Abbreviate the adjacent element ID's and store them in matchingFaces. */
3109  const unsigned long v0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
3110  const unsigned long v1 = localFaces[i].elemID1;
3111 
3112  matchingFaces[ii].elemID0 = v0;
3113  matchingFaces[ii].elemID1 = v1;
3114 
3115  /* Allocate the memory for the connectivities of the face. */
3116  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide0.resize(sizeDOFsGridFaceSide0);
3117  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide1.resize(sizeDOFsGridFaceSide1);
3118  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide0.resize(sizeDOFsSolFaceSide0);
3119  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide1.resize(sizeDOFsSolFaceSide1);
3120 
3121  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide0.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid);
3122  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide1.resize(volElem[v1].nDOFsGrid);
3123  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide0.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsSol);
3124  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide1.resize(volElem[v1].nDOFsSol);
3125 
3126  /*--- Create the connectivities of the adjacent elements in the correct
3127  sequence as well as the connectivities of the face. The
3128  connectivities of both sides of the face are determined for the
3129  grid and solution. First for side 0. ---*/
3130  bool swapFaceInElementSide0;
3131  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v0].nDOFsSol; ++j)
3132  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
3133 
3134  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3135  volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3136  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolySol,
3137  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide0,
3138  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide0.data(),
3139  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide0.data());
3140 
3141  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid; ++j)
3142  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid[j];
3143 
3144  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3145  volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3146  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3147  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide0,
3148  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data(),
3149  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide0.data());
3150 
3151  /*--- And also for side 1 of the face. ---*/
3152  bool swapFaceInElementSide1;
3153  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v1].nDOFsSol; ++j)
3154  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v1].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
3155 
3156  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3157  volElem[v1].VTK_Type, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid,
3158  volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v1].nPolySol,
3159  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide1,
3160  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolFaceSide1.data(),
3161  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsSolElementSide1.data());
3162 
3163  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v1].nDOFsGrid; ++j)
3164  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid[j];
3165 
3166  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3167  volElem[v1].VTK_Type, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid,
3168  volElem[v1].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v1].nPolyGrid,
3169  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElementSide1,
3170  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridFaceSide1.data(),
3171  matchingFaces[ii].DOFsGridElementSide1.data());
3172 
3173  /*--- Search in the standard elements for faces for a matching
3174  standard element. If not found, create a new standard element.
3175  Note that both the grid and the solution representation must
3176  match with the standard element. ---*/
3177  unsigned long j;
3178  for(j=0; j<standardMatchingFacesSol.size(); ++j) {
3179  if(standardMatchingFacesSol[j].SameStandardMatchingFace(VTK_Type,
3180  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3181  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3182  localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3183  localFaces[i].elemType1,
3184  localFaces[i].nPolySol1,
3185  swapFaceInElementSide0,
3186  swapFaceInElementSide1) &&
3187  standardMatchingFacesGrid[j].SameStandardMatchingFace(VTK_Type,
3188  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3189  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3190  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3191  localFaces[i].elemType1,
3192  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1,
3193  swapFaceInElementSide0,
3194  swapFaceInElementSide1) ) {
3195  matchingFaces[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3196  break;
3197  }
3198  }
3199 
3200  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
3201  if(j == standardMatchingFacesSol.size()) {
3202 
3203  standardMatchingFacesSol.push_back(CFEMStandardInternalFace(VTK_Type,
3204  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3205  localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3206  localFaces[i].elemType1,
3207  localFaces[i].nPolySol1,
3208  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3209  swapFaceInElementSide0,
3210  swapFaceInElementSide1,
3211  config) );
3212 
3213  standardMatchingFacesGrid.push_back(CFEMStandardInternalFace(VTK_Type,
3214  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3215  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3216  localFaces[i].elemType1,
3217  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid1,
3218  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3219  swapFaceInElementSide0,
3220  swapFaceInElementSide1,
3221  config,
3222  standardMatchingFacesSol[j].GetOrderExact()) );
3223  matchingFaces[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3224  }
3225 
3226  /* Update the counter ii for the next internal matching face. */
3227  ++ii;
3228  }
3229  }
3230 
3231  /* Carry out an additional sorting of matchingFaces, such that faces with the
3232  same standard face are contiguous in memory as much as possible. This allows
3233  for a simultaneous treatment of faces, which increases the gemm performance.
3234  Note that this sorting takes place for each time level, because the grouping
3235  of faces per time level is essential for the correct functioning of the code.
3236  The same holds for the distinction between internal faces and faces that
3237  are adjacent to a halo element. */
3238  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i) {
3239  sort(matchingFaces.begin()+nMatchingFacesInternal[i],
3240  matchingFaces.begin()+nMatchingFacesInternal[i+1]);
3241 
3242  sort(matchingFaces.begin()+nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i],
3243  matchingFaces.begin()+nMatchingFacesWithHaloElem[i+1]);
3244  }
3245 
3246  /* Loop over the faces to flag the elements that share one or more faces
3247  with elements from a lower time level. */
3248  vector<bool> elemAdjLowTimeLevel(nVolElemTot, false);
3249  for(unsigned long i=0; i<matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
3250  const unsigned long e0 = matchingFaces[i].elemID0;
3251  const unsigned long e1 = matchingFaces[i].elemID1;
3252 
3253  if(volElem[e0].timeLevel > volElem[e1].timeLevel) elemAdjLowTimeLevel[e0] = true;
3254  if(volElem[e1].timeLevel > volElem[e0].timeLevel) elemAdjLowTimeLevel[e1] = true;
3255  }
3256 
3257  /* Determine the list of elements per time level, which share one or more
3258  faces with elements of the lower time level. Make a distinction between
3259  owned and halo elements. */
3260  ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
3261  haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel.resize(nTimeLevels);
3262 
3263  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
3264  if( elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i] )
3265  ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel].push_back(i);
3266  }
3267 
3268  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3269  if( elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i] )
3270  haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[volElem[i].timeLevel].push_back(i);
3271  }
3272 
3273  /* Determine the offsets of the solution DOFs in the solution working vectors
3274  of the solver for the different time levels. These are needed when time
3275  accurate local time stepping is employed. */
3276  vector<unsigned long> counterDOFs(nTimeLevels, 0);
3277 
3278  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3279  const unsigned short lev = volElem[i].timeLevel;
3280  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel = counterDOFs[lev];
3281  counterDOFs[lev] += volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
3282 
3283  if( elemAdjLowTimeLevel[i] ) {
3284  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel = counterDOFs[lev-1];
3285  counterDOFs[lev-1] += volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
3286  }
3287  else {
3288  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel = ULONG_MAX;
3289  }
3290  }
3291 
3292  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3293  /*--- Step 4: Create the local face based data structure for the faces ---*/
3294  /*--- that belong to the physical boundaries. ---*/
3295  /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3296 
3297  /* Loop over the boundary markers. ---*/
3298  unsigned long indBegMarker = 0;
3299  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3300 
3301  /* Initialize the number of surface elements per time level to zero. */
3302  boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem.assign(nTimeLevels+1, 0);
3303 
3304  /*--- The periodic boundaries are skipped, because these are not physical
3305  boundaries and are treated via the halo elements. These have already
3306  been created. ---*/
3307  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
3308 
3309  /* Determine the end index for this marker in localFaces. Note that
3310  localFaces is sorted such that the boundary faces are first and
3311  also grouped per boundary, see the functor CSortFaces. */
3312  unsigned long indEndMarker = indBegMarker;
3313  for(; indEndMarker<localFaces.size(); ++indEndMarker) {
3314  if(localFaces[indEndMarker].faceIndicator != (short) iMarker) break;
3315  }
3316 
3317  /* Easier storage of the surface elements for this boundary. */
3318  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
3319 
3320  /*--- Loop over range in localFaces for this boundary marker and create
3321  the connectivity information, which is stored in surfElem. ---*/
3322  for(unsigned long i=indBegMarker; i<indEndMarker; ++i) {
3323 
3324  /* Determine the time level of the adjacent element and increment
3325  the number of surface elements for this time level. The +1 is there,
3326  because this vector will be put in cumulative storage format
3327  afterwards. */
3328  ii = i - indBegMarker;
3329  const unsigned short timeLevel = volElem[surfElem[ii].volElemID].timeLevel;
3330  ++boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[timeLevel+1];
3331 
3332  /*--- Determine the number of DOFs of the face for both the grid
3333  and solution. This value depends on the face type. ---*/
3334  unsigned short sizeDOFsGridFace = 0, sizeDOFsSolFace = 0;
3335 
3336  unsigned short VTK_Type = 0; // To avoid a compiler warning.
3337  switch( localFaces[i].nCornerPoints ) {
3338  case 2:
3339  /* Face is a line. */
3340  VTK_Type = LINE;
3341  sizeDOFsGridFace = localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0 + 1;
3342  sizeDOFsSolFace = localFaces[i].nPolySol0 + 1;
3343  break;
3344 
3345  case 3:
3346  /* Face is a triangle. */
3347  VTK_Type = TRIANGLE;
3348  sizeDOFsGridFace = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+2)/2;
3349  sizeDOFsSolFace = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +2)/2;
3350  break;
3351 
3352  case 4:
3353  /* Face is a quadrilateral. */
3354  VTK_Type = QUADRILATERAL;
3355  sizeDOFsGridFace = (localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1)*(localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0+1);
3356  sizeDOFsSolFace = (localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1)*(localFaces[i].nPolySol0 +1);
3357  break;
3358  }
3359 
3360  /* Abbreviate the adjacent element ID. */
3361  const unsigned long v0 = localFaces[i].elemID0;
3362 
3363  /* Allocate the memory for the connectivities of the face. */
3364  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridFace.resize(sizeDOFsGridFace);
3365  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolFace.resize(sizeDOFsSolFace);
3366 
3367  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridElement.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid);
3368  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolElement.resize(volElem[v0].nDOFsSol);
3369 
3370  /*--- Create the connectivities of the adjacent element in the correct
3371  sequence as well as the connectivities of the face. The
3372  connectivities are determined for the grid and solution. ---*/
3373  bool swapFaceInElement;
3374  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v0].nDOFsSol; ++j)
3375  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].offsetDOFsSolLocal + j;
3376 
3377  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3378  volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3379  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolySol,
3380  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElement,
3381  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolFace.data(),
3382  surfElem[ii].DOFsSolElement.data());
3383 
3384  for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[v0].nDOFsGrid; ++j)
3385  DOFsElem[j] = volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid[j];
3386 
3387  CreateConnectivitiesFace(VTK_Type, localFaces[i].cornerPoints,
3388  volElem[v0].VTK_Type, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3389  volElem[v0].nodeIDsGrid, volElem[v0].nPolyGrid,
3390  DOFsElem.data(), swapFaceInElement,
3391  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridFace.data(),
3392  surfElem[ii].DOFsGridElement.data());
3393 
3394  /*--- Search in the standard elements for boundary faces for a matching
3395  standard element. If not found, create a new standard element.
3396  Note that both the grid and the solution representation must
3397  match with the standard element. ---*/
3398  unsigned long j;
3399  for(j=0; j<standardBoundaryFacesSol.size(); ++j) {
3400  if(standardBoundaryFacesSol[j].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type,
3401  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3402  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3403  localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3404  swapFaceInElement) &&
3405  standardBoundaryFacesGrid[j].SameStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type,
3406  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3407  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3408  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3409  swapFaceInElement) ) {
3410  surfElem[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3411  break;
3412  }
3413  }
3414 
3415  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
3416  if(j == standardBoundaryFacesSol.size()) {
3417 
3418  standardBoundaryFacesSol.push_back(CFEMStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type,
3419  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3420  localFaces[i].nPolySol0,
3421  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3422  swapFaceInElement,
3423  config) );
3424 
3425  standardBoundaryFacesGrid.push_back(CFEMStandardBoundaryFace(VTK_Type,
3426  localFaces[i].elemType0,
3427  localFaces[i].nPolyGrid0,
3428  localFaces[i].JacFaceIsConsideredConstant,
3429  swapFaceInElement,
3430  config,
3431  standardBoundaryFacesSol[j].GetOrderExact()) );
3432  surfElem[ii].indStandardElement = j;
3433  }
3434  }
3435 
3436  /* Set indBegMarker to indEndMarker for the next marker. */
3437  indBegMarker = indEndMarker;
3438 
3439  /* Put boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem in cumulative storage. */
3440  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
3441  boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i+1] += boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i];
3442 
3443  /* Carry out another sort of the surface elements, such that surface elements
3444  belonging to the same standard element are contiguous in memory. In this
3445  way a simultaneous treatment of several surface elements is possible, which
3446  increases the performance. Note that this renumbering must happen within
3447  each time level. */
3448  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeLevels; ++i)
3449  sort(surfElem.begin()+boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i],
3450  surfElem.begin()+boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[i+1],
3451  CSortBoundaryFaces());
3452  }
3453  }
3454 }
3455 
3456 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateStandardVolumeElements(CConfig *config) {
3457 
3458  /*--- Loop over the volume elements and create new standard elements if needed.
3459  Note that a new standard element is created when either the solution
3460  element or the grid element does not match. Note further that for the
3461  standard element of the grid the order for the integration of the
3462  solution is used, such that the metric terms are computed in the correct
3463  integration points in case the polynomial order of the solution differs
3464  from that of the grid. ---*/
3465  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3466 
3467  /* Check the existing standard elements in the list. */
3468  unsigned long j;
3469  for(j=0; j<standardElementsSol.size(); ++j) {
3470  if(standardElementsSol[j].SameStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type,
3471  volElem[i].nPolySol,
3472  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant) &&
3473  standardElementsGrid[j].SameStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type,
3474  volElem[i].nPolyGrid,
3475  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant) ) {
3476  volElem[i].indStandardElement = j;
3477  break;
3478  }
3479  }
3480 
3481  /* Create the new standard elements if no match was found. */
3482  if(j == standardElementsSol.size()) {
3483 
3484  standardElementsSol.push_back(CFEMStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type,
3485  volElem[i].nPolySol,
3486  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant,
3487  config) );
3488 
3489  standardElementsGrid.push_back(CFEMStandardElement(volElem[i].VTK_Type,
3490  volElem[i].nPolyGrid,
3491  volElem[i].JacIsConsideredConstant,
3492  config,
3493  standardElementsSol[j].GetOrderExact(),
3494  standardElementsSol[j].GetRDOFs(),
3495  standardElementsSol[j].GetSDOFs(),
3496  standardElementsSol[j].GetTDOFs()) );
3497  volElem[i].indStandardElement = j;
3498  }
3499  }
3500 }
3501 
3502 void CMeshFEM_DG::SetSendReceive(CConfig *config) {
3503 
3504  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3505  /*--- Step 1: Determine the ranks from which this rank has to receive data ---*/
3506  /*--- during the actual communication of halo data, as well as the ---*/
3507  /* data that must be communicated. ---*/
3508  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3509 
3510  /* Determine for every element the local offset of the solution DOFs.
3511  The if statement in the line below is to avoid problems when the
3512  partition is empty. */
3513  if( nVolElemTot ) volElem[0].offsetDOFsSolLocal = 0;
3514  for(unsigned long i=1; i<nVolElemTot; ++i)
3515  volElem[i].offsetDOFsSolLocal = volElem[i-1].offsetDOFsSolLocal
3516  + volElem[i-1].nDOFsSol;
3517 
3518  /* Determine the ranks from which this rank will receive halo data. */
3519  vector<int> recvFromRank(size, 0);
3520  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i)
3521  recvFromRank[volElem[i].rankOriginal] = 1;
3522 
3523  map<int,int> rankToIndRecvBuf;
3524  for(int i=0; i<size; ++i) {
3525  if( recvFromRank[i] ) {
3526  int ind = rankToIndRecvBuf.size();
3527  rankToIndRecvBuf[i] = ind;
3528  }
3529  }
3530 
3531  ranksRecv.resize(rankToIndRecvBuf.size());
3532  map<int,int>::const_iterator MI = rankToIndRecvBuf.begin();
3533  for(unsigned long i=0; i<rankToIndRecvBuf.size(); ++i, ++MI)
3534  ranksRecv[i] = MI->first;
3535 
3536  /* Define and determine the buffers to send the global indices of my halo
3537  elements to the appropriate ranks and the vectors which store the
3538  elements that I will receive from these ranks. */
3539  vector<vector<unsigned long> > longBuf(rankToIndRecvBuf.size(), vector<unsigned long>(0));
3540  entitiesRecv.resize(rankToIndRecvBuf.size());
3541 
3542  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3543  MI = rankToIndRecvBuf.find(volElem[i].rankOriginal);
3544  longBuf[MI->second].push_back(volElem[i].elemIDGlobal);
3545 
3546  entitiesRecv[MI->second].push_back(i);
3547  }
3548 
3549  /* Determine the mapping from global element ID to local owned element ID. */
3550  map<unsigned long,unsigned long> globalElemIDToLocalInd;
3551  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i)
3552  globalElemIDToLocalInd[volElem[i].elemIDGlobal] = i;
3553 
3554 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
3555 
3556  /*--- Parallel mode. First determine the number of ranks to which this
3557  rank has to send halo data during the actual exchange. ---*/
3558  int nRankSend;
3559  vector<int> sizeReduce(size, 1);
3560 
3561  SU2_MPI::Reduce_scatter(recvFromRank.data(), &nRankSend, sizeReduce.data(),
3562  MPI_INT, MPI_SUM, MPI_COMM_WORLD);
3563 
3564  /* Resize ranksSend and the first index of entitiesSend to the number of
3565  ranks to which this rank has to send data. */
3566  ranksSend.resize(nRankSend);
3567  entitiesSend.resize(nRankSend);
3568 
3569  /*--- Send all the data using non-blocking sends. ---*/
3570  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> commReqs(ranksRecv.size());
3571 
3572  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
3573  int dest = ranksRecv[i];
3574  SU2_MPI::Isend(longBuf[i].data(), longBuf[i].size(), MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG,
3575  dest, dest, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &commReqs[i]);
3576  }
3577 
3578  /* Loop over the number of ranks from which I receive data about the
3579  global element ID's that I must send. */
3580  for(int i=0; i<nRankSend; ++i) {
3581 
3582  /* Block until a message arrivesi and determine the source. */
3583  SU2_MPI::Status status;
3584  SU2_MPI::Probe(MPI_ANY_SOURCE, rank, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
3585  ranksSend[i] = status.MPI_SOURCE;
3586 
3587  /* Determine the size of the message, allocate the memory for the
3588  receive buffer and receive the message. */
3589  int sizeMess;
3590  SU2_MPI::Get_count(&status, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, &sizeMess);
3591 
3592  entitiesSend[i].resize(sizeMess);
3593  SU2_MPI::Recv(entitiesSend[i].data(), sizeMess, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG,
3594  ranksSend[i], rank, MPI_COMM_WORLD, &status);
3595 
3596  /* Convert the global indices currently stored in entitiesSend[i]
3597  to local indices. */
3598  for(int j=0; j<sizeMess; ++j) {
3599  map<unsigned long,unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
3600  LMI = globalElemIDToLocalInd.find(entitiesSend[i][j]);
3601 
3602  if(LMI == globalElemIDToLocalInd.end())
3603  SU2_MPI::Error("This should not happen", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3604 
3605  entitiesSend[i][j] = LMI->second;
3606  }
3607  }
3608 
3609  /* Complete the non-blocking sends and synchronize the rank, because
3610  wild cards have been used. */
3611  SU2_MPI::Waitall(ranksRecv.size(), commReqs.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
3612  SU2_MPI::Barrier(MPI_COMM_WORLD);
3613 
3614 #else
3615  /* Sequential mode. Resize ranksSend and the first index of entitiesSend to
3616  the number of ranks to which this rank has to send data. This number is
3617  only non-zero when periodic boundaries are present in the grid. */
3618  ranksSend.resize(ranksRecv.size());
3619  entitiesSend.resize(ranksRecv.size());
3620 
3621  /* Convert the global element ID's of longBuf to local indices, which are
3622  stored in entitiesSend[0]. Note that an additional test for longBuf.size()
3623  is necessary to avoid problems. */
3624  if( longBuf.size() ) {
3625 
3626  entitiesSend[0].resize(longBuf[0].size());
3627 
3628  for(unsigned long i=0; i<longBuf[0].size(); ++i) {
3629  map<unsigned long,unsigned long>::const_iterator LMI;
3630  LMI = globalElemIDToLocalInd.find(longBuf[0][i]);
3631 
3632  if(LMI == globalElemIDToLocalInd.end())
3633  SU2_MPI::Error("This should not happen", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3634 
3635  entitiesSend[0][i] = LMI->second;
3636  }
3637  }
3638 
3639 #endif
3640 
3641  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3642  /*--- Step 2: Determine the rotational periodic transformations as well as ---*/
3643  /*--- the halo elements for which these must be applied. ---*/
3644  /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
3645 
3646  /*--- Loop over the markers and determine the mapping for the rotationally
3647  periodic transformations. The mapping is from the marker to the first
3648  index in the vectors to store the rotationally periodic halo elements. ---*/
3649  map<short,unsigned short> mapRotationalPeriodicToInd;
3650 
3651  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
3652  if(config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker) == PERIODIC_BOUNDARY) {
3653 
3654  su2double *angles = config->GetPeriodicRotAngles(config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker));
3655  if(fabs(angles[0]) > 1.e-5 || fabs(angles[1]) > 1.e-5 || fabs(angles[2]) > 1.e-5) {
3656 
3657  unsigned short curSize = mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size();
3658  mapRotationalPeriodicToInd[iMarker] = curSize;
3659  }
3660  }
3661  }
3662 
3663  /* Store the rotationally periodic indices in rotPerMarkers. */
3664  rotPerMarkers.reserve(mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size());
3665  for(map<short,unsigned short>::iterator SMI =mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.begin();
3666  SMI!=mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.end(); ++SMI)
3667  rotPerMarkers.push_back(SMI->first);
3668 
3669  /* Resize the first index of rotPerHalos to the correct size. */
3670  rotPerHalos.resize(mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.size());
3671 
3672  /*--- Loop over the volume elements and store the indices of the rotationally
3673  periodic halo elements in rotPerHalos. ---*/
3674  for(unsigned long i=nVolElemOwned; i<nVolElemTot; ++i) {
3675  if(volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor > -1) {
3676  map<short,unsigned short>::const_iterator SMI;
3677  SMI = mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.find(volElem[i].periodIndexToDonor);
3678 
3679  if(SMI != mapRotationalPeriodicToInd.end())
3680  rotPerHalos[SMI->second].push_back(i);
3681  }
3682  }
3683 }
3684 
3685 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesFace(
3686  const unsigned short VTK_TypeFace,
3687  const unsigned long *cornerPointsFace,
3688  const unsigned short VTK_TypeElem,
3689  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3690  const vector<unsigned long> &elemNodeIDsGrid,
3691  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3692  const unsigned long *connElem,
3693  bool &swapFaceInElement,
3694  unsigned long *modConnFace,
3695  unsigned long *modConnElem) {
3696 
3697  /*--- Set swapFaceInElement to false. This variable is only relevant for
3698  triangular faces of a pyramid and quadrilateral faces of a prism.
3699  Only for these situations this variable will be passed to the
3700  appropriate functions. ---*/
3701  swapFaceInElement = false;
3702 
3703  /*--- Make a distinction between the types of the volume element and call
3704  the appropriate function to do the actual job. ---*/
3705  switch( VTK_TypeElem ) {
3706  case TRIANGLE:
3707  CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentTriangle(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3708  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3709  connElem, modConnFace,
3710  modConnElem);
3711  break;
3712 
3713  case QUADRILATERAL:
3714  CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentQuadrilateral(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3715  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3716  connElem, modConnFace,
3717  modConnElem);
3718  break;
3719 
3720  case TETRAHEDRON:
3721  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentTetrahedron(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3722  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3723  connElem, modConnFace,
3724  modConnElem);
3725  break;
3726 
3727  case PYRAMID: {
3728  switch( VTK_TypeFace ) {
3729  case TRIANGLE:
3730  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPyramid(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3731  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3732  connElem, swapFaceInElement,
3733  modConnFace, modConnElem);
3734  break;
3735 
3736  case QUADRILATERAL:
3737  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPyramid(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3738  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3739  connElem, modConnFace,
3740  modConnElem);
3741  break;
3742  }
3743 
3744  break;
3745  }
3746 
3747  case PRISM: {
3748  switch( VTK_TypeFace ) {
3749  case TRIANGLE:
