3750  CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPrism(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3751  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3752  connElem, modConnFace,
3753  modConnElem);
3754  break;
3755 
3756  case QUADRILATERAL:
3757  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPrism(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3758  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3759  connElem, swapFaceInElement,
3760  modConnFace, modConnElem);
3761  break;
3762  }
3763 
3764  break;
3765  }
3766 
3767  case HEXAHEDRON:
3768  CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentHexahedron(cornerPointsFace, nPolyGrid,
3769  elemNodeIDsGrid, nPolyConn,
3770  connElem, modConnFace,
3771  modConnElem);
3772  break;
3773  }
3774 }
3775 
3776 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentQuadrilateral(
3777  const unsigned long *cornerPointsLine,
3778  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3779  const vector<unsigned long> &quadNodeIDsGrid,
3780  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3781  const unsigned long *connQuad,
3782  unsigned long *modConnLine,
3783  unsigned long *modConnQuad) {
3784 
3785  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the quadrilateral. */
3786  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3787  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3788  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1) -1;
3789  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
3790 
3791  /* Easier storage of the two corner points of the line in the new numbering. */
3792  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsLine[0];
3793  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsLine[1];
3794 
3795  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3796  quadNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
3797  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j and jj = d + e*i + f*j, where ii,jj are the
3798  indices of the new numbering and i,j the indices of the numbering used
3799  in quadNodeIDsGrid (and connQuad). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f
3800  depend on how the corner points of the line coincide with the corner points
3801  of the quad. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
3802  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
3803  it is checked for security. ---*/
3804  signed short a=0, b=0, c=0, d=0, e=0, f=0;
3805  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
3806 
3807  if(vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3808  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 0 of the quad connectivity.
3809  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3810  if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]){
3811  /* The new numbering is the same as the original numbering. */
3812  a = d = 0; b = f = 1; c = e = 0;
3813  }
3814  else if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) {
3815  /* The i and j numbering are swapped. This is a left handed transformation. */
3816  a = d = 0; b = f = 0; c = e = 1;
3817  }
3818  else {
3819  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3820  }
3821  }
3822  else if(vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3823  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 1 of the quad connectivity.
3824  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3825  if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]){
3826  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the j-direction
3827  of the original numbering, while the new j-direction is the negative
3828  i-direction of the original numbering. */
3829  a = 0; d = nPolyConn; b = f = 0; c = 1; e = -1;
3830  }
3831  else if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3832  /* The i-direction is negated, while the j-direction coincides.
3833  This is a left handed transformation. */
3834  a = nPolyConn; d = 0; b = -1; f = 1; c = e = 0;
3835  }
3836  else {
3837  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3838  }
3839  }
3840  else if(vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3841  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 2 of the quad connectivity.
3842  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3843  if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]){
3844  /* Both the i- and j-direction are negated. */
3845  a = d = nPolyConn; b = f = -1; c = e = 0;
3846  }
3847  else if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3848  /* The new i-direction is the original negative j-direction, while the
3849  new j-direction is the original negative i-direction. This is a
3850  left handed transformation. */
3851  a = d = nPolyConn; b = f = 0; c = e = -1;
3852  }
3853  else {
3854  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3855  }
3856  }
3857  else if(vert0 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) {
3858  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 3 of the quad connectivity.
3859  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3860  if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind0]){
3861  /* The new i-direction is the original negative j-direction, while the
3862  new j-direction is the original i-direction. */
3863  a = nPolyConn; d = 0; b = f = 0; c = -1; e = 1;
3864  }
3865  else if(vert1 == quadNodeIDsGrid[ind2]){
3866  /* The i-directions coincide while the j-direction is negated.
3867  This is a left handed transformation. */
3868  a = 0; d = nPolyConn; b = 1; f = -1; c = e = 0;
3869  }
3870  else {
3871  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3872  }
3873  }
3874  else {
3875  /* Vert0 does not match with any of the corner vertices of the quad. */
3876  verticesDontMatch = true;
3877  }
3878 
3879  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
3880  if( verticesDontMatch )
3881  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3882 
3883  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original quad to create the connectivity
3884  of the quad that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
3885  unsigned short ind = 0;
3886  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
3887  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i, ++ind) {
3888 
3889  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it to
3890  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnQuad. ---*/
3891  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c;
3892  unsigned short jj = d + i*e + j*f;
3893  unsigned short iind = jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii;
3894 
3895  modConnQuad[iind] = connQuad[ind];
3896  }
3897  }
3898 
3899  /*--- The line corresponds to face 0 of the quadrilateral. Hence the first
3900  nPolyConn+1 entries in modConnQuad are the DOFs of the line. Copy
3901  these entries from modConnQuad. ---*/
3902  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i)
3903  modConnLine[i] = modConnQuad[i];
3904 }
3905 
3906 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesLineAdjacentTriangle(
3907  const unsigned long *cornerPointsLine,
3908  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
3909  const vector<unsigned long> &triaNodeIDsGrid,
3910  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
3911  const unsigned long *connTria,
3912  unsigned long *modConnLine,
3913  unsigned long *modConnTria) {
3914 
3915  /* Determine the indices of the 3 corner vertices of the triangle. */
3916  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
3917  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
3918  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)/2 -1;
3919 
3920  /* Easier storage of the two corner points of the line in the new numbering. */
3921  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsLine[0];
3922  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsLine[1];
3923 
3924  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
3925  triaNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
3926  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j and jj = d + e*i + f*j, where ii,jj are the
3927  indices of the new numbering and i,j the indices of the numbering used
3928  in triaNodeIDsGrid (and connTria). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f
3929  depend on how the corner points of the line coincide with the corner points
3930  of the triangle. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
3931  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
3932  it is checked for security. ---*/
3933  signed short a=0, b=0, c=0, d=0, e=0, f=0;
3934  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
3935 
3936  if(vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3937  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 0 of the triangle connectivity.
3938  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3939  if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]){
3940  /* The new numbering is the same as the original numbering. */
3941  a = 0; b = 1; c = 0; d = 0; e = 0; f = 1;
3942  }
3943  else if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3944  /* The i and j numbering are swapped. This is a left handed transformation. */
3945  a = 0; b = 0; c = 1; d = 0; e = 1; f = 0;
3946  }
3947  else {
3948  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3949  }
3950  }
3951  else if(vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3952  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 1 of the triangle connectivity.
3953  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3954  if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]){
3955  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the j-direction
3956  of the original numbering, while the new j-direction corresponds to
3957  a combination of the original i- and j-direction. */
3958  a = 0; b = 0; c = 1; d = nPolyConn; e = -1; f = -1;
3959  }
3960  else if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) {
3961  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to a combination of
3962  the original i- and j-direction, while the new j-direction corresponds
3963  to the j-direction of the original numbering. This is a left
3964  handed transformation. */
3965  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; c = -1; d = 0; e = 0; f = 1;
3966  }
3967  else {
3968  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3969  }
3970  }
3971  else if(vert0 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) {
3972  /* Vert0 coincides with vertex 2 of the triangle connectivity.
3973  Determine the situation for vert1. */
3974  if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]){
3975  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to a combination of
3976  the original i- and j-direction, while the new j-direction corresponds
3977  to the i-direction of the original numbering. */
3978  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; c = -1; d = 0; e = 1; f = 0;
3979  }
3980  else if(vert1 == triaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) {
3981  /* The i-direction of the new numbering corresponds to the i-direction of
3982  the original numbering, while the new j-direction corresponds to a
3983  combination of the original i- and j-direction. This is a left handed
3984  transformation. */
3985  a = 0; b = 1; c = 0; d = nPolyConn; e = -1; f = -1;
3986  }
3987  else {
3988  verticesDontMatch = true; // Vert1 does not match with a neigbor.
3989  }
3990  }
3991 
3992  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
3993  if( verticesDontMatch )
3994  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
3995 
3996  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original triangle to create the connectivity
3997  of the triangle that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
3998  unsigned short ind = 0;
3999  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
4000  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=(nPolyConn-j); ++i, ++ind) {
4001 
4002  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4003  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnTria. ---*/
4004  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c;
4005  unsigned short jj = d + i*e + j*f;
4006 
4007  unsigned short iind = jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii - jj*(jj-1)/2;
4008 
4009  modConnTria[iind] = connTria[ind];
4010  }
4011  }
4012 
4013  /*--- The line corresponds to face 0 of the triangle. Hence the first
4014  nPolyConn+1 entries in modConnTria are the DOFs of the line. Copy
4015  these entries from modConnTria. ---*/
4016  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i)
4017  modConnLine[i] = modConnTria[i];
4018 }
4019 
4020 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentHexahedron(
4021  const unsigned long *cornerPointsQuad,
4022  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4023  const vector<unsigned long> &hexaNodeIDsGrid,
4024  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4025  const unsigned long *connHexa,
4026  unsigned long *modConnQuad,
4027  unsigned long *modConnHexa) {
4028 
4029  /* Determine the indices of the eight corner points of the hexahedron. */
4030  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4031  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4032  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1) -1;
4033  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
4034  const unsigned short ind4 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1)*nPolyGrid;
4035  const unsigned short ind5 = ind1 + ind4;
4036  const unsigned short ind6 = ind2 + ind4;
4037  const unsigned short ind7 = ind3 + ind4;
4038 
4039  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
4040  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
4041  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
4042  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
4043  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
4044 
4045  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4046  hexaNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4047  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j + d*k, jj = e + f*i + g*j + h*k and
4048  kk = l + m*i + n*j + o*k, where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new
4049  numbering and i,j,k the indices of the numbering used in in hexaNodeIDsGrid
4050  (and connHexa). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,l,m,n,o
4051  depend on how the corner points of the quad coincide with the corner points
4052  of the hexahedron. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
4053  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
4054  it is checked for security. ---*/
4055  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0,
4056  l = 0, m = 0, n = 0, o = 0;
4057  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4058 
4059  if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4060  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4061  b = g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4062  }
4063  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4064  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4065  c = f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4066  }
4067  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4068  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = k.
4069  b = h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4070  }
4071  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = k.
4072  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4073  d = f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4074  }
4075  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4076  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = k.
4077  c = h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4078  }
4079  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = k.
4080  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4081  d = g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4082  }
4083 
4084  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4085  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4086  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4087  }
4088  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4089  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4090  e = nPolyConn; f = -1; c = o = 1; // kk = k.
4091  }
4092  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4093  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = k.
4094  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4095  }
4096  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = k.
4097  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4098  e = nPolyConn; f = -1; d = n = 1; // kk = j.
4099  }
4100  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4101  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = k.
4102  l = nPolyConn; m = -1; c = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4103  }
4104  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = k.
4105  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4106  l = nPolyConn; m = -1; d = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4107  }
4108 
4109  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4110  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4111  a = e = nPolyConn; c = f = -1; o = 1; // kk = k.
4112  }
4113  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4114  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4115  a = e = nPolyConn; b = g = -1; o = 1; // kk = k.
4116  }
4117  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4118  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = k.
4119  a = l = nPolyConn; c = m = -1; h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4120  }
4121  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = k.
4122  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4123  e = l = nPolyConn; g = m = -1; d = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4124  }
4125  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4126  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = k.
4127  a = l = nPolyConn; b = n = -1; h = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4128  }
4129  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = k.
4130  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4131  e = l = nPolyConn; f = n = -1; d = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4132  }
4133 
4134  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4135  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4136  a = nPolyConn; c = -1; f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4137  }
4138  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4139  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4140  e = nPolyConn; g = -1; b = o = 1; // kk = k.
4141  }
4142  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4143  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = k.
4144  a = nPolyConn; c = -1; h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4145  }
4146  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = k.
4147  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4148  e = nPolyConn; g = -1; d = m = 1; // kk = i.
4149  }
4150  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4151  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = k.
4152  l = nPolyConn; n = -1; b = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4153  }
4154  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = k.
4155  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4156  l = nPolyConn; n = -1; d = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4157  }
4158 
4159  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
4160  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = j.
4161  l = nPolyConn; o = -1; b = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4162  }
4163  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = j.
4164  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4165  l = nPolyConn; o = -1; c = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4166  }
4167  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
4168  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4169  e = nPolyConn; h = -1; b = n = 1; // kk = j.
4170  }
4171  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4172  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4173  a = nPolyConn; d = -1; f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4174  }
4175  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = j.
4176  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4177  e = nPolyConn; h = -1; c = m = 1; // kk = i.
4178  }
4179  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4180  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = j.
4181  a = nPolyConn; d = -1; g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4182  }
4183 
4184  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = j.
4185  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4186  e = l = nPolyConn; f = o = -1; c = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4187  }
4188  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4189  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = j.
4190  a = l = nPolyConn; b = o = -1; g = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4191  }
4192  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = j.
4193  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4194  e = l = nPolyConn; h = m = -1; c = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4195  }
4196  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4197  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = j.
4198  a = l = nPolyConn; d = m = -1; g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4199  }
4200  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4201  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4202  a = e = nPolyConn; d = f = -1; n = 1; // kk = j.
4203  }
4204  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4205  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4206  a = e = nPolyConn; b = h = -1; n = 1; // kk = j.
4207  }
4208 
4209  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4210  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4211  a = e = l = nPolyConn; b = g = o = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4212  }
4213  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4214  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4215  a = e = l = nPolyConn; c = f = o = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4216  }
4217  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4218  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4219  a = e = l = nPolyConn; b = h = n = -1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4220  }
4221  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4222  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4223  a = e = l = nPolyConn; d = f = n = -1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4224  }
4225  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4226  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4227  a = e = l = nPolyConn; d = g = m = -1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4228  }
4229  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4230  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4231  a = e = l = nPolyConn; c = h = m = -1; // kk = nPoly-i.
4232  }
4233 
4234  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4235  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = i.
4236  a = l = nPolyConn; c = o = -1; f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4237  }
4238  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = i.
4239  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4240  e = l = nPolyConn; g = o = -1; b = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4241  }
4242  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4243  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4244  a = e = nPolyConn; c = h = -1; m = 1; // kk = i.
4245  }
4246  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4247  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4248  a = e = nPolyConn; d = g = -1; m = 1; // kk = i.
4249  }
4250  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6] && // ii = i.
4251  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-k.
4252  e = l = nPolyConn; h = n = -1; b = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4253  }
4254  else if(vert0 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind7] && vert1 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-k.
4255  vert2 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == hexaNodeIDsGrid[ind6]) { // jj = i.
4256  a = l = nPolyConn; d = n = -1; f = 1; // kk = nPoly-j.
4257  }
4258 
4259  else {
4260  verticesDontMatch = true;
4261  }
4262 
4263  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4264  if( verticesDontMatch )
4265  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4266 
4267  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original hexahedron to create the connectivity
4268  of the hexahedron that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4269  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+1);
4270  unsigned short ind = 0;
4271  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4272  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
4273  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i, ++ind) {
4274 
4275  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4276  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnHexa. ---*/
4277  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c + k*d;
4278  unsigned short jj = e + i*f + j*g + k*h;
4279  unsigned short kk = l + i*m + j*n + k*o;
4280  unsigned short iind = kk*nn2 + jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii;
4281 
4282  modConnHexa[iind] = connHexa[ind];
4283  }
4284  }
4285  }
4286 
4287  /*--- The quad corresponds to face 0 of the hexahedron. Hence the first
4288  nn2 entries in modConnHexa are the DOFs of the quad. Copy
4289  these entries from modConnHexa. ---*/
4290  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nn2; ++i)
4291  modConnQuad[i] = modConnHexa[i];
4292 }
4293 
4294 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPrism(
4295  const unsigned long *cornerPointsQuad,
4296  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4297  const vector<unsigned long> &prismNodeIDsGrid,
4298  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4299  const unsigned long *connPrism,
4300  bool &swapFaceInElement,
4301  unsigned long *modConnQuad,
4302  unsigned long *modConnPrism) {
4303 
4304  /* Determine the indices of the six corner points of the prism. */
4305  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4306  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4307  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)/2 -1;
4308  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)*nPolyGrid/2;
4309  const unsigned short ind4 = ind1 + ind3;
4310  const unsigned short ind5 = ind2 + ind3;
4311 
4312  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
4313  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
4314  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
4315  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
4316  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
4317 
4318  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4319  prismNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is
4320  of the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = g + h*k,
4321  where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices
4322  of the numbering used in in prismNodeIDsGrid (and connPrism). Note that
4323  the k-direction can at most be reversed compared to the original definition.
4324  This is due to the way the basis functions are defined for a prism. As a
4325  consequence also the variable swapFaceInElement is needed to cover all
4326  possible situations. The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h depend
4327  on how the corner points of the quad coincide with the corner points of the
4328  prism. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to
4329  check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked
4330  for security. ---*/
4331  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0;
4332  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4333 
4334  if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4335  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4336  b = f = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4337  }
4338  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = i.
4339  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = j.
4340  b = f = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4341  }
4342  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4343  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = i.
4344  c = e = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4345  }
4346  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4347  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4348  c = e = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4349  }
4350 
4351  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4352  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = j.
4353  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; f = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4354  }
4355  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4356  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = j.
4357  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; f = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4358  }
4359  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4360  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4361  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; c = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4362  }
4363  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = j.
4364  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4365  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; c = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4366  }
4367 
4368  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4369  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4370  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; e = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4371  }
4372  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4373  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = i.
4374  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; e = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4375  }
4376  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4377  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4378  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; b = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = k.
4379  }
4380  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = i.
4381  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4382  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; b = h = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = k. Plus swap.
4383  }
4384 
4385  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4386  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = j.
4387  g = nPolyConn; b = f = 1; h = -1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4388  }
4389  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = i.
4390  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = j.
4391  g = nPolyConn; b = f = 1; h = -1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4392  }
4393  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4394  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = i.
4395  g = nPolyConn; c = e = 1; h = -1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4396  }
4397  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = j.
4398  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = i.
4399  g = nPolyConn; c = e = 1; h = -1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4400  }
4401 
4402  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4403  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = j.
4404  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; f = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4405  }
4406  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4407  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4408  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; f = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4409  }
4410  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4411  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4412  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; c = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4413  }
4414  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = j.
4415  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4416  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; c = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4417  }
4418 
4419  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4420  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4421  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; e = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4422  }
4423  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4424  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = i.
4425  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; e = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4426  }
4427  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4428  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4429  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; b = 1; swapFaceInElement = false; // kk = nPoly-k.
4430  }
4431  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4432  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4433  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; b = 1; swapFaceInElement = true; // kk = nPoly-k. Plus swap.
4434  }
4435 
4436  else {
4437  verticesDontMatch = true;
4438  }
4439 
4440  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4441  if( verticesDontMatch )
4442  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4443 
4444  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original prism to create the connectivity
4445  of the prism that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4446  const unsigned short kOff = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+2)/2;
4447  unsigned short ind = 0;
4448  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4449  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
4450  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - j;
4451  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
4452 
4453  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4454  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPrism. ---*/
4455  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c;
4456  unsigned short jj = d + i*e + j*f;
4457  unsigned short kk = g + h*k;
4458  unsigned short iind = kk*kOff + jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii - jj*(jj-1)/2;
4459 
4460  modConnPrism[iind] = connPrism[ind];
4461  }
4462  }
4463  }
4464 
4465  /*--- Determine the connectivity of the quadrilateral face. ---*/
4466  if( swapFaceInElement ) {
4467 
4468  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the quad must be swapped
4469  w.r.t. to the parametric coordinates of the face of the prism.
4470  This means that the coordinate r of the quad runs from the base
4471  triangle to the top triangle of the prism. This corresponds to
4472  the k-direction of the prism. Hence the s-direction of the quad
4473  corresponds to the i-direction of the prism. ---*/
4474  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4475  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i) {
4476  const unsigned short iind = i*(nPolyConn+1) + k;
4477  modConnQuad[iind] = modConnPrism[k*kOff+i];
4478  }
4479  }
4480  }
4481  else {
4482  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the quad correspond to the
4483  parametric coordinates in i- and k-direction of the face of the
4484  prism. So an easy copy can be made. ---*/
4485  unsigned short iind = 0;
4486  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4487  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=nPolyConn; ++i, ++iind) {
4488  modConnQuad[iind] = modConnPrism[k*kOff+i];
4489  }
4490  }
4491  }
4492 }
4493 
4494 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesQuadrilateralAdjacentPyramid(
4495  const unsigned long *cornerPointsQuad,
4496  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4497  const vector<unsigned long> &pyraNodeIDsGrid,
4498  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4499  const unsigned long *connPyra,
4500  unsigned long *modConnQuad,
4501  unsigned long *modConnPyra) {
4502 
4503  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the quadrilateral
4504  base of the pyramid. Note that the top of the pyramid is not needed
4505  in the comparison, because only triangular faces are attached to it. */
4506  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4507  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4508  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1) -1;
4509  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
4510 
4511  /* Easier storage of the four corner points of the quad in the new numbering. */
4512  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsQuad[0];
4513  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsQuad[1];
4514  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsQuad[2];
4515  const unsigned long vert3 = cornerPointsQuad[3];
4516 
4517  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4518  pyraNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4519  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = k, where
4520  ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices of
4521  the numbering used in in pyraNodeIDsGrid (and connPyra). The values of
4522  the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f depend on how the corner points of the quad
4523  coincide with the corner points of the quadrilateral base of the pyramid.
4524  This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check
4525  if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for
4526  security. Note that this mapping is less complicated than for a prism or
4527  hexahedron, because a pyramid only has one quadrilateral face and hence
4528  the k-direction has to match. ---*/
4529  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0;
4530  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4531 
4532  if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4533  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = j.
4534  b = f = 1;
4535  }
4536  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = j.
4537  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4538  c = e = 1;
4539  }
4540 
4541  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4542  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4543  d = nPolyConn; c = 1; e = -1;
4544  }
4545  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4546  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4547  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; f = 1;
4548  }
4549 
4550  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i.
4551  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4552  a = d = nPolyConn; b = f = -1;
4553  }
4554  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4555  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i.
4556  a = d = nPolyConn; c = e = -1;
4557  }
4558 
4559  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-j.
4560  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = i.
4561  a = nPolyConn; c = -1; e = 1;
4562  }
4563  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = i.
4564  vert2 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert3 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-j.
4565  d = nPolyConn; b = 1; f = -1;
4566  }
4567 
4568  else {
4569  verticesDontMatch = true;
4570  }
4571 
4572  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4573  if( verticesDontMatch )
4574  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4575 
4576  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original pyramid to create the connectivity
4577  of the pyramid that corresponds to the new numbering. Note that the
4578  outer k-loop is the same for both numberings. ---*/
4579  unsigned short mPoly = nPolyConn;
4580  unsigned short offLevel = 0;
4581 
4582  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4583  unsigned short ind = offLevel;
4584 
4585  /* The variables of a and d in the transformation are actually flexible. */
4586  /* Create the correct values of a and d for the current k-level. */
4587  const signed short aa = a ? mPoly : 0;
4588  const signed short dd = d ? mPoly : 0;
4589 
4590  /* Loop over the DOFs of the current quadrilateral. */
4591  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=mPoly; ++j) {
4592  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=mPoly; ++i, ++ind) {
4593 
4594  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it
4595  to a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPyra. ---*/
4596  unsigned short ii = aa + i*b + j*c;
4597  unsigned short jj = dd + i*e + j*f;
4598  unsigned short iind = offLevel + jj*(mPoly+1) + ii;
4599 
4600  modConnPyra[iind] = connPyra[ind];
4601  }
4602  }
4603 
4604  /* Update offLevel for the next quadrilateral level of the pyramid. */
4605  offLevel += (mPoly+1)*(mPoly+1);
4606  }
4607 
4608  /*--- The quad corresponds to face 0 of the pyramid. Hence the first
4609  nn2 entries in modConnPyra are the DOFs of the quad. Copy
4610  these entries from modConnPyra. ---*/
4611  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+1);
4612  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nn2; ++i)
4613  modConnQuad[i] = modConnPyra[i];
4614 }
4615 
4616 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPrism(
4617  const unsigned long *cornerPointsTria,
4618  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4619  const vector<unsigned long> &prismNodeIDsGrid,
4620  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4621  const unsigned long *connPrism,
4622  unsigned long *modConnTria,
4623  unsigned long *modConnPrism) {
4624 
4625  /* Determine the indices of the six corner points of the prism. */
4626  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4627  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4628  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)/2 -1;
4629  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)*nPolyGrid/2;
4630  const unsigned short ind4 = ind1 + ind3;
4631  const unsigned short ind5 = ind2 + ind3;
4632 
4633  /* Easier storage of the three corner points of the triangle in the new numbering. */
4634  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4635  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsTria[1];
4636  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsTria[2];
4637 
4638  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4639  prismNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is
4640  of the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = g + h*k,
4641  where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices
4642  of the numbering used in in prismNodeIDsGrid (and connPrism). Note that
4643  the k-direction can at most be reversed compared to the original definition.
4644  This is due to the way the basis functions are defined for a prism.
4645  The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h depend on how the corner
4646  points of the triangle coincide with the corner points of the prism. This
4647  is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check if vertices
4648  do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for security. ---*/
4649  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0;
4650  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4651 
4652  if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4653  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4654  b = f = h = 1; // kk = k.
4655  }
4656  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4657  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4658  c = e = h = 1; // kk = k.
4659  }
4660 
4661  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4662  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4663  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; f = h = 1; // kk = k.
4664  }
4665  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4666  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4667  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; c = h = 1; // kk = k.
4668  }
4669 
4670  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4671  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4672  a = nPolyConn; b = c = -1; e = h = 1; // kk = k.
4673  }
4674  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4675  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4676  d = nPolyConn; e = f = -1; b = h = 1; // kk = k.
4677  }
4678 
4679  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4680  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = j.
4681  g = nPolyConn; b = f = 1; h = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4682  }
4683  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4684  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = i.
4685  g = nPolyConn; c = e = 1; h = -1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4686  }
4687 
4688  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4689  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5]) { // jj = j.
4690  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; f = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4691  }
4692  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && // ii = j.
4693  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4694  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; c = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4695  }
4696 
4697  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = nPoly-i-j.
4698  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) { // jj = i.
4699  a = g = nPolyConn; b = c = h = -1; e = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4700  }
4701  else if(vert0 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind5] && vert1 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind4] && // ii = i.
4702  vert2 == prismNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j.
4703  d = g = nPolyConn; e = f = h = -1; b = 1; // kk = nPoly-k.
4704  }
4705 
4706  else {
4707  verticesDontMatch = true;
4708  }
4709 
4710  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4711  if( verticesDontMatch )
4712  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4713 
4714  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original prism to create the connectivity
4715  of the prism that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
4716  const unsigned short kOff = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+2)/2;
4717  unsigned short ind = 0;
4718  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
4719  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=nPolyConn; ++j) {
4720  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - j;
4721  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
4722 
4723  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
4724  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPrism. ---*/
4725  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c;
4726  unsigned short jj = d + i*e + j*f;
4727  unsigned short kk = g + h*k;
4728  unsigned short iind = kk*kOff + jj*(nPolyConn+1) + ii - jj*(jj-1)/2;
4729 
4730  modConnPrism[iind] = connPrism[ind];
4731  }
4732  }
4733  }
4734 
4735  /*--- The triangle corresponds to face 0 of the prism. Hence the first
4736  kOff entries in modConnPrism are the DOFs of the triangle. Copy
4737  these entries from modConnPrism. ---*/
4738  for(unsigned short i=0; i<kOff; ++i)
4739  modConnTria[i] = modConnPrism[i];
4740 }
4741 
4742 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentPyramid(
4743  const unsigned long *cornerPointsTria,
4744  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4745  const vector<unsigned long> &pyraNodeIDsGrid,
4746  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4747  const unsigned long *connPyra,
4748  bool &swapFaceInElement,
4749  unsigned long *modConnTria,
4750  unsigned long *modConnPyra) {
4751 
4752  /* Determine the indices of the five corner points of the pyramid. */
4753  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4754  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4755  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+1) -1;
4756  const unsigned short ind3 = ind2 - nPolyGrid;
4757  const unsigned short ind4 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)*(2*nPolyGrid+3)/6 -1;
4758 
4759  /* Check if the top of the pyramid coincides with either corner point 1 or
4760  corner point 2 of the triangle. Set swapFaceInElement accordingly. */
4761  if( cornerPointsTria[1] == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) swapFaceInElement = true;
4762  else if(cornerPointsTria[2] == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind4]) swapFaceInElement = false;
4763  else
4764  SU2_MPI::Error(string("Top of the pyramid does not coincide with either corner point 1 or 2.\n") +
4765  string("This should not happen"), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4766 
4767  /* Easier storage of the two other corner points of the triangle in the new numbering.
4768  vert0 always corresponds to cornerPointsTria[0], while vert1 contains the other
4769  point that is not equal to the top of the pyramid. This depends on swapFaceInElement. */
4770  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4771  const unsigned long vert1 = swapFaceInElement ? cornerPointsTria[2] : cornerPointsTria[1];
4772 
4773  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4774  pyraNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4775  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j, jj = d + e*i + f*j and kk = k, where
4776  ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new numbering and i,j,k the indices of
4777  the numbering used in in pyraNodeIDsGrid (and connPyra). The values of
4778  the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f depend on how the corner points of the triangle
4779  coincide with the corner points of the triangular face of the pyramid.
4780  This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is there to check
4781  if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but it is checked for
4782  security. ---*/
4783  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0;
4784  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4785 
4786  if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // ii = i.
4787  b = f = 1; // jj = j.
4788  }
4789  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // ii = j.
4790  c = e = 1; // jj = i.
4791  }
4792 
4793  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // ii = j.
4794  d = nPolyConn; c = 1; e = -1; // jj = nPoly-i.
4795  }
4796  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // ii = nPoly-i.
4797  a = nPolyConn; b = -1; f = 1; // jj = j.
4798  }
4799 
4800  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // ii = nPoly-i.
4801  a = d = nPolyConn; b = f = -1; // jj = nPoly-j.
4802  }
4803  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // ii = nPoly-j.
4804  a = d = nPolyConn; c = e = -1; // jj = nPoly-i.
4805  }
4806 
4807  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // ii = nPoly-j.
4808  a = nPolyConn; c = -1; e = 1; // jj = i.
4809  }
4810  else if(vert0 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == pyraNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // ii = i.
4811  d = nPolyConn; b = 1; f = -1; // jj = nPoly-j.
4812  }
4813 
4814  else {
4815  verticesDontMatch = true;
4816  }
4817 
4818  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
4819  if( verticesDontMatch )
4820  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
4821 
4822  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original pyramid to create the connectivity
4823  of the pyramid that corresponds to the new numbering. Note that the
4824  outer k-loop is the same for both numberings. ---*/
4825  unsigned short mPoly = nPolyConn;
4826  unsigned short offLevel = 0;
4827 
4828  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4829  unsigned short ind = offLevel;
4830 
4831  /* The variables of a and d in the transformation are actually flexible. */
4832  /* Create the correct values of a and d for the current k-level. */
4833  const signed short aa = a ? mPoly : 0;
4834  const signed short dd = d ? mPoly : 0;
4835 
4836  /* Loop over the DOFs of the current quadrilateral. */
4837  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=mPoly; ++j) {
4838  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=mPoly; ++i, ++ind) {
4839 
4840  /*--- Determine the ii and jj indices of the new numbering, convert it
4841  to a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnPyra. ---*/
4842  unsigned short ii = aa + i*b + j*c;
4843  unsigned short jj = dd + i*e + j*f;
4844  unsigned short iind = offLevel + jj*(mPoly+1) + ii;
4845 
4846  modConnPyra[iind] = connPyra[ind];
4847  }
4848  }
4849 
4850  /* Update offLevel for the next quadrilateral level of the pyramid. */
4851  offLevel += (mPoly+1)*(mPoly+1);
4852  }
4853 
4854  /*--- Determine the connectivity of the triangular face. ---*/
4855  if( swapFaceInElement ) {
4856 
4857  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the triangle must be swapped
4858  w.r.t. to the parametric coordinates of the face of the pyramid.
4859  This means that the coordinate r of the triangle runs from the base
4860  to the top of the pyramid. This corresponds to the k-direction of the
4861  pyramid. Hence the s-direction of the triangle corresponds to the
4862  i-direction of the pyramid. ---*/
4863  mPoly = nPolyConn;
4864  offLevel = 0;
4865  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4866  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=mPoly; ++i) {
4867  unsigned short iind = i*(nPolyConn+1) + k - i*(i-1)/2;
4868  modConnTria[iind] = modConnPyra[offLevel+i];
4869  }
4870  offLevel += (mPoly+1)*(mPoly+1);
4871  }
4872  }
4873  else {
4874  /*--- The parametric coordinates r and s of the triangle correspond to the
4875  parametric coordinates in i- and k-direction of the face of the
4876  pyramid. So an easy copy can be made. ---*/
4877  mPoly = nPolyConn;
4878  offLevel = 0;
4879  unsigned short iind = 0;
4880  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k, --mPoly) {
4881  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=mPoly; ++i, ++iind) {
4882  modConnTria[iind] = modConnPyra[offLevel+i];
4883  }
4884  offLevel += (mPoly+1)*(mPoly+1);
4885  }
4886  }
4887 }
4888 
4889 void CMeshFEM_DG::CreateConnectivitiesTriangleAdjacentTetrahedron(
4890  const unsigned long *cornerPointsTria,
4891  const unsigned short nPolyGrid,
4892  const vector<unsigned long> &tetNodeIDsGrid,
4893  const unsigned short nPolyConn,
4894  const unsigned long *connTet,
4895  unsigned long *modConnTria,
4896  unsigned long *modConnTet) {
4897 
4898  /* Determine the indices of the four corner points of the tetrahedron. */
4899  const unsigned short ind0 = 0;
4900  const unsigned short ind1 = nPolyGrid;
4901  const unsigned short ind2 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)/2 -1;
4902  const unsigned short ind3 = (nPolyGrid+1)*(nPolyGrid+2)*(nPolyGrid+3)/6 -1;
4903 
4904  /* Easier storage of the three corner points of the triangle in the new numbering. */
4905  const unsigned long vert0 = cornerPointsTria[0];
4906  const unsigned long vert1 = cornerPointsTria[1];
4907  const unsigned long vert2 = cornerPointsTria[2];
4908 
4909  /*--- There exists a linear mapping from the indices of the numbering used in
4910  tetNodeIDsGrid to the indices of the target numbering. This mapping is of
4911  the form ii = a + b*i + c*j + d*k, jj = e + f*i + g*j + h*k and
4912  kk = l + m*i + n*j + o*k, where ii,jj,kk are the indices of the new
4913  numbering and i,j,k the indices of the numbering used in in tetNodeIDsGrid
4914  (and connTet). The values of the coefficients a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,l,m,n,o
4915  depend on how the corner points of the triangle coincide with the corner points
4916  of the tetrahedron. This is determined below. The bool verticesDontMatch is
4917  there to check if vertices do not match. This should not happen, but
4918  it is checked for security. ---*/
4919  signed short a = 0, b = 0, c = 0, d = 0, e = 0, f = 0, g = 0, h = 0,
4920  l = 0, m = 0, n = 0, o = 0;
4921  bool verticesDontMatch = false;
4922 
4923  if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4924  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4925  b = g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4926  }
4927  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4928  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4929  c = f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4930  }
4931  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4932  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4933  b = h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4934  }
4935  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4936  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4937  d = f = n = 1; // kk = j.
4938  }
4939  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4940  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4941  c = h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4942  }
4943  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4944  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4945  d = g = m = 1; // kk = i.
4946  }
4947 
4948  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4949  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4950  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; g = o = 1; // kk = k.
4951  }
4952  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4953  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4954  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; c = o = 1; // kk = k.
4955  }
4956  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4957  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4958  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; h = n = 1; // kk = j.
4959  }
4960  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4961  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4962  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; d = n = 1; // kk = j.
4963  }
4964  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
4965  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4966  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; c = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4967  }
4968  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4969  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
4970  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; d = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4971  }
4972 
4973  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4974  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4975  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; f = o = 1; // kk = k.
4976  }
4977  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4978  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4979  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; b = o = 1; // kk = k.
4980  }
4981  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4982  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4983  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4984  }
4985  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4986  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
4987  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; d = m = 1; // kk = i.
4988  }
4989  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
4990  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4991  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; h = m = 1; // kk = i.
4992  }
4993  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
4994  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3]) { // jj = k.
4995  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; b = h = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
4996  }
4997  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && // ii = k.
4998  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
4999  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; d = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
5000  }
5001 
5002  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
5003  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
5004  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; f = n = 1; // kk = j.
5005  }
5006  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
5007  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
5008  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; b = n = 1; // kk = j.
5009  }
5010  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0] && // ii = nPoly-i-j-k.
5011  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
5012  a = nPolyConn; b = c = d = -1; g = m = 1; // kk = i.
5013  }
5014  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
5015  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind0]) { // jj = nPoly-i-j-k.
5016  e = nPolyConn; f = g = h = -1; c = m = 1; // kk = i.
5017  }
5018  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1] && // ii = i.
5019  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2]) { // jj = j.
5020  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; b = g = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
5021  }
5022  else if(vert0 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind3] && vert1 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind2] && // ii = j.
5023  vert2 == tetNodeIDsGrid[ind1]) { // jj = i.
5024  l = nPolyConn; m = n = o = -1; c = f = 1; // kk = nPoly-i-j-k.
5025  }
5026 
5027  else {
5028  verticesDontMatch = true;
5029  }
5030 
5031  /*--- If non-matching vertices have been found, terminate with an error message. ---*/
5032  if( verticesDontMatch )
5033  SU2_MPI::Error("Corner vertices do not match. This should not happen.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5034 
5035  /*--- Some constants to convert the (ii,jj,kk) indices to a 1D index. ---*/
5036  const unsigned short abv1 = (11 + 12*nPolyConn + 3*nPolyConn*nPolyConn);
5037  const unsigned short abv2 = (2*nPolyConn + 3)*3;
5038  const unsigned short abv3 = (nPolyConn + 2)*3;
5039 
5040  /*--- Loop over the DOFs of the original tetrahedron to create the connectivity
5041  of the tetrahedron that corresponds to the new numbering. ---*/
5042  unsigned short ind = 0;
5043  for(unsigned short k=0; k<=nPolyConn; ++k) {
5044  unsigned short uppBoundJ = nPolyConn - k;
5045  for(unsigned short j=0; j<=uppBoundJ; ++j) {
5046  unsigned short uppBoundI = nPolyConn - k - j;
5047  for(unsigned short i=0; i<=uppBoundI; ++i, ++ind) {
5048 
5049  /*--- Determine the ii, jj and kk indices of the new numbering, convert it to
5050  a 1D index and shore the modified index in modConnTet. ---*/
5051  unsigned short ii = a + i*b + j*c + k*d;
5052  unsigned short jj = e + i*f + j*g + k*h;
5053  unsigned short kk = l + i*m + j*n + k*o;
5054  unsigned short iind = (abv1*kk + abv2*jj + 6*ii - abv3*kk*kk
5055  - 6*kk*jj - 3*jj*jj + kk*kk*kk)/6;
5056 
5057  modConnTet[iind] = connTet[ind];
5058  }
5059  }
5060  }
5061 
5062  /*--- The triangle corresponds to face 0 of the tetrahedron. Hence the first
5063  nn2 entries in modConnTet are the DOFs of the triangle. Copy these
5064  entries from modConnTet. ---*/
5065  const unsigned short nn2 = (nPolyConn+1)*(nPolyConn+2)/2;
5066  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nn2; ++i)
5067  modConnTria[i] = modConnTet[i];
5068 }
5069 
5070 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsMatchingFaces(CConfig *config) {
5071 
5072  /* Determine whether or not the viscous terms are needed. */
5073  bool viscousTerms = (config->GetKind_Solver() != FEM_EULER && config->GetKind_Solver() != DISC_ADJ_FEM_EULER);
5074 
5075  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
5076  for(unsigned long i=0; i<matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
5077 
5078  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5079  /*--- Step 1: Allocate the memory for the face metric terms. ---*/
5080  /*--- Depending on the case, not all of this memory is needed. ---*/
5081  /*--- - Unit normals + area (nDim+1 per integration point) ---*/
5082  /*--- - drdx, dsdx, etc. for both sides (nDim*nDim per ---*/
5083  /*--- integration point) ---*/
5084  /*--- - grid velocities in the integration points. ---*/
5085  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5086 
5087  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
5088  relevant information from it. */
5089  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[i].indStandardElement;
5090  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5091 
5092  /* Allocate the memory for the vectors to store the different face
5093  metric terms. */
5094  matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.resize(nInt*(nDim+1));
5095 
5096  if( viscousTerms ) {
5097  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace0.resize(nInt*nDim*nDim);
5098  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace1.resize(nInt*nDim*nDim);
5099  }
5100 
5101  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities and initialize them to the
5102  default value of zero. */
5103  matchingFaces[i].gridVelocities.assign(nInt*nDim, 0.0);
5104 
5105  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5106  /*--- Step 2: Determine the actual metric data in the integration points ---*/
5107  /*--- of the faces. ---*/
5108  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5109 
5110  /* Call the function ComputeNormalsFace to compute the unit normals and
5111  its corresponding area in the integration points. The data from side 0
5112  is used, but the data from side 1 should give the same result. */
5113  unsigned short nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
5114  const su2double *dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetDrBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
5115  const su2double *ds = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetDsBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
5116 
5117  ComputeNormalsFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr, ds, matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridFaceSide0.data(),
5118  matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.data());
5119 
5120  /* Check whether the viscous terms are needed in the discretization. */
5121  if( viscousTerms ) {
5122 
5123  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
5124  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
5125  on side 0 of the face. */
5126  nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElemSide0();
5127  dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegrationSide0();
5128 
5129  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr,
5130  matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridElementSide0.data(),
5131  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace0.data(),
5132  config);
5133 
5134  /* Compute the derivatives of the parametric coordinates w.r.t. the
5135  Cartesian coordinates, i.e. drdx, drdy, etc. in the integration points
5136  on side 1 of the face. */
5137  nDOFs = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetNDOFsElemSide1();
5138  dr = standardMatchingFacesGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisElemIntegrationSide1();
5139 
5140  ComputeGradientsCoordinatesFace(nInt, nDOFs, dr,
5141  matchingFaces[i].DOFsGridElementSide1.data(),
5142  matchingFaces[i].metricCoorDerivFace1.data(),
5143  config);
5144  }
5145  }
5146 }
5147 
5148 void CMeshFEM_DG::LengthScaleVolumeElements(void) {
5149 
5150  /* Initialize the length scale of the elements to zero. */
5151  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemTot; ++i)
5152  volElem[i].lenScale = 0.0;
5153 
5154  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5155  /*--- Step 1: Determine the maximum value of the Jacobians of the ---*/
5156  /*--- surrounding faces of the elements. ---*/
5157  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5158 
5159  /*--- First the physical boundaries. Loop over them. ---*/
5160  for(unsigned short j=0; j<boundaries.size(); ++j) {
5161  if( !boundaries[j].periodicBoundary ) {
5162  for(unsigned long i=0; i<boundaries[j].surfElem.size(); ++i) {
5163 
5164  /* Easier storage of corresponding volume element and the metric data
5165  for the normals of this surface element, determine the number of
5166  integration points for this surface element and loop over them. */
5167  const unsigned long volInd = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].volElemID;
5168  const su2double *normals = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].metricNormalsFace.data();
5169  const unsigned short ind = boundaries[j].surfElem[i].indStandardElement;
5170  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5171 
5172  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the maximum area
5173  scale for this face. This is stored in the variable lenScale of
5174  the corresponding volume element. */
5175  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nInt; ++k)
5176  volElem[volInd].lenScale = max(volElem[volInd].lenScale,
5177  normals[k*(nDim+1)+nDim]);
5178  }
5179  }
5180  }
5181 
5182  /*--- Loop over the matching internal faces to update the maximum Jacobian
5183  of the surrounding faces. ---*/
5184  for(unsigned long i=0; i<matchingFaces.size(); ++i) {
5185 
5186  /* Easier storage of the ID's of the two adjacent elements, determine the
5187  corresponding standard face element, the number of integration points
5188  and store the metric data of the face a bit easier. */
5189  const unsigned long v0 = matchingFaces[i].elemID0;
5190  const unsigned long v1 = matchingFaces[i].elemID1;
5191  const su2double *normals = matchingFaces[i].metricNormalsFace.data();
5192  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[i].indStandardElement;
5193  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5194 
5195  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the maximum area
5196  scale for this face. This is stored in the variable lenScale of
5197  the neigbhoring volume elements. */
5198  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nInt; ++k) {
5199  const su2double area = normals[k*(nDim+1)+nDim];
5200  volElem[v0].lenScale = max(volElem[v0].lenScale, area);
5201  volElem[v1].lenScale = max(volElem[v1].lenScale, area);
5202  }
5203  }
5204 
5205  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5206  /*--- Step 2: Communicate the currently stored data of the halo ---*/
5207  /*--- elements to the ranks where the original is stored. ---*/
5208  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5209 
5210 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5211 
5212  /*--- Define the buffers needed for the communication. ---*/
5213  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> sendRequests(ranksSend.size());
5214  vector<SU2_MPI::Request> recvRequests(ranksRecv.size());
5215 
5216  vector<vector<su2double> > sendBuf(ranksSend.size());
5217  vector<vector<su2double> > recvBuf(ranksRecv.size());
5218 
5219  /*--- Send the data using non-blocking sends. Exclude self communication.
5220  Note that the inverse communication pattern must be used for this
5221  purpose. ---*/
5222  unsigned long nRecvRequests = 0;
5223  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
5224  if(ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
5225 
5226  /* Allocate the memory for communication buffer. */
5227  recvBuf[i].resize(entitiesRecv[i].size());
5228 
5229  /* Fill the buffer to be sent, which is the receive
5230  information of the original communication pattern. */
5231  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesRecv[i].size(); ++j)
5232  recvBuf[i][j] = volElem[entitiesRecv[i][j]].lenScale;
5233 
5234  /* Send the data. */
5235  SU2_MPI::Isend(recvBuf[i].data(), recvBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
5236  ranksRecv[i], ranksRecv[i]+10, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
5237  &recvRequests[nRecvRequests++]);
5238  }
5239  }
5240 
5241  /*--- Post the receives using non-blocking receives. Exclude self communication.
5242  Also here the inverse communication pattern must be used. ---*/
5243  unsigned long nSendRequests = 0;
5244  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
5245  if(ranksSend[i] != rank) {
5246 
5247  /* Allocate the memory for communication buffer and post the receive. */
5248  sendBuf[i].resize(entitiesSend[i].size());
5249 
5250  SU2_MPI::Irecv(sendBuf[i].data(), sendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
5251  ranksSend[i], rank+10, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
5252  &sendRequests[nSendRequests++]);
5253  }
5254  }
5255 
5256 #endif
5257 
5258  /*--- Carry out the self communication, if needed. Note that this part
5259  is outside the MPI part. First determine if self communication
5260  takes place at all. ---*/
5261  bool selfComm = false;
5262  unsigned long selfRecvInd, selfSendInd;
5263  for(selfRecvInd=0; selfRecvInd<ranksRecv.size(); ++selfRecvInd) {
5264  if(ranksRecv[selfRecvInd] == rank) {
5265  selfComm = true;
5266  break;
5267  }
5268  }
5269 
5270  /*--- Determine the send index for self communication and update the
5271  data of the owners with the halo data, if self communication
5272  takes place. ---*/
5273  if( selfComm ) {
5274  for(selfSendInd=0; selfSendInd<ranksSend.size(); ++selfSendInd) {
5275  if(ranksSend[selfSendInd] == rank) break;
5276  }
5277 
5278  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesSend[selfSendInd].size(); ++j) {
5279  const unsigned long v0 = entitiesSend[selfSendInd][j];
5280  const unsigned long v1 = entitiesRecv[selfRecvInd][j];
5281 
5282  volElem[v0].lenScale = max(volElem[v0].lenScale, volElem[v1].lenScale);
5283  }
5284  }
5285 
5286 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5287 
5288  /*--- Complete the nonblocking communication. ---*/
5289  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRecvRequests, recvRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5290  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nSendRequests, sendRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5291 
5292  /*--- Update the variable currently stored in lenScale for the
5293  owned elements. ---*/
5294  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
5295  if(ranksSend[i] != rank) {
5296  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesSend[i].size(); ++j) {
5297  const unsigned long ind = entitiesSend[i][j];
5298  volElem[ind].lenScale = max(volElem[ind].lenScale, sendBuf[i][j]);
5299  }
5300  }
5301  }
5302 
5303 #endif
5304 
5305  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5306  /*--- Step 3: Determine the minimum value of the Jacobians of the ---*/
5307  /*--- elements and from that the length scale of the ---*/
5308  /*--- owned elements. ---*/
5309  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5310 
5311  /* Determine the number of metric terms per integration point.
5312  This depends on the number of spatial dimensions of the problem. */
5313  const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = nDim*nDim + 1;
5314 
5315  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5316  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5317 
5318  /* Easier storage of the metric terms and determine the number of
5319  integration points for this element. */
5320  const su2double *metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data();
5321  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5322  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5323 
5324  /* Loop over the integration points and determine the minimum Jacobian
5325  for this element. Note that the Jacobian is the first variable stored
5326  in the metric terms of the integration points. */
5327  su2double minJacElem = metric[0];
5328  for(unsigned short k=1; k<nInt; ++k)
5329  minJacElem = min(minJacElem, metric[k*nMetricPerPoint]);
5330 
5331  /* Determine the length scale of the element, for which the length
5332  scale of the reference element, 2.0, must be taken into account. */
5333  const su2double maxJacFaces = volElem[i].lenScale;
5334  volElem[i].lenScale = 2.0*minJacElem/maxJacFaces;
5335  }
5336 
5337  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5338  /*--- Step 4: Set the length scale for the halo elements. ---*/
5339  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5340 
5341 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5342 
5343  /*--- Send the data using non-blocking sends. Exclude self communication. ---*/
5344  nSendRequests = 0;
5345  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksSend.size(); ++i) {
5346  if(ranksSend[i] != rank) {
5347 
5348  /* Fill the send buffer. */
5349  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesSend[i].size(); ++j)
5350  sendBuf[i][j] = volElem[entitiesSend[i][j]].lenScale;
5351 
5352  /* Send the data. */
5353  SU2_MPI::Isend(sendBuf[i].data(), sendBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
5354  ranksSend[i], ranksSend[i]+20, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
5355  &sendRequests[nSendRequests++]);
5356  }
5357  }
5358 
5359  /*--- Post the receives using non-blocking receives.
5360  Exclude self communication. ---*/
5361  nRecvRequests = 0;
5362  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
5363  if(ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
5364 
5365  /* Post the nonblocking receive. */
5366  SU2_MPI::Irecv(recvBuf[i].data(), recvBuf[i].size(), MPI_DOUBLE,
5367  ranksRecv[i], rank+20, MPI_COMM_WORLD,
5368  &recvRequests[nRecvRequests++]);
5369  }
5370  }
5371 
5372 #endif
5373 
5374  /*--- Carry out the self communication, if needed. Note that this part
5375  is outside the MPI part. ---*/
5376  if( selfComm ) {
5377  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesSend[selfSendInd].size(); ++j) {
5378  const unsigned long v0 = entitiesSend[selfSendInd][j];
5379  const unsigned long v1 = entitiesRecv[selfRecvInd][j];
5380  volElem[v1].lenScale = volElem[v0].lenScale;
5381  }
5382  }
5383 
5384 #ifdef HAVE_MPI
5385 
5386  /*--- Complete the nonblocking communication. ---*/
5387  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nSendRequests, sendRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5388  SU2_MPI::Waitall(nRecvRequests, recvRequests.data(), MPI_STATUSES_IGNORE);
5389
