5390  /*--- Copy the data from the receive buffers into the volElem. ---*/
5391  for(unsigned long i=0; i<ranksRecv.size(); ++i) {
5392  if(ranksRecv[i] != rank) {
5393  for(unsigned long j=0; j<entitiesRecv[i].size(); ++j)
5394  volElem[entitiesRecv[i][j]].lenScale = recvBuf[i][j];
5395  }
5396  }
5397 
5398 #endif
5399 }
5400 
5401 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsSurfaceElements(CConfig *config) {
5402 
5403  /*--- Compute the metric terms of the internal matching faces. ---*/
5404  MetricTermsMatchingFaces(config);
5405 
5406  /*--- Loop over the physical boundaries and compute the metric
5407  terms of the boundary. ---*/
5408  for(unsigned short i=0; i<boundaries.size(); ++i) {
5409  if( !boundaries[i].periodicBoundary )
5410  MetricTermsBoundaryFaces(&boundaries[i], config);
5411  }
5412 }
5413 
5414 void CMeshFEM_DG::MetricTermsVolumeElements(CConfig *config) {
5415 
5416  /* Find out whether or not the full, inverse of the full and the lumped mass
5417  matrices are needed. In principle always the full mass matrix is used,
5418  unless the user explicitly indices to use the lumped mass matrix for
5419  steady and dual time stepping. Note that for the DG_FEM the mass matrix
5420  is local to the elements. Finally, when the non-aliased predictor is used
5421  for ADER-DG for the Navier-Stokes equations, the derivatives of the
5422  metric terms are needed for the computation of the 2nd derivatives. */
5423  const bool UseLumpedMassMatrix = config->GetUse_Lumped_MassMatrix_DGFEM();
5424 
5425  bool FullMassMatrix = false, FullInverseMassMatrix = false;
5426  bool LumpedMassMatrix = false, DerMetricTerms = false;
5427 
5428  if(config->GetUnsteady_Simulation() == STEADY ||
5429  config->GetUnsteady_Simulation() == ROTATIONAL_FRAME) {
5430  if( UseLumpedMassMatrix) LumpedMassMatrix = true;
5431  else FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5432  }
5433  else if(config->GetUnsteady_Simulation() == DT_STEPPING_1ST ||
5434  config->GetUnsteady_Simulation() == DT_STEPPING_2ND ||
5435  config->GetUnsteady_Simulation() == HARMONIC_BALANCE) {
5436  if( UseLumpedMassMatrix ) FullMassMatrix = LumpedMassMatrix = true;
5437  else FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5438  }
5439  else {
5440 
5441  /* Time accurate explicit time integration scheme. */
5442  FullMassMatrix = LumpedMassMatrix = false;
5443  FullInverseMassMatrix = true;
5444 
5445  /* For ADER-DG, check if the derivative of the metric terms are needed. */
5446  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG) {
5447  unsigned short solver = config->GetKind_Solver();
5448  if(solver == FEM_NAVIER_STOKES || solver == FEM_RANS || solver == FEM_LES) {
5449  if(config->GetKind_ADER_Predictor() == ADER_NON_ALIASED_PREDICTOR)
5450  DerMetricTerms = true;
5451  }
5452  }
5453  }
5454 
5455  /* Determine the number of metric terms per integration point.
5456  This depends on the number of spatial dimensions of the problem.
5457  Also determine the additional number of metric terms per integration
5458  point for the computation of the second derivatives. */
5459  const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = nDim*nDim + 1;
5460  const unsigned short nMetric2ndDerPerPoint = nDim*(nDim + nDim*(nDim-1)/2);
5461 
5462  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5463  /*--- Step 1: Determine the metric terms, drdx, drdy, drdz, dsdx, etc. ---*/
5464  /*--- and the Jacobian in the integration points and solution ---*/
5465  /*--- DOFs of the owned volume elements. ---*/
5466  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5467 
5468  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5469  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5470 
5471  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element
5472  and determine the number of integration points as well as the number
5473  of DOFs for the grid and solution. */
5474  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5475  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
5476  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[i].nDOFsGrid;
5477  const unsigned short nDOFsSol = volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
5478 
5479  /* Allocate the memory for the grid velocities. They are initialized to
5480  zero as default value, i.e. not moving. */
5481  volElem[i].gridVelocities.assign(nDim*nInt, 0.0);
5482  volElem[i].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.assign(nDim*nDOFsSol, 0.0);
5483 
5484  /* Allocate the memory for the metric terms of this element. */
5485  volElem[i].metricTerms.resize(nMetricPerPoint*nInt);
5486  volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs.resize(nMetricPerPoint*nDOFsSol);
5487 
5488  /* Get the pointer to the matrix storage of the basis functions
5489  and its derivatives. The first nDOFsGrid*nInt entries of this matrix
5490  correspond to the interpolation data to the integration points
5491  and are not needed. Hence this part is skipped. */
5492  const su2double *matBasisInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5493  const su2double *matDerBasisInt = matBasisInt + nDOFsGrid*nInt;
5494 
5495  /* Also get the pointer to the matrix storage of the derivatives of the
5496  basis functions in the sol DOFs. */
5497  const su2double *matDerBasisSolDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisFunctionsSolDOFs();
5498 
5499  /* Allocate the memory for the result vectors. */
5500  vector<su2double> helpVecResultInt(nInt*nDim*nDim);
5501  vector<su2double> helpVecResultDOFsSol(nDOFsSol*nDim*nDim);
5502  su2double *vecResultInt = helpVecResultInt.data();
5503  su2double *vecResultDOFsSol = helpVecResultDOFsSol.data();
5504 
5505  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5506  coordinates for this element in the integration points. */
5507  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nInt, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisInt,
5508  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(),
5509  vecResultInt, config);
5510 
5511  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5512  coordinates for this element in the solution DOFs. */
5513  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nDOFsSol, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisSolDOFs,
5514  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(),
5515  vecResultDOFsSol, config);
5516 
5517  /* Convert the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. to the required metric terms
5518  for both the integration points and the solution DOFs. */
5519  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nInt, vecResultInt,
5520  volElem[i].metricTerms);
5521 
5522  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nDOFsSol, vecResultDOFsSol,
5523  volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs);
5524 
5525  /* Check for negative Jacobians in the integrations points and at the
5526  location of the solution DOFs. */
5527  bool negJacobian = false;
5528  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
5529  if(volElem[i].metricTerms[nMetricPerPoint*j] <= 0.0) negJacobian = true;
5530  }
5531 
5532  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFsSol; ++j) {
5533  if(volElem[i].metricTermsSolDOFs[nMetricPerPoint*j] <= 0.0) negJacobian = true;
5534  }
5535 
5536  if( negJacobian )
5537  SU2_MPI::Error("Negative Jacobian found.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5538  }
5539 
5540  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5541  /*--- Step 2: Determine the derivatives of the metric terms in the ---*/
5542  /*--- integration points, if needed. ---*/
5543  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5544 
5545  if( DerMetricTerms ) {
5546 
5547  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5548  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5549 
5550  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element
5551  and determine the number of integration points as well as the number
5552  of DOFs for the grid. */
5553  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5554  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
5555  const unsigned short nDOFsGrid = volElem[i].nDOFsGrid;
5556 
5557  /* Get the pointer to the matrix storage of the basis functions
5558  and its derivatives. The first nDOFsGrid*nInt entries of this matrix
5559  correspond to the interpolation data to the integration points
5560  and are not needed. Hence this part is skipped. */
5561  const su2double *matBasisInt = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5562  const su2double *matDerBasisInt = matBasisInt + nDOFsGrid*nInt;
5563 
5564  /* Also get the pointer to the matrix storage of the derivatives of the
5565  basis functions in the owned DOFs, i.e. the grid DOFs. */
5566  const su2double *matDerBasisGridDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetMatDerBasisFunctionsOwnDOFs();
5567 
5568  /* Compute the gradient of the coordinates w.r.t. the parametric
5569  coordinates for this element in the solution DOFs. */
5570  vector<su2double> helpVecResultGridDOFs(nDOFsGrid*nDim*nDim);
5571  su2double *vecResultGridDOFs = helpVecResultGridDOFs.data();
5572 
5573  ComputeGradientsCoorWRTParam(nDOFsGrid, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisGridDOFs,
5574  volElem[i].nodeIDsGrid.data(),
5575  vecResultGridDOFs, config);
5576 
5577  /* Convert the values of dxdr, dydr, etc. to the required metric terms
5578  in the grid DOFs. */
5579  vector<su2double> metricGridDOFs(nDOFsGrid*nMetricPerPoint);
5580  VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(nDOFsGrid, vecResultGridDOFs,
5581  metricGridDOFs);
5582 
5583  /*--- The metric terms currently stored in metricGridDOFs are scaled
5584  with the Jacobian and also the Jacobian is part of the metric
5585  terms. For the derivatives of the metric terms, the Jacobian
5586  is not needed, but the original unscaled terms are needed.
5587  This is done in the loop below. ---*/
5588  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFsGrid; ++j) {
5589  su2double *metOld = metricGridDOFs.data() + j*nMetricPerPoint;
5590  su2double *metNew = metricGridDOFs.data() + j*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5591 
5592  const su2double JacInv = 1.0/metOld[0];
5593  for(unsigned short k=1; k<nMetricPerPoint; ++k)
5594  metNew[k-1] = JacInv*metOld[k];
5595  }
5596 
5597  /* Compute the derivatives of the metric terms w.r.t. the
5598  parametric coordinates in the integration points.
5599  First allocate the memory to store the results. */
5600  vector<su2double> helpVecDerMetrics(nDim*nInt*(nMetricPerPoint-1));
5601  su2double *vecDerMetrics = helpVecDerMetrics.data();
5602 
5603  /* Carry out the matrix multiplication. The last argument is NULL, such
5604  that this gemm call is ignored in the profiling. Replace by config if
5605  it should be included. */
5606  blasFunctions->gemm(nDim*nInt, nMetricPerPoint-1, nDOFsGrid, matDerBasisInt,
5607  metricGridDOFs.data(), vecDerMetrics, NULL);
5608 
5609  /* Allocate the memory for the additional metric terms needed to
5610  compute the second derivatives. */
5611  volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.resize(nInt*nMetric2ndDerPerPoint);
5612 
5613  /*--- Loop over the integration points to compute the additional metric
5614  terms needed for the second derivatives. This is a combination of
5615  the original metric terms and derivatives of these terms.
5616  Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. ---*/
5617  switch( nDim ) {
5618  case 2: {
5619 
5620  /* 2D computation. Loop over the integration points. */
5621  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
5622 
5623  /* Set the pointers where the data for this integration
5624  point starts. */
5625  const su2double *metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data()
5626  + j*nMetricPerPoint;
5627  const su2double *rDerMetric = vecDerMetrics + j*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5628  const su2double *sDerMetric = rDerMetric + nInt*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5629  su2double *metric2ndDer = volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.data()
5630  + j*nMetric2ndDerPerPoint;
5631 
5632  /* More readable abbreviations for the metric terms
5633  and its derivatives. */
5634  const su2double JacInv = 1.0/metric[0];
5635  const su2double drdx = JacInv*metric[1], drdy = JacInv*metric[2];
5636  const su2double dsdx = JacInv*metric[3], dsdy = JacInv*metric[4];
5637 
5638  const su2double ddrdx_dr = rDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dr = rDerMetric[1];
5639  const su2double ddsdx_dr = rDerMetric[2], ddsdy_dr = rDerMetric[3];
5640 
5641  const su2double ddrdx_ds = sDerMetric[0], ddrdy_ds = sDerMetric[1];
5642  const su2double ddsdx_ds = sDerMetric[2], ddsdy_ds = sDerMetric[3];
5643 
5644  /* Compute the metric terms needed to compute the Cartesian 2nd
5645  derivatives. Note that for the cross derivatives an average of
5646  the two possibilities is taken. */
5647  metric2ndDer[0] = drdx*ddrdx_dr + dsdx*ddrdx_ds;
5648  metric2ndDer[1] = drdx*ddsdx_dr + dsdx*ddsdx_ds;
5649 
5650  metric2ndDer[2] = 0.5*(drdx*ddrdy_dr + dsdx*ddrdy_ds
5651  + drdy*ddrdx_dr + dsdy*ddrdx_ds);
5652  metric2ndDer[3] = 0.5*(drdx*ddsdy_dr + dsdx*ddsdy_ds
5653  + drdy*ddsdx_dr + dsdy*ddsdx_ds);
5654 
5655  metric2ndDer[4] = drdy*ddrdy_dr + dsdy*ddrdy_ds;
5656  metric2ndDer[5] = drdy*ddsdy_dr + dsdy*ddsdy_ds;
5657  }
5658 
5659  break;
5660  }
5661 
5662  case 3: {
5663 
5664  /* 3D computation. Loop over the integration points. */
5665  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
5666 
5667  /* Set the pointers where the data for this integration
5668  point starts. */
5669  const su2double *metric = volElem[i].metricTerms.data()
5670  + j*nMetricPerPoint;
5671  const su2double *rDerMetric = vecDerMetrics + j*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5672  const su2double *sDerMetric = rDerMetric + nInt*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5673  const su2double *tDerMetric = sDerMetric + nInt*(nMetricPerPoint-1);
5674  su2double *metric2ndDer = volElem[i].metricTerms2ndDer.data()
5675  + j*nMetric2ndDerPerPoint;
5676 
5677  /* More readable abbreviations for the metric terms
5678  and its derivatives. */
5679  const su2double JacInv = 1.0/metric[0];
5680  const su2double drdx = JacInv*metric[1], drdy = JacInv*metric[2], drdz = JacInv*metric[3];
5681  const su2double dsdx = JacInv*metric[4], dsdy = JacInv*metric[5], dsdz = JacInv*metric[6];
5682  const su2double dtdx = JacInv*metric[7], dtdy = JacInv*metric[5], dtdz = JacInv*metric[9];
5683 
5684  const su2double ddrdx_dr = rDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dr = rDerMetric[1], ddrdz_dr = rDerMetric[2];
5685  const su2double ddsdx_dr = rDerMetric[3], ddsdy_dr = rDerMetric[4], ddsdz_dr = rDerMetric[5];
5686  const su2double ddtdx_dr = rDerMetric[6], ddtdy_dr = rDerMetric[7], ddtdz_dr = rDerMetric[8];
5687 
5688  const su2double ddrdx_ds = sDerMetric[0], ddrdy_ds = sDerMetric[1], ddrdz_ds = sDerMetric[2];
5689  const su2double ddsdx_ds = sDerMetric[3], ddsdy_ds = sDerMetric[4], ddsdz_ds = sDerMetric[5];
5690  const su2double ddtdx_ds = sDerMetric[6], ddtdy_ds = sDerMetric[7], ddtdz_ds = sDerMetric[8];
5691 
5692  const su2double ddrdx_dt = tDerMetric[0], ddrdy_dt = tDerMetric[1], ddrdz_dt = tDerMetric[2];
5693  const su2double ddsdx_dt = tDerMetric[3], ddsdy_dt = tDerMetric[4], ddsdz_dt = tDerMetric[5];
5694  const su2double ddtdx_dt = tDerMetric[6], ddtdy_dt = tDerMetric[7], ddtdz_dt = tDerMetric[8];
5695 
5696  /* Compute the metric terms needed to compute the Cartesian 2nd
5697  derivatives. Note that for the cross derivatives an average of
5698  the two possibilities is taken. */
5699  metric2ndDer[0] = drdx*ddrdx_dr + dsdx*ddrdx_ds + dtdx*ddrdx_dt;
5700  metric2ndDer[1] = drdx*ddsdx_dr + dsdx*ddsdx_ds + dtdx*ddsdx_dt;
5701  metric2ndDer[2] = drdx*ddtdx_dr + dsdx*ddtdx_ds + dtdx*ddtdx_dt;
5702 
5703  metric2ndDer[3] = 0.5*(drdx*ddrdy_dr + dsdx*ddrdy_ds + dtdx*ddrdy_dt
5704  + drdy*ddrdx_dr + dsdy*ddrdx_ds + dtdy*ddrdx_dt);
5705  metric2ndDer[4] = 0.5*(drdx*ddsdy_dr + dsdx*ddsdy_ds + dtdx*ddsdy_dt
5706  + drdy*ddsdx_dr + dsdy*ddsdx_ds + dtdy*ddsdx_dt);
5707  metric2ndDer[5] = 0.5*(drdx*ddtdy_dr + dsdx*ddtdy_ds + dtdx*ddtdy_dt
5708  + drdy*ddtdx_dr + dsdy*ddtdx_ds + dtdy*ddtdx_dt);
5709 
5710  metric2ndDer[6] = drdy*ddrdy_dr + dsdy*ddrdy_ds + dtdy*ddrdy_dt;
5711  metric2ndDer[7] = drdy*ddsdy_dr + dsdy*ddsdy_ds + dtdy*ddsdy_dt;
5712  metric2ndDer[8] = drdy*ddtdy_dr + dsdy*ddtdy_ds + dtdy*ddtdy_dt;
5713 
5714  metric2ndDer[9] = 0.5*(drdx*ddrdz_dr + dsdx*ddrdz_ds + dtdx*ddrdz_dt
5715  + drdz*ddrdx_dr + dsdz*ddrdx_ds + dtdz*ddrdx_dt);
5716  metric2ndDer[10] = 0.5*(drdx*ddsdz_dr + dsdx*ddsdz_ds + dtdx*ddsdz_dt
5717  + drdz*ddsdx_dr + dsdz*ddsdx_ds + dtdz*ddsdx_dt);
5718  metric2ndDer[11] = 0.5*(drdx*ddtdz_dr + dsdx*ddtdz_ds + dtdx*ddtdz_dt
5719  + drdz*ddtdx_dr + dsdz*ddtdx_ds + dtdz*ddtdx_dt);
5720 
5721  metric2ndDer[12] = 0.5*(drdy*ddrdz_dr + dsdy*ddrdz_ds + dtdy*ddrdz_dt
5722  + drdz*ddrdy_dr + dsdz*ddrdy_ds + dtdz*ddrdy_dt);
5723  metric2ndDer[13] = 0.5*(drdy*ddsdz_dr + dsdy*ddsdz_ds + dtdy*ddsdz_dt
5724  + drdz*ddsdy_dr + dsdz*ddsdy_ds + dtdz*ddsdy_dt);
5725  metric2ndDer[14] = 0.5*(drdy*ddtdz_dr + dsdy*ddtdz_ds + dtdy*ddtdz_dt
5726  + drdz*ddtdy_dr + dsdz*ddtdy_ds + dtdz*ddtdy_dt);
5727 
5728  metric2ndDer[15] = drdz*ddrdz_dr + dsdz*ddrdz_ds + dtdz*ddrdz_dt;
5729  metric2ndDer[16] = drdz*ddsdz_dr + dsdz*ddsdz_ds + dtdz*ddsdz_dt;
5730  metric2ndDer[17] = drdz*ddtdz_dr + dsdz*ddtdz_ds + dtdz*ddtdz_dt;
5731  }
5732 
5733  break;
5734  }
5735  }
5736  }
5737  }
5738 
5739  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5740  /*--- Step 3: Determine the mass matrix (or its inverse) and/or the ---*/
5741  /*--- lumped mass matrix. ---*/
5742  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5743 
5744  /* Determine the time coefficients in the iteration matrix of the ADER-DG
5745  predictor step. */
5746  if(config->GetKind_TimeIntScheme_Flow() == ADER_DG)
5747  TimeCoefficientsPredictorADER_DG(config);
5748 
5749  /* Define the double vector to define the values of the mass matrix
5750  contributions of the standard element in the integration points. */
5751  vector<vector<su2double> > valMMInt;
5752  valMMInt.resize(standardElementsSol.size());
5753 
5754  /* Loop over the different standard elements. */
5755  for(unsigned long i=0; i<standardElementsSol.size(); ++i) {
5756 
5757  /* Get the required data from the standard element. */
5758  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[i].GetNIntegration();
5759  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsSol[i].GetNDOFs();
5760  const su2double *lag = standardElementsSol[i].GetBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5761  const su2double *w = standardElementsSol[i].GetWeightsIntegration();
5762 
5763  /* Allocate the memory for valMMInt[i]. */
5764  valMMInt[i].resize(nDOFs*nDOFs*nInt);
5765 
5766  /* Create the values of valMMInt[i], which is a matrix of size
5767  nDOFs2XnInt stored in row major order. */
5768  unsigned int ll = 0;
5769  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
5770  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFs; ++j)
5771  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nInt; ++l, ++ll)
5772  valMMInt[i][ll] = w[l]*lag[l*nDOFs+k]*lag[l*nDOFs+j];
5773  }
5774 
5775  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
5776  for(unsigned long i=0; i<nVolElemOwned; ++i) {
5777 
5778  /* Easier storage of the index of the corresponding standard element and
5779  get the necessary information from it. */
5780  const unsigned short ind = volElem[i].indStandardElement;
5781  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5782  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[i].nDOFsSol;
5783  const unsigned int nDOFs2 = nDOFs*nDOFs;
5784  const su2double *valInt = valMMInt[ind].data();
5785 
5786  /* Copy the data of the Jacobian in the integration points in
5787  a separate vector. */
5788  vector<su2double> JacVec(nInt);
5789  su2double *Jac = JacVec.data();
5790 
5791  for(unsigned short l=0; l<nInt; ++l)
5792  Jac[l] = volElem[i].metricTerms[l*nMetricPerPoint];
5793 
5794  /* Allocate the memory for working vector for the construction
5795  of the mass matrix. */
5796  vector<su2double> massMat(nDOFs2);
5797 
5798  /* Create the mass matrix, which is a BLAS gemv operation. */
5799  blasFunctions->gemv(nDOFs2, nInt, valInt, Jac, massMat.data());
5800 
5801  /* Store the full mass matrix in volElem[i], if needed. */
5802  if( FullMassMatrix ) volElem[i].massMatrix = massMat;
5803 
5804  /*--- Check if the lumped mass matrix is needed. ---*/
5805  if( LumpedMassMatrix ) {
5806 
5807  /* Allocate the memory for the lumped mass matrix and initialize them to zero.. */
5808  volElem[i].lumpedMassMatrix.assign(nDOFs, 0.0);
5809 
5810  /* Loop over the DOFs to compute the elements of the local lumped mass
5811  matrix. It is the sum of the absolute values of the row. */
5812  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nDOFs; ++j) {
5813  const su2double *val = massMat.data() + j*nDOFs;
5814  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k)
5815  volElem[i].lumpedMassMatrix[j] += fabs(val[k]);
5816  }
5817  }
5818 
5819  /*--- Check if the inverse of mass matrix is needed. ---*/
5820  if( FullInverseMassMatrix ) {
5821 
5822  /*--- Check if LAPACK/MKL can be used to compute the inverse. ---*/
5823 
5824 #if (defined(HAVE_MKL) || defined(HAVE_LAPACK)) && !(defined(CODI_REVERSE_TYPE) || defined(CODI_FORWARD_TYPE))
5825 
5826  /* The inverse can be computed using the Lapack routines dpotrf
5827  and dpotri. As the mass matrix is positive definite, a
5828  Cholesky decomposition is used, which is much more efficient
5829  than a standard inverse. */
5830  char uplo = 'L';
5831  int NN = nDOFs, errorCode;
5832  dpotrf_(&uplo, &NN, massMat.data(), &NN, &errorCode);
5833  if(errorCode != 0) {
5834  ostringstream message;
5835  if(errorCode < 0) {
5836  message << "Something wrong when calling dpotrf. Error code: "
5837  << errorCode;
5838  }
5839  else {
5840  message << "Mass matrix not positive definite. " << endl;
5841  message << "This is most likely caused by a too low accuracy of the quadrature rule," << endl;
5842  message << "possibly combined with a low quality element." << endl;
5843  message << "Increase the accuracy of the quadrature rule.";
5844  }
5845 
5846  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5847  }
5848 
5849  dpotri_(&uplo, &NN, massMat.data(), &NN, &errorCode);
5850  if(errorCode != 0) {
5851  ostringstream message;
5852  if(errorCode < 0) {
5853  message << "Something wrong when calling dpotri. Error code: "
5854  << errorCode;
5855  }
5856  else {
5857  message << "Mass matrix is singular. " << endl;
5858  message << "The is most likely caused by a too low accuracy of the quadrature rule, " << endl;
5859  message << "possibly combined with a low quality element." << endl;
5860  message << "Increase the accuracy of the quadrature rule.";
5861  }
5862 
5863  SU2_MPI::Error(message.str(), CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5864  }
5865 
5866  /* The Lapack routines for a Cholesky decomposition only store the upper
5867  part of the matrix. Copy the data to the lower part. */
5868  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFs; ++k) {
5869  for(unsigned short j=(k+1); j<nDOFs; ++j) {
5870  massMat[j*nDOFs+k] = massMat[k*nDOFs+j];
5871  }
5872  }
5873 #else
5874  /* No support for Lapack. Hence an internal routine is used.
5875  This does not do all the checking the Lapack routines do. */
5876  CFEMStandardElementBase::InverseMatrix(nDOFs, massMat);
5877 #endif
5878  /* Store the inverse of the mass matrix in volElem[i]. */
5879  volElem[i].invMassMatrix = massMat;
5880  }
5881  }
5882 }
5883 
5884 void CMeshFEM_DG::TimeCoefficientsPredictorADER_DG(CConfig *config) {
5885 
5886  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5887  /*--- Determine the coefficients that appear in the iteration matrix of ---*/
5888  /*--- the prediction step of ADER-DG. ---*/
5889  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5890 
5891  /* Determine the number of time DOFs in the predictor step of ADER as well
5892  as their location on the interval [-1..1]. */
5893  const unsigned short nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
5894  const su2double *TimeDOFs = config->GetTimeDOFsADER_DG();
5895 
5896  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix and its inverse in the time DOFs. */
5897  vector<su2double> rTimeDOFs(nTimeDOFs);
5898  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i) rTimeDOFs[i] = TimeDOFs[i];
5899 
5900  vector<su2double> V(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs);
5901  CFEMStandardElementBase timeElement;
5902  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeDOFs, V);
5903 
5904  vector<su2double> VInv = V;
5905  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, VInv);
5906 
5907  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for r = 1, i.e. the end of the interval. */
5908  vector<su2double> rEnd(1); rEnd[0] = 1.0;
5909  vector<su2double> VEnd(nTimeDOFs);
5910  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rEnd, VEnd);
5911 
5912  /*--- Determine the matrix products VEnd*VInv to get the correct expression
5913  for the values of the Lagrangian interpolation functions for r = 1. ---*/
5914  vector<su2double> lEnd(nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5915  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5916  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k)
5917  lEnd[j] += VEnd[k]*VInv[j*nTimeDOFs+k];
5918  }
5919 
5920  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
5921  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
5922  roundoff. ---*/
5923  su2double val = 0.0;
5924  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) val += lEnd[j];
5925 
5926  if(fabs(val-1.0) > 1.e-6)
5927  SU2_MPI::Error( "Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
5928 
5929  val = 1.0/val;
5930  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) lEnd[j] *= val;
5931 
5932  /*--- Compute the mass matrix in time, which is the inverse of V^T V. Note that
5933  this definition is different from the one used in Hesthaven, because their
5934  V is our V^T. Furthermore note that the mass matrix should be a diagonal
5935  matrix, due to the choice of the DOFs (Gauss Legendre points). ---*/
5936  vector<su2double> MassTime(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5937  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5938  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5939  const unsigned short ji = j*nTimeDOFs + i;
5940  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k)
5941  MassTime[ji] += V[k*nTimeDOFs+j]*V[k*nTimeDOFs+i];
5942  }
5943  }
5944 
5945  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, MassTime);
5946 
5947  /* Compute the gradient of the Vandermonde matrix in the time DOFs. */
5948  vector<su2double> VDr(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs);
5949  timeElement.GradVandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeDOFs, VDr);
5950 
5951  /* Compute the product VDr VInv. Store the result in V. Note that in both
5952  matrices the transpose is stored compared to the definition of Hesthaven. */
5953  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5954  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5955  const unsigned short ji = j*nTimeDOFs + i;
5956  V[ji] = 0.0;
5957  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k)
5958  V[ji] += VDr[k*nTimeDOFs+j]*VInv[i*nTimeDOFs+k];
5959  }
5960  }
5961 
5962  /* Compute the time stiffness matrix S = M Dr. */
5963  vector<su2double> S(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5964  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5965  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i) {
5966  const unsigned short ji = j*nTimeDOFs + i;
5967  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k)
5968  S[ji] += MassTime[j*nTimeDOFs+k]*V[k*nTimeDOFs+i];
5969  }
5970  }
5971 
5972  /* Compute the time coefficients of the iteration matrix in the predictor step. */
5973  timeCoefADER_DG.assign(nTimeDOFs*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
5974  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5975  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
5976  timeCoefADER_DG[j*nTimeDOFs+i] = lEnd[j]*lEnd[i] - S[i*nTimeDOFs+j];
5977  }
5978 
5979  /* Determine the inverse of timeCoefADER_DG, because this is needed in the
5980  iteration matrix of the predictor step of ADER-DG. */
5981  timeElement.InverseMatrix(nTimeDOFs, timeCoefADER_DG);
5982 
5983  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5984  /*--- Determine the interpolation matrix from the time DOFs of ADER-DG ---*/
5985  /*--- to the time integration points. Note that in many cases this ---*/
5986  /*--- interpolation matrix is the identity matrix, i.e. the DOFs and the ---*/
5987  /*--- integration points coincide. ---*/
5988  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5989 
5990  /* Determine the number of time integration points of ADER as well
5991  as their location on the interval [-1..1]. */
5992  unsigned short nTimeIntegrationPoints = config->GetnTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
5993  const su2double *TimeIntegrationPoints = config->GetTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
5994 
5995  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for the time integration points. */
5996  vector<su2double> rTimeIntPoints(nTimeIntegrationPoints);
5997  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i)
5998  rTimeIntPoints[i] = TimeIntegrationPoints[i];
5999 
6000  V.resize(nTimeIntegrationPoints*nTimeDOFs);
6001  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeIntPoints, V);
6002 
6003  /* Allocate the memory for the time interpolation coefficients and initialize
6004  them to zero. */
6005  timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG.assign(nTimeIntegrationPoints*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
6006 
6007  /* Determine the matrix products V*VInv to get the correct expression for
6008  mTimeInterpolDOFToIntegration. Note that from mathematical point of view the
6009  transpose of V*VInv is stored, because in this way the interpolation data
6010  for a time integration point is contiguous in memory. */
6011  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
6012  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
6013  const unsigned short ii = i*nTimeDOFs + j;
6014 
6015  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
6016  const unsigned short indV = k*nTimeIntegrationPoints + i;
6017  const unsigned short indVInv = j*nTimeDOFs + k;
6018 
6019  timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[ii] += V[indV]*VInv[indVInv];
6020  }
6021  }
6022  }
6023 
6024  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
6025  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
6026  roundoff. ---*/
6027  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++j) {
6028  const unsigned short jj = j*nTimeDOFs;
6029 
6030  val = 0.0;
6031  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
6032  val += timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj+i];
6033 
6034  if(fabs(val-1.0) > 1.e-6)
6035  SU2_MPI::Error( "Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6036 
6037  val = 1.0/val;
6038  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
6039  timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj+i] *= val;
6040  }
6041 
6042  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6043  /*--- Determine the interpolation matrix from the time DOFs of ADER-DG ---*/
6044  /*--- of adjacent elements of a higher time level to the time ---*/
6045  /*--- integration points. ---*/
6046  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6047 
6048  /* Determine the location of the time integration points from the
6049  perspective of an adjacent element with twice the time step. Note that
6050  the time step of this adjacent element covers two fine time steps and
6051  hence the number of integration points double and the position is
6052  determined via the transformation xxi = 0.5(xi-1) and xi varies between
6053  -1 and 3. */
6054  rTimeIntPoints.resize(2*nTimeIntegrationPoints);
6055  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i)
6056  rTimeIntPoints[i] = 0.5*(TimeIntegrationPoints[i]-1.0);
6057 
6058  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
6059  const unsigned short ii = i + nTimeIntegrationPoints;
6060  rTimeIntPoints[ii] = 0.5*(TimeIntegrationPoints[i]+1.0);
6061  }
6062 
6063  nTimeIntegrationPoints *= 2;
6064 
6065  /* Compute the Vandermonde matrix for these time integration points. */
6066  V.resize(nTimeIntegrationPoints*nTimeDOFs);
6067  timeElement.Vandermonde1D(nTimeDOFs, rTimeIntPoints, V);
6068 
6069  /* Allocate the memory for the time interpolation coefficients and initialize
6070  them to zero. */
6071  timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG.assign(nTimeIntegrationPoints*nTimeDOFs, 0.0);
6072 
6073  /* Determine the matrix products V*VInv to get the correct expression for
6074  mTimeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegration. Note that from mathematical point of view
6075  the transpose of V*VInv is stored, because in this way the interpolation
6076  data for a time integration point is contiguous in memory. */
6077  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
6078  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++i) {
6079  const unsigned short ii = i*nTimeDOFs + j;
6080 
6081  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nTimeDOFs; ++k) {
6082  const unsigned short indV = k*nTimeIntegrationPoints + i;
6083  const unsigned short indVInv = j*nTimeDOFs + k;
6084 
6085  timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[ii] += V[indV]*VInv[indVInv];
6086  }
6087  }
6088  }
6089 
6090  /*--- To reduce the error due to round off, make sure that the row sum is 1.
6091  Also check if the difference is not too large to be solely caused by
6092  roundoff. ---*/
6093  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeIntegrationPoints; ++j) {
6094  const unsigned short jj = j*nTimeDOFs;
6095 
6096  val = 0.0;
6097  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
6098  val += timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj+i];
6099 
6100  if(fabs(val-1.0) > 1.e-6)
6101  SU2_MPI::Error( "Difference is too large to be caused by roundoff", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6102 
6103  val = 1.0/val;
6104  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nTimeDOFs; ++i)
6105  timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG[jj+i] *= val;
6106  }
6107 }
6108 
6109 void CMeshFEM_DG::VolumeMetricTermsFromCoorGradients(
6110  const unsigned short nEntities,
6111  const su2double *gradCoor,
6112  vector<su2double> &metricTerms) {
6113 
6114  /*--- Convert the dxdr, dydr, etc., stored in coorGradients, to the
6115  required metric terms. Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. ---*/
6116  switch( nDim ) {
6117  case 2: {
6118 
6119  /* 2D computation. Store the offset between the r and s derivatives. */
6120  const unsigned short off = 2*nEntities;
6121 
6122  /* Loop over the entities and store the metric terms. */
6123  unsigned short ii = 0;
6124  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nEntities; ++j) {
6125  const unsigned short jx = 2*j; const unsigned short jy = jx+1;
6126  const su2double dxdr = gradCoor[jx], dydr = gradCoor[jy];
6127  const su2double dxds = gradCoor[jx+off], dyds = gradCoor[jy+off];
6128 
6129  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr*dyds - dxds*dydr; // J
6130  metricTerms[ii++] = dyds; // J drdx
6131  metricTerms[ii++] = -dxds; // J drdy
6132  metricTerms[ii++] = -dydr; // J dsdx
6133  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr; // J dsdy
6134  }
6135 
6136  break;
6137  }
6138 
6139  case 3: {
6140  /* 3D computation. Store the offset between the r and s and r and t derivatives. */
6141  unsigned short offS = 3*nEntities, offT = 6*nEntities;
6142 
6143  /* Loop over the entities and store the metric terms. */
6144  unsigned short ii = 0;
6145  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nEntities; ++j) {
6146  const unsigned short jx = 3*j; const unsigned short jy = jx+1, jz = jx+2;
6147  const su2double dxdr = gradCoor[jx], dydr = gradCoor[jy], dzdr = gradCoor[jz];
6148  const su2double dxds = gradCoor[jx+offS], dyds = gradCoor[jy+offS], dzds = gradCoor[jz+offS];
6149  const su2double dxdt = gradCoor[jx+offT], dydt = gradCoor[jy+offT], dzdt = gradCoor[jz+offT];
6150 
6151  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr*(dyds*dzdt - dzds*dydt)
6152  - dxds*(dydr*dzdt - dzdr*dydt)
6153  + dxdt*(dydr*dzds - dzdr*dyds); // J
6154 
6155  metricTerms[ii++] = dyds*dzdt - dzds*dydt; // J drdx
6156  metricTerms[ii++] = dzds*dxdt - dxds*dzdt; // J drdy
6157  metricTerms[ii++] = dxds*dydt - dyds*dxdt; // J drdz
6158 
6159  metricTerms[ii++] = dzdr*dydt - dydr*dzdt; // J dsdx
6160  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr*dzdt - dzdr*dxdt; // J dsdy
6161  metricTerms[ii++] = dydr*dxdt - dxdr*dydt; // J dsdz
6162 
6163  metricTerms[ii++] = dydr*dzds - dzdr*dyds; // J dtdx
6164  metricTerms[ii++] = dzdr*dxds - dxdr*dzds; // J dtdy
6165  metricTerms[ii++] = dxdr*dyds - dydr*dxds; // J dtdz
6166  }
6167 
6168  break;
6169  }
6170  }
6171 }
6172 
6173 void CMeshFEM_DG::WallFunctionPreprocessing(CConfig *config) {
6174 
6175  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6176  /*--- Step 1: Check whether wall functions are used at all. ---*/
6177  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6178 
6179  bool wallFunctions = false;
6180  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
6181 
6182  switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
6183  case ISOTHERMAL:
6184  case HEAT_FLUX: {
6185  const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
6186  if(config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != NO_WALL_FUNCTION)
6187  wallFunctions = true;
6188  break;
6189  }
6190  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6191  break;
6192  }
6193  }
6194 
6195  /* If no wall functions are used, nothing needs to be done and a
6196  return can be made. */
6197  if( !wallFunctions ) return;
6198 
6199  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6200  /*--- Step 2. Build the local ADT of the volume elements. The halo ---*/
6201  /*--- elements are included such that also direct neighbors are ---*/
6202  /*--- guaranteed to be found as donor element. Note that the ADT ---*/
6203  /*--- is built with the linear subelements. This is done to ---*/
6204  /*--- avoid relatively many expensive Newton solves for high ---*/
6205  /*--- order elements. ---*/
6206  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6207 
6208  /* Define the vectors, which store the mapping from the subelement to the
6209  parent element, subelement ID within the parent element, the element
6210  type and the connectivity of the subelements. */
6211  vector<unsigned long> parentElement;
6212  vector<unsigned short> subElementIDInParent;
6213  vector<unsigned short> VTK_TypeElem;
6214  vector<unsigned long> elemConn;
6215 
6216  /* Loop over the locally stored volume elements (including halo elements)
6217  to create the connectivity of the subelements. */
6218  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemTot; ++l) {
6219 
6220  /* Determine the necessary data from the corresponding standard element. */
6221  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
6222 
6223  unsigned short VTK_Type[] = {standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type1(),
6224  standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type2()};
6225  unsigned short nSubElems[] = {0, 0};
6226  unsigned short nDOFsPerSubElem[] = {0, 0};
6227  const unsigned short *connSubElems[] = {NULL, NULL};
6228 
6229  if(VTK_Type[0] != NONE) {
6230  nSubElems[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType1();
6231  nDOFsPerSubElem[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFsPerSubElem(VTK_Type[0]);
6232  connSubElems[0] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType1();
6233  }
6234 
6235  if(VTK_Type[1] != NONE) {
6236  nSubElems[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType2();
6237  nDOFsPerSubElem[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFsPerSubElem(VTK_Type[1]);
6238  connSubElems[1] = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType2();
6239  }
6240 
6241  /* Abbreviate the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
6242  const unsigned long *DOFs = volElem[l].nodeIDsGrid.data();
6243 
6244  /* Loop over the number of subelements and store the required data. */
6245  unsigned short jj = 0;
6246  for(unsigned short i=0; i<2; ++i) {
6247  unsigned short kk = 0;
6248  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nSubElems[i]; ++j, ++jj) {
6249  parentElement.push_back(l);
6250  subElementIDInParent.push_back(jj);
6251  VTK_TypeElem.push_back(VTK_Type[i]);
6252 
6253  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDOFsPerSubElem[i]; ++k, ++kk)
6254  elemConn.push_back(DOFs[connSubElems[i][kk]]);
6255  }
6256  }
6257  }
6258 
6259  /* Copy the coordinates in a vector that can be used by the ADT. */
6260  vector<su2double> volCoor;
6261  volCoor.reserve(nDim*meshPoints.size());
6262 
6263  for(unsigned long l=0; l<meshPoints.size(); ++l) {
6264  for(unsigned short k=0; k<nDim; ++k)
6265  volCoor.push_back(meshPoints[l].coor[k]);
6266  }
6267 
6268  /* Build the local ADT. */
6269  CADTElemClass localVolumeADT(nDim, volCoor, elemConn, VTK_TypeElem,
6270  subElementIDInParent, parentElement, false);
6271 
6272  /* Release the memory of the vectors used to build the ADT. To make sure
6273  that all the memory is deleted, the swap function is used. */
6274  vector<unsigned short>().swap(subElementIDInParent);
6275  vector<unsigned short>().swap(VTK_TypeElem);
6276  vector<unsigned long>().swap(parentElement);
6277  vector<unsigned long>().swap(elemConn);
6278  vector<su2double>().swap(volCoor);
6279 
6280  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6281  /*--- Step 3. Search for donor elements at the exchange locations in ---*/
6282  /*--- the local elements. ---*/
6283  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6284 
6285  /* Loop over the markers and select the ones for which a wall function
6286  treatment must be carried out. */
6287  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
6288 
6289  switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
6290  case ISOTHERMAL:
6291  case HEAT_FLUX: {
6292  const string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
6293  if(config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) != NO_WALL_FUNCTION) {
6294 
6295  /* An LES wall model is used for this boundary marker. Determine
6296  which wall model and allocate the memory for the member variable. */
6297  switch (config->GetWallFunction_Treatment(Marker_Tag) ) {
6298  case EQUILIBRIUM_WALL_MODEL: {
6299  if(rank == MASTER_NODE)
6300  cout << "Marker " << Marker_Tag << " uses an Equilibrium Wall Model." << endl;
6301 
6302  boundaries[iMarker].wallModel = new CWallModel1DEQ;
6303  break;
6304  }
6305  case LOGARITHMIC_WALL_MODEL: {
6306  if(rank == MASTER_NODE)
6307  cout << "Marker " << Marker_Tag << " uses a Logarithmic law-of-the-wall Model." << endl;
6308 
6309  boundaries[iMarker].wallModel = new CWallModelLogLaw;
6310  break;
6311  }
6312  default: {
6313  SU2_MPI::Error("Wall function not present yet", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6314  }
6315  }
6316 
6317  /* Retrieve the integer and floating point information for this
6318  boundary marker. The exchange location is the first element of
6319  the floating point array. */
6320  const unsigned short *intInfo = config->GetWallFunction_IntInfo(Marker_Tag);
6321  const su2double *doubleInfo = config->GetWallFunction_DoubleInfo(Marker_Tag);
6322 
6323  /* Initialize the wall model. */
6324  boundaries[iMarker].wallModel->Initialize(intInfo, doubleInfo);
6325 
6326  /* Easier storage of the surface elements and loop over them. */
6327  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
6328  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6329 
6330  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
6331  relevant information from it. Note that the standard element
6332  of the solution must be taken and not of the grid. */
6333  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6334  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6335 
6336  /* Allocate the memory for the memory to store the donors and
6337  the parametric weights. The donor elements are stored in an
6338  CUnsignedLong2T, such that they can be sorted. */
6339  vector<CUnsignedLong2T> donorElements(nInt);
6340  vector<su2double> parCoorInDonor(nInt*nDim);
6341 
6342  /* Loop over the integration points. */
6343  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6344 
6345  /* Easier storage of the normals and coordinates of this
6346  integration point. */
6347  const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data()
6348  + i*(nDim+1);
6349  const su2double *Coord = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data()
6350  + i*nDim;
6351 
6352  /* Determine the coordinates of the exchange location. Note that the normals
6353  point out of the domain, so the normals must be subtracted. */
6354  su2double coorExchange[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0}; // To avoid a compiler warning.
6355  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6356  coorExchange[iDim] = Coord[iDim] - doubleInfo[0]*normals[iDim];
6357 
6358  /* Search for the element, which contains the exchange location. */
6359  unsigned short subElem;
6360  unsigned long parElem;
6361  int rank;
6362  su2double parCoor[3], weightsInterpol[8];
6363  if( localVolumeADT.DetermineContainingElement(coorExchange, subElem,
6364  parElem, rank, parCoor,
6365  weightsInterpol) ) {
6366 
6367  /* Subelement found that contains the exchange location. However,
6368  what is needed is the location in the high order parent element.
6369  Determine this. */
6370  HighOrderContainmentSearch(coorExchange, parElem, subElem,
6371  weightsInterpol, parCoor);
6372 
6373  /* Store the info in donorElements and parCoorInDonor. */
6374  donorElements[i].long0 = parElem;
6375  donorElements[i].long1 = i;
6376  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6377  parCoorInDonor[nDim*i+iDim] = parCoor[iDim];
6378  }
6379  else {
6380 
6381  /* No subelement found that contains the exchange location.
6382  The partitioning is done such that this should not happen.
6383  Print an error message and exit. */
6384  SU2_MPI::Error("Exchange location not found in ADT",
6385  CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6386  }
6387  }
6388 
6389  /* Sort donorElements in increasing order, such that the
6390  integration points with the same donor are grouped together. */
6391  sort(donorElements.begin(), donorElements.end());
6392 
6393  /* Store the donor information in the member variables of surfElem. */
6394  surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.push_back(donorElements[0].long0);
6395  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(0);
6396  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor.resize(nInt);
6397  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[0] = donorElements[0].long1;
6398 
6399  for(unsigned short i=1; i<nInt; ++i) {
6400  if(donorElements[i].long0 != surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.back()) {
6401  surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.push_back(donorElements[i].long0);
6402  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(i);
6403  }
6404  surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[i] = donorElements[i].long1;
6405  }
6406 
6407  surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor.push_back(nInt);
6408 
6409  /* Determine whether or not halo information is needed to apply
6410  the boundary conditions for this surface. If needed, set
6411  haloInfoNeededForBC of the boundary to true. As DonorsWallFunction
6412  is sorted in increasing order, it suffices to check the last element. */
6413  if(surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.back() >= nVolElemOwned)
6414  boundaries[iMarker].haloInfoNeededForBC = true;
6415 
6416  /* Allocate the memory of the first index of the interpolation
6417  matrices for the donordata. */
6418  surfElem[l].matWallFunctionDonor.resize(surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.size());
6419 
6420  /* Loop over the different donors for the wall function data. */
6421  for(unsigned long j=0; j<surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction.size(); ++j) {
6422 
6423  /* Easier storage of the donor and the vector for the
6424  interpolation data for this donor. */
6425  const unsigned long donor = surfElem[l].donorsWallFunction[j];
6426  vector<su2double> &matDonor = surfElem[l].matWallFunctionDonor[j];
6427 
6428  /* Determine the number of DOFs in the donor element. Note that
6429  the standard element of the solution must be used for this
6430  purpose. */
6431  const unsigned short ind = volElem[donor].indStandardElement;
6432  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNDOFs();
6433 
6434  /* Allocate the memory for the vector used to compute the
6435  Lagrangian interpolation functions in the parametric coordinates,
6436  i.e. the interpolation weights, and for matDonor, which stores
6437  all these weights. */
6438  const unsigned short nIntThisDonor = surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j+1]
6439  - surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j];
6440  vector<su2double> lagBasis(nDOFs);
6441  matDonor.reserve(nIntThisDonor*nDOFs);
6442 
6443  /* Loop over the integration points for this donor element. */
6444  for(unsigned short i=surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j];
6445  i<surfElem[l].nIntPerWallFunctionDonor[j+1]; ++i) {
6446 
6447  /* Determine the pointer to the parametric coordinates of the
6448  donor point of this integration point. */
6449  const unsigned short ii = surfElem[l].intPerWallFunctionDonor[i];
6450  const su2double *parCoor = parCoorInDonor.data() + ii*nDim;
6451 
6452  /* Determine the interpolation weights for this point and
6453  store it in matDonor. */
6454  standardElementsSol[ind].BasisFunctionsInPoint(parCoor, lagBasis);
6455  matDonor.insert(matDonor.end(), lagBasis.begin(), lagBasis.end());
6456  }
6457  }
6458  }
6459  }
6460 
6461  break;
6462  }
6463  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6464  break;
6465  }
6466  }
6467 }
6468 
6469 void CMeshFEM_DG::HighOrderContainmentSearch(const su2double *coor,
6470  const unsigned long parElem,
6471  const unsigned short subElem,
6472  const su2double *weightsSubElem,
6473  su2double *parCoor) {
6474 
6475  /* Definition of the maximum number of iterations in the Newton solver
6476  and the tolerance level. */
6477  const unsigned short maxIt = 50;
6478  const su2double tolNewton = 1.e-10;
6479 
6480  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6481  /* Step 1: Create an initial guess for the parametric coordinates from */
6482  /* interpolation in the linear sub-element of the parent element. */
6483  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6484 
6485  /* Abbreviate the index in the standard element a bit easier. */
6486  const unsigned short ind = volElem[parElem].indStandardElement;
6487 
6488  /* Define the variables to store the number of DOFs and the connectivity
6489  of the sub element in which the given coordinate resides. */
6490  unsigned short nDOFsPerSubElem = 0;
6491  const unsigned short *connSubElems;
6492 
6493  /* Check if the sub element is of the first sub-element type. */
6494  const unsigned short nSubElemType1 = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNSubElemsType1();
6495  if(subElem < nSubElemType1) {
6496 
6497  /* Determine the element type and set nDOFsPerSubElem. */
6498  switch( standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type1() ) {
6499  case TRIANGLE: nDOFsPerSubElem = 3; break;
6500  case QUADRILATERAL: nDOFsPerSubElem = 4; break;
6501  case TETRAHEDRON: nDOFsPerSubElem = 4; break;
6502  case PYRAMID: nDOFsPerSubElem = 5; break;
6503  case PRISM: nDOFsPerSubElem = 6; break;
6504  case HEXAHEDRON: nDOFsPerSubElem = 8; break;
6505  default: break; /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6506  }
6507 
6508  /* Set the connectivity for the correct subelement. */
6509  connSubElems = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType1()
6510  + subElem*nDOFsPerSubElem;
6511  }
6512  else {
6513 
6514  /* The sub-element is of the second sub-element type. Determine the
6515  element type and set nDOFsPerSubElem. */
6516  switch( standardElementsGrid[ind].GetVTK_Type2() ) {
6517  case TRIANGLE: nDOFsPerSubElem = 3; break;
6518  case QUADRILATERAL: nDOFsPerSubElem = 4; break;
6519  case TETRAHEDRON: nDOFsPerSubElem = 4; break;
6520  case PYRAMID: nDOFsPerSubElem = 5; break;
6521  case PRISM: nDOFsPerSubElem = 6; break;
6522  case HEXAHEDRON: nDOFsPerSubElem = 8; break;
6523  default: break; /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6524  }
6525 
6526  /* Set the connectivity for the correct subelement. */
6527  connSubElems = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSubConnType2()
6528  + (subElem-nSubElemType1)*nDOFsPerSubElem;
6529  }
6530 
6531  /* Get the parametric coordinates of the DOFs from the standard element. */
6532  const vector<su2double> *locDOFs[] = {standardElementsGrid[ind].GetRDOFs(),
6533  standardElementsGrid[ind].GetSDOFs(),
6534  standardElementsGrid[ind].GetTDOFs()};
6535 
6536  /* Create the initial guess of the parametric coordinates by interpolation
6537  in the sub-element. */
6538  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim) {
6539  parCoor[iDim] = 0.0;
6540  const su2double *coorDOFs = locDOFs[iDim]->data();
6541  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsPerSubElem; ++i)
6542  parCoor[iDim] += weightsSubElem[i]*coorDOFs[connSubElems[i]];
6543  }
6544 
6545  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6546  /* Step 2: The Newton algorithm to compute the parametric coordinates in */
6547  /* the high order element. */
6548  /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6549 
6550  /* Determine the number of DOFs of the standard element and allocate the
6551  memory to store the basis functions and its derivatives. */
6552  const unsigned short nDOFs = standardElementsGrid[ind].GetNDOFs();
6553 
6554  vector<su2double> lagBasis(nDOFs);
6555  vector<vector<su2double> > dLagBasis(nDim, vector<su2double>(nDOFs));
6556 
6557  /* Abbreviate the grid DOFs of this element a bit easier. */
6558  const unsigned long *DOFs = volElem[parElem].nodeIDsGrid.data();
6559 
6560  /* Loop over the maximum number of iterations. */
6561  unsigned short itCount;
6562  for(itCount=0; itCount<maxIt; ++itCount) {
6563 
6564  /* Compute the Lagrangian basis functions and its derivatives in
6565  the current parametric coordinate. */
6566  standardElementsGrid[ind].BasisFunctionsAndDerivativesInPoint(parCoor, lagBasis,
6567  dLagBasis);
6568 
6569  /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D in order to have the most
6570  efficient code. */
6571  bool converged = false;
6572  switch( nDim ) {
6573  case 2: {
6574  /* Two dimensional computation. Compute the values of the function
6575  and minus the Jacobian matrix. */
6576  su2double f0 = coor[0], f1 = coor[1];
6577  su2double a00 = 0.0, a01 = 0.0, a10 = 0.0, a11 = 0.0;
6578  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6579  const su2double x = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[0];
6580  const su2double y = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[1];
6581 
6582  f0 -= x*lagBasis[i]; f1 -= y*lagBasis[i];
6583 
6584  a00 += x*dLagBasis[0][i]; a01 += x*dLagBasis[1][i];
6585  a10 += y*dLagBasis[0][i]; a11 += y*dLagBasis[1][i];
6586  }
6587 
6588  /* Compute the updates of the parametric values. As minus the
6589  Jacobian is computed, the updates should be added to parCoor. */
6590  const su2double detInv = 1.0/(a00*a11 - a01*a10);
6591  const su2double dr = detInv*(f0*a11 - f1*a01);
6592  const su2double ds = detInv*(f1*a00 - f0*a10);
6593 
6594  parCoor[0] += dr;
6595  parCoor[1] += ds;
6596 
6597  /* Check for convergence. */
6598  if(fabs(dr) <= tolNewton && fabs(ds) <= tolNewton) converged = true;
6599  break;
6600  }
6601 
6602  case 3: {
6603  /* Three dimensional computation. Compute the values of the function
6604  and minus the Jacobian matrix. */
6605  su2double f0 = coor[0], f1 = coor[1], f2 = coor[2];
6606  su2double a00 = 0.0, a01 = 0.0, a02 = 0.0;
6607  su2double a10 = 0.0, a11 = 0.0, a12 = 0.0;
6608  su2double a20 = 0.0, a21 = 0.0, a22 = 0.0;
6609 
6610  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6611  const su2double x = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[0];
6612  const su2double y = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[1];
6613  const su2double z = meshPoints[DOFs[i]].coor[2];
6614 
6615  f0 -= x*lagBasis[i]; f1 -= y*lagBasis[i]; f2 -= z*lagBasis[i];
6616 
6617  a00 += x*dLagBasis[0][i]; a01 += x*dLagBasis[1][i]; a02 += x*dLagBasis[2][i];
6618  a10 += y*dLagBasis[0][i]; a11 += y*dLagBasis[1][i]; a12 += y*dLagBasis[2][i];
6619  a20 += z*dLagBasis[0][i]; a21 += z*dLagBasis[1][i]; a22 += z*dLagBasis[2][i];
6620  }
6621 
6622  /* Compute the updates of the parametric values. As minus the
6623  Jacobian is computed, the updates should be added to parCoor. */
6624  const su2double detInv = 1.0/(a00*a11*a22 - a00*a12*a21 - a01*a10*a22
6625  + a01*a12*a20 + a02*a10*a21 - a02*a11*a20);
6626  const su2double dr = detInv*(a01*a12*f2 - a01*a22*f1 - a02*a11*f2
6627  + a02*a21*f1 + a11*a22*f0 - a12*a21*f0);
6628  const su2double ds = -detInv*(a00*a12*f2 - a00*a22*f1 - a02*a10*f2
6629  + a02*a20*f1 + a10*a22*f0 - a12*a20*f0);
6630  const su2double dt = detInv*(a00*a11*f2 - a00*a21*f1 - a01*a10*f2
6631  + a01*a20*f1 + a10*a21*f0 - a11*a20*f0);
6632  parCoor[0] += dr;
6633  parCoor[1] += ds;
6634  parCoor[2] += dt;
6635 
6636  /* Check for convergence. */
6637  if(fabs(dr) <= tolNewton && fabs(ds) <= tolNewton && fabs(dt) <= tolNewton)
6638  converged = true;
6639  break;
6640  }
6641  }
6642 
6643  /* Break the loop if the Newton algorithm converged. */
6644  if( converged ) break;
6645  }
6646 
6647  /* Terminate if the Newton algorithm did not converge. */
6648  if(itCount == maxIt)
6649  SU2_MPI::Error("Newton did not converge", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6650 }
6651 
6652 void CMeshFEM_DG::InitStaticMeshMovement(CConfig *config,
6653  const unsigned short Kind_Grid_Movement,
6654  const unsigned short iZone) {
6655 
6656  /*--- Get the reference values for the non-dimensionalization of the
6657  prescribed velocities. ---*/
6658  const su2double L_Ref = config->GetLength_Ref();
6659  const su2double Omega_Ref = config->GetOmega_Ref();
6660  const su2double Vel_Ref = config->GetVelocity_Ref();
6661 
6662  /*--- Make a distinction between the possibilities. ---*/
6663  switch( Kind_Grid_Movement ) {
6664 
6665  case MOVING_WALL: {
6666 
6667  /*--- Loop over the physical boundaries. Skip the periodic boundaries. ---*/
6668  for(unsigned short i=0; i<boundaries.size(); ++i) {
6669  if( !boundaries[i].periodicBoundary ) {
6670 
6671  /* Check if for this boundary a motion has been specified. */
6672  if (config->GetMarker_All_Moving(i) == YES) {
6673 
6674  /* Determine the prescribed translation velocity, rotation rate
6675  and rotation center. */
6676  const unsigned short jMarker = config->GetMarker_Moving(boundaries[i].markerTag);
6677  const su2double Center[] = {config->GetMotion_Origin_X(jMarker),
6678  config->GetMotion_Origin_Y(jMarker),
6679  config->GetMotion_Origin_Z(jMarker)};
6680  const su2double Omega[] = {config->GetRotation_Rate_X(jMarker)/Omega_Ref,
6681  config->GetRotation_Rate_Y(jMarker)/Omega_Ref,
6682  config->GetRotation_Rate_Z(jMarker)/Omega_Ref};
6683  const su2double vTrans[] = {config->GetTranslation_Rate_X(jMarker)/Vel_Ref,
6684  config->GetTranslation_Rate_Y(jMarker)/Vel_Ref,
6685  config->GetTranslation_Rate_Z(jMarker)/Vel_Ref};
6686 
6687  /* Easier storage of the surface elements and loop over them. */
6688  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[i].surfElem;
6689 
6690  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6691 
6692  /* Determine the corresponding standard face element and get the
6693  relevant information from it. Note that the standard element
6694  of the solution must be taken and not of the grid. */
6695  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6696  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6697 
6698  /* Loop over the number of integration points. */
6699  for(unsigned short j=0; j<nInt; ++j) {
6700 
6701  /* Set the pointers for the coordinates and grid velocities
6702  for this integration points. */
6703  const su2double *Coord = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + j*nDim;
6704  su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + j*nDim;
6705 
6706  /* Calculate non-dim. position from rotation center. */
6707  su2double r[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6708  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6709  r[iDim] = (Coord[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6710 
6711  /* Cross Product of angular velocity and distance from center to
6712  get the rotational velocity. Note that we are adding on the
6713  velocity due to pure translation as well. Note that for the
6714  2D case only Omega[2] can be non-zero. */
6715  su2double velGrid[] = {vTrans[0] + Omega[1]*r[2] - Omega[2]*r[1],
6716  vTrans[1] + Omega[2]*r[0] - Omega[0]*r[2],
6717  vTrans[2] + Omega[0]*r[1] - Omega[1]*r[0]};
6718 
6719  /* Store the grid velocities. */
6720  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6721  gridVel[iDim] = velGrid[iDim];
6722  }
6723  }
6724  }
6725  }
6726  }
6727 
6728  break;
6729  }
6730 
6731  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6732 
6733  case ROTATING_FRAME: {
6734 
6735  /* Get the rotation rate and rotation center from config. */
6736  const su2double Center[] = {config->GetMotion_Origin_X(iZone),
6737  config->GetMotion_Origin_Y(iZone),
6738  config->GetMotion_Origin_Z(iZone)};
6739  const su2double Omega[] = {config->GetRotation_Rate_X(iZone)/Omega_Ref,
6740  config->GetRotation_Rate_Y(iZone)/Omega_Ref,
6741  config->GetRotation_Rate_Z(iZone)/Omega_Ref};
6742 
6743  /* Array used to store the distance to the rotation center. */
6744  su2double dist[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6745 
6746  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
6747  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
6748 
6749  /* Get the number of DOFs and integration points for this element. */
6750  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
6751  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6752  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
6753 
6754  /* Determine the grid velocities in the integration points. */
6755  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6756  const su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
6757  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6758 
6759  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6760  dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6761 
6762  gridVel[0] = Omega[1]*dist[2] - Omega[2]*dist[1];
6763  gridVel[1] = Omega[2]*dist[0] - Omega[0]*dist[2];
6764  if(nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0]*dist[1] - Omega[1]*dist[0];
6765  }
6766 
6767  /* Determine the grid velocities in the solution DOFs. */
6768  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6769  const su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
6770  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
6771 
6772  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6773  dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6774 
6775  gridVel[0] = Omega[1]*dist[2] - Omega[2]*dist[1];
6776  gridVel[1] = Omega[2]*dist[0] - Omega[0]*dist[2];
6777  if(nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0]*dist[1] - Omega[1]*dist[0];
6778  }
6779  }
6780 
6781  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
6782  for(unsigned long l=0; l<matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
6783 
6784  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6785  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
6786  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6787 
6788  /* Determine the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6789  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6790  const su2double *coor = matchingFaces[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
6791  su2double *gridVel = matchingFaces[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6792 
6793  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6794  dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6795 
6796  gridVel[0] = Omega[1]*dist[2] - Omega[2]*dist[1];
6797  gridVel[1] = Omega[2]*dist[0] - Omega[0]*dist[2];
6798  if(nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0]*dist[1] - Omega[1]*dist[0];
6799  }
6800  }
6801 
6802  /* Loop over the physical boundaries. Exclude periodic boundaries. */
6803  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
6804  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
6805 
6806  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
6807  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
6808 
6809  /* Check if this is a shroud boundary. */
6810  bool shroudBoundary = false;
6811  for(unsigned short iShroud=0; iShroud<config->GetnMarker_Shroud(); ++iShroud) {
6812  if(boundaries[iMarker].markerTag == config->GetMarker_Shroud(iShroud)) {
6813  shroudBoundary = true;
6814  break;
6815  }
6816  }
6817 
6818  /* Loop over the boundary faces of this marker. */
6819  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6820 
6821  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6822  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6823  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
6824 
6825  /* For a shroud boundary the grid velocities must be set to zero. */
6826  if( shroudBoundary ) {
6827  for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nInt*nDim); ++i)
6828  surfElem[l].gridVelocities[i] = 0.0;
6829  }
6830  else {
6831 
6832  /* Normal boundary. Determine the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6833  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6834  const su2double *coor = surfElem[l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
6835  su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6836 
6837  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6838  dist[iDim] = (coor[iDim]-Center[iDim])/L_Ref;
6839 
6840  gridVel[0] = Omega[1]*dist[2] - Omega[2]*dist[1];
6841  gridVel[1] = Omega[2]*dist[0] - Omega[0]*dist[2];
6842  if(nDim == 3) gridVel[2] = Omega[0]*dist[1] - Omega[1]*dist[0];
6843  }
6844  }
6845  }
6846  }
6847  }
6848 
6849  break;
6850  }
6851 
6852  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6853 
6854  case STEADY_TRANSLATION: {
6855 
6856  /* Get the translation velocity from config. */
6857  su2double vTrans[] = {config->GetTranslation_Rate_X(iZone)/Vel_Ref,
6858  config->GetTranslation_Rate_Y(iZone)/Vel_Ref,
6859  config->GetTranslation_Rate_Z(iZone)/Vel_Ref};
6860 
6861  /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
6862  for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
6863 
6864  /* Get the number of DOFs and integration points for this element. */
6865  const unsigned short ind = volElem[l].indStandardElement;
6866  const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6867  const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
6868 
6869  /* Set the grid velocity in both the integration points and
6870  the sol DOFs. */
6871  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6872  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6873  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6874  gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6875  }
6876 
6877  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6878  su2double *gridVel = volElem[l].gridVelocitiesSolDOFs.data() + i*nDim;
6879  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6880  gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6881  }
6882  }
6883 
6884  /* Loop over the internal matching faces. */
6885  for(unsigned long l=0; l<matchingFaces.size(); ++l) {
6886 
6887  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6888  const unsigned short ind = matchingFaces[l].indStandardElement;
6889  const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6890 
6891  /* Set the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6892  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6893  su2double *gridVel = matchingFaces[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6894  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6895  gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6896  }
6897  }
6898 
6899  /* Loop over the physical boundaries. Exclude periodic boundaries. */
6900  for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<boundaries.size(); ++iMarker) {
6901  if( !boundaries[iMarker].periodicBoundary ) {
6902 
6903  /* Abbreviate the surface elements a bit easier. */
6904  vector<CSurfaceElementFEM> &surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem;
6905 
6906  /* Loop over the boundary faces of this marker. */
6907  for(unsigned long l=0; l<surfElem.size(); ++l) {
6908 
6909  /* Get the number of integration points. */
6910  const unsigned short ind = surfElem[l].indStandardElement;
6911  const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesGrid[ind].GetNIntegration();
6912 
6913  /* Set the grid velocity in the integration points. */
6914  for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6915  su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6916  for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6917  gridVel[iDim] = vTrans[iDim];
6918  }
6919  }
6920  }
6921  }
6922 
6923  break;
6924  }
6925 
6926  /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6927 
6928  default: /* Just to avoid a compiler warning. */
6929  break;
6930  }
6931 }
